original: gnas ma mthong ba'i don bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa gdab par sems pa ni 'on te gnyis med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ma mthong ba'i don bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa gdab par sems pa ni 'on te gnyis med ces bya ba'o //
translated: Having set forth the meaning of not seeing a location, etc., the thought to repudiate the next world is ‚ÄúBut if there is no duality.‚Äù

original: 'di yang ni 'jig rten 'di yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang ni 'jig rten 'di yang ngo //
translated: And this is the next world.

original: 'di ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum ste /
translated: This is direct perception.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la ltos nas rang rig pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la ltos nas rang rig pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: In relation to the next world, there is not only self-awareness,

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten 'di la ltos nas kyang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten 'di la ltos nas kyang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but also in relation to this world. This is the meaning.

original: 'jig rten gnyi ga'i 'bras bu med par smra ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyi ga'i 'bras bu med par smra ba la /
translated: In regard to the statement that the result of both worlds does not exist,

original: ches shin tu med pa can yin pa'i phyir ji ltar med pa la yang med pa nyid yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ches shin tu med pa can yin pa'i phyir ji ltar med pa la yang med pa nyid yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can nonexistence be nonexistence?

original: sems ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it is said: ‚ÄúThe mind.‚Äù

original: thams cad las ni dor bya dang blang bya las so //
analyzed: thams cad las ni dor bya dang blang bya las so //
translated: From everything, from what is to be rejected and what is to be accepted.

original: spang phyir ni nye bar bsdus pa'i phyir te bya ba nus pa'o //
analyzed: spang phyir ni nye bar bsdus pa'i phyir te bya ba nus pa'o //
translated: In order to abandon, in order to include, in order to be able to act.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rang rig pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa la grol ba nyid de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rang rig pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa la grol ba nyid de /
translated: For that reason, in the teaching of self-awareness, there is liberation.

original: sems thar pa thob pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod pa ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems thar pa thob pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod pa ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that there is no assertion that the mind alone is liberated.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo la skur ba mi 'debs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo la skur ba mi 'debs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it does not deny the principal aim of beings.

original: de la skur ba 'debs pa ni med par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrang rig pa'i mngon sum 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de la skur ba 'debs pa ni med par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // rang rig pa'i mngon sum 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The meaning is that it does not deny that the mind alone is liberated.üîΩIt is true that the direct perception of reflexive awareness does not establish a world beyond this one,

original: 'jig rten 'di yang ma yin pa ni bden mod kyi /üîΩsa la sogs pa de nyid gzhi //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di yang ma yin pa ni bden mod kyi / sa la sogs pa de nyid gzhi //
translated: nor does it establish this world.

original: zhes zer ba'i dpe'i don du yin la /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i dpe'i don du yin la /
translated: The meaning of the example is that earth and so on are the basis of reality.

original: rnam par dpyad na de la rab tu grags pa'i sa la sogs pa yang de nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na de la rab tu grags pa'i sa la sogs pa yang de nyid ma yin la /
translated: When analyzed, even the earth and so on that are well known in the world are not reality.

original: 'jig rten pha rol lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention a world beyond this one?

original: de dag tsam ni skyes bu'i don thar pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tsam ni skyes bu'i don thar pa ma yin te /
translated: Those alone are not the aim of beings, which is liberation.

original: rnam par rtogs pa yang 'jig rten 'di'i yul can yin te ;
analyzed: rnam par rtogs pa yang 'jig rten 'di'i yul can yin te ;
translated: Conceptual thought also has this world as its object,

original: rang rig pa bzhin du rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa bzhin du rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: because it is a natural object, like reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te 'jig rten 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, ‚Äúin this world,‚Äù

original: rmongs pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni rnam pa rtog pa gzhan te /
analyzed: rmongs pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni rnam pa rtog pa gzhan te /
translated: ‚Äúother‚Äù means another kind of conceptualization.

original: 'jig rten pha rol pa sogs pa'i yul du ma grags pa kho na'i phyi mi 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol pa sogs pa'i yul du ma grags pa kho na'i phyi mi 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not accept that the object of the conceptualization of the other world is not known.

original: 'di yan zhes bya ba ni yul 'jig rten 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di yan zhes bya ba ni yul 'jig rten 'di'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the object, the world.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú From where‚Äù means ‚Äúnot from that.‚Äù

original: gal te rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo thar pa yin na 'dod pa can du mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo thar pa yin na 'dod pa can du mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If the nature of mere reflexive awareness were liberation, it would not be accepted.

original: de phyir nges pa gang nyid kyis //
analyzed: de phyir nges pa gang nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, by that very certainty,

original: 'du byed kyis ni rjes su 'jug pa //
analyzed: 'du byed kyis ni rjes su 'jug pa //
translated: one is led by compositional activity.

original: sems ni de med mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: sems ni de med mi 'byung ba //
translated: The mind does not arise without that.

original: de phyir sems la rten pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir sems la rten pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is based on the mind.

original: @329a * // zhes bya ba'i rigs pas gang gi tshe thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rnam rtog ni rang gi rigs tsam las grub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: @329a * // zhes bya ba'i rigs pas gang gi tshe thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rnam rtog ni rang gi rigs tsam las grub pa de'i tshe /
translated: By that reasoning, when the conception of beginningless and endless samsara is established from mere continuity of its own type,

original: 'jig rten pha rol grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: then the other world is established.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is said to be so in regard to beginninglessness and endlessness.

original: gal te thog mtha' med 'grub na //
analyzed: gal te thog mtha' med 'grub na //
translated: If it is established as beginningless and endless,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not the effect of anything.

original: snga ma snga ma'i rnam par rtogs pa'i bag chags kyi rjes su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de'i bskyed bya ma yin na /
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i rnam par rtogs pa'i bag chags kyi rjes su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de'i bskyed bya ma yin na /
translated: And if the conceptual thought that conforms to the latent impressions of prior conceptual thought is not the effect of that,

original: 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ma yin pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ma yin pa lta ci smos te /
translated: then how could it be the effect of the elements?

original: de'i khyad par ma yin pa'i khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ma yin pa'i khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a particular that is not a particular of that.

original: de'i phyir 'di rgyu med pa nyid yin na 'bras bu thams cad rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rgyu med pa nyid yin na 'bras bu thams cad rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if this is causeless, then all effects would be causeless.

original: 'di rgyu med pa can du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'di rgyu med pa can du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established that this is causeless,

original: rgyu med nyid ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med nyid ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: the causeless is the cause.

original: rgyu med pa can ni ming yin pa'i phyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can ni ming yin pa'i phyir bstan pa ni /
translated: Because the causeless is a name, the teaching isüîΩthat everything is causeless.

original: thams cad rgyu med nyid du zhes bya ba ste khyod kyis smras pa yang gzhan gyis go ba'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med nyid du zhes bya ba ste khyod kyis smras pa yang gzhan gyis go ba'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that what you say is understood by others.

original: ci don nyid ni khyed don gang la yin pa'am /
analyzed: ci don nyid ni khyed don gang la yin pa'am /
translated: What is the point of that?üîΩOr, what is the point of that?

original: 'di don yang yin la gang yang yin pa'i phyir ci don no //
analyzed: 'di don yang yin la gang yang yin pa'i phyir ci don no //
translated: Because it is a point and also what, it is what.

original: de gang la yod pa ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa ni de nyid do //
translated: What has that is that itself.

original: smra ba po khyod la dgos pa ci yod ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba po khyod la dgos pa ci yod ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: What is the point of your speaking?

original: 'on te 'di la zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: Or, this is the point, the result.

original: des zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis brgal zhing rtag pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis brgal zhing rtag pas so //
translated: By that, by the objection and examination of another.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa la dgos ba cung zad bsgrub par bya ba med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa la dgos ba cung zad bsgrub par bya ba med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that there is nothing to be established by the objection and examination?

original: de nyid ni ma rig pa 'ba' zhig gis 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni ma rig pa 'ba' zhig gis 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught by just ignorance alone.

original: ma rig pas byas pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pas byas pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is made by ignorance.

original: don med pa ni tshig tsam mo //
analyzed: don med pa ni tshig tsam mo //
translated: It is meaningless, just words.

original: de nyid kyis skyon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis skyon bstan pa ni /
translated: That itself is taught as the fault.

original: gzhan gyi bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the explanation of another.

original: gal te ma rig chad min na //
analyzed: gal te ma rig chad min na //
translated: If it is not cut off by ignorance,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said.

original: rtogs su gzhug bya'i ma rig pa gal te ma chad na tshig tsam ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs su gzhug bya'i ma rig pa gal te ma chad na tshig tsam ni don med pa yin no //
translated: If the ignorance to be eliminated is not eliminated, then the words are useless.

original: 'on te chad na yang de ltar chad par byed pa'i tshig rgu kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te chad na yang de ltar chad par byed pa'i tshig rgu kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is eliminated, then the words that eliminate it are themselves eliminated.

original: rgyu med pa smra ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa smra ba ji ltar yin /
translated: How can you say that there is no cause?

original: 'on te ma rig chad na yang //
analyzed: 'on te ma rig chad na yang //
translated: But if ignorance is eliminated,

original: ji ltar thog ma med par grub pas 'khor ba grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma med par grub pas 'khor ba grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can cyclic existence be established as beginningless?

original: ma rig rnam rtog las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig rnam rtog las zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that ignorance is the discrimination of the perishable.

original: 'di thog ma med pa yin bag chags goms pa yang yin la /üîΩde'i yongs su smin pa ni sad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di thog ma med pa yin bag chags goms pa yang yin la / de'i yongs su smin pa ni sad pa yin la /
translated: This is beginningless, and the habit is the maturation of the latent potentialities.üîΩThe activation of the habit is the production of the discrimination of the perishable.

original: des byas pa ni bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams goms pa las byung ba nyid du nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: des byas pa ni bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams goms pa las byung ba nyid du nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Since it is said that attachment and pleasure, etc., arise from the habit, they are included in the maturation of the latent potentialities.

original: rgyu med pa ni skye ba dang 'gal @329b ba'i phyir goms pa las sdug bsngal skye ba yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni skye ba dang 'gal @329b ba'i phyir goms pa las sdug bsngal skye ba yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But it is not reasonable to say that suffering arises from the habit without a cause, because that contradicts the principle of causality.

original: rgyu med pa nyid rtag go goms pas mngon par gsal ba yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid rtag go goms pas mngon par gsal ba yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: The cause is permanent, but it becomes manifest through familiarity.üîΩIn response to this, Aryadeva says,

original: de ni res 'ga' zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni res 'ga' zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes it is not observed.‚Äù

original: dmigs bya ma yin pa la dmigs bya nyid kyang snga na med pa kho na byung na de nyid yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs bya ma yin pa la dmigs bya nyid kyang snga na med pa kho na byung na de nyid yod pa yin gyi /
translated: If something that is not an object of observation were an object of observation, it would exist only when it arises, since it did not exist previously.

original: de yang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba kho nas sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba kho nas sdug bsngal te /
translated: Moreover, it would be impermanent, and it would follow that it would be suffering.

original: gnod pa ma yin la zag pa med pa rnams kyang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur zhes thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa ma yin la zag pa med pa rnams kyang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur zhes thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It would not be a fault, and it would follow that uncontaminated states would be like that.

original: nyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams te /
translated: The faults

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las byung ba rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las byung ba rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are the basis for the arising of the habit of grasping the self and attachment, etc.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that they are contaminated.

original: rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i snying po can yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i snying po can yin gyi /
translated: The cause is the essence of attachment to the self and to things possessed by the self.

original: rgyu tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tsam ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the cause,

original: snga ma bzhin du thal ches pa'i phyir la //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thal ches pa'i phyir la //
translated: because, as before, it would follow that the consequence is excessive.

original: de'i dbang ni de la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang ni de la rag las pa'o //
translated: Its power is its dependence on that.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: Its reality is just that.

original: yang gi sgra ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'i don dang goms pa can nyid bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'i don dang goms pa can nyid bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúafter‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúinclination.‚Äù

original: 'grel par ni goms pa las byung ba ni 'dod pa la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel par ni goms pa las byung ba ni 'dod pa la rag las pa'o //
translated: In the commentary, ‚Äúarising from habituation‚Äù means ‚Äúdependent on desire.‚Äù

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la ma goms pa ni mchog yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la ma goms pa ni mchog yin te /
translated: Non-habituation to the grasping of self, etc., is the best,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of suffering.

original: de las bzlog pa las goms pa nyid kyang mchog yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa las goms pa nyid kyang mchog yin te /
translated: The opposite of that, habituation, is also the best,

original: mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it is incompatible with that.

original: gal te bdag go zhes bya ba bdag tu 'dzin pa rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag go zhes bya ba bdag tu 'dzin pa rgyu yin na /
translated: If the cause of the grasping of self is the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di ni goms pa las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di ni goms pa las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: this grasping of self does not arise from habituation.

original: lus dang dbang po dang tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir sems la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la dbang po bya ba byed pa med pas lus ma dmigs kyang bdag go zhes nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir sems la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la dbang po bya ba byed pa med pas lus ma dmigs kyang bdag go zhes nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: Since the self is the subject of objects that are different from the body and faculties, the self is experienced as existing even when the body is not perceived, since the faculties are not active in the states of mind and so on.

original: de ltar yang re re'i bdag nyid la de ltar 'gyur ba la yin no zhes smos pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de ltar yang re re'i bdag nyid la de ltar 'gyur ba la yin no zhes smos pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thus, it is thought that the self is the nature of each of them.

original: bdag min zhes bya ba ste /üîΩbdag tu dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag min zhes bya ba ste / bdag tu dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúIt is not the self.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not perceived.

original: re zhig rang rig pas ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rang rig pas ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not by means of reflexive awareness,

original: yul nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is near.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pas mchod pa'i yul ni nges pa las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pas mchod pa'i yul ni nges pa las kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it from the object, time, and so on, because the object of worship is ascertained.

original: mthong pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyi phyir dang mthong ba'i lus la sogs pa nyid phyi rol dang tha dad pa yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rgyun mi 'chad par @330a * //üîΩyod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mthong pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyi phyir dang mthong ba'i lus la sogs pa nyid phyi rol dang tha dad pa yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rgyun mi 'chad par @330a * //üîΩyod pa'i phyir //
translated: It is not from the body and so on that are seen, because they are external and different, because they are apprehended as different in terms of object, time, and so on, and because they exist without interruption.

original: dngos gang yul dang dus dag las //
analyzed: dngos gang yul dang dus dag las //
translated: What is the nature of the self?

original: de ni rtag pa'i khyab bdag 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa'i khyab bdag 'dod //
translated: It is the pervader of the body, the object, and time.

original: de phyir bdag ni khyab bdag brjod //
analyzed: de phyir bdag ni khyab bdag brjod //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ‚Äúpervading self.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: ces bya ba ji ltar yin /
translated: How is this?

original: bdag mngon sum pa ma yin pa de ni bden te /
analyzed: bdag mngon sum pa ma yin pa de ni bden te /
translated: It is true that the self is not directly perceived,

original: nye ba tsam nyid kyis skad cig ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: nye ba tsam nyid kyis skad cig ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: because if it were, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be momentary, like the things that are directly perceived.

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba ni yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba ni yin no //
translated: However, it is to be inferred.

original: 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'bad pa dang / bde ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi shes pa rnas ni 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis rgyu rnam las lus pa'i bdag rten du gyur bar go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'bad pa dang / bde ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi shes pa rnas ni 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis rgyu rnam las lus pa'i bdag rten du gyur bar go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The knowledge of desire, hatred, effort, pleasure, pain, and so on, is the effect of the self, and it is from this effect that the existence of the self, which is the basis of the remaining causes, is inferred.

original: bdag nyi nyams su ma myong ba'am ma dran pa 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag nyi nyams su ma myong ba'am ma dran pa 'dod pa 'am /
translated: The self is not experienced or remembered by the knowledge of desire and so on.

original: sdang ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir nams su myong ba dang dran pa dang 'dod pa dus tha dad pa rnams de'i dus su yod pa'i dngos po med na 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sdang ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir nams su myong ba dang dran pa dang 'dod pa dus tha dad pa rnams de'i dus su yod pa'i dngos po med na 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Because it is neither hostile nor friendly, the times of experience, memory, and desire do not occur in the absence of a thing that exists at the time of those.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'ang ma yin pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i bdag gis so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'ang ma yin pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i bdag gis so //
translated: The self that is the basis of desire and so on does not exist.

original: brten pa nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bag chags tsam las byung ba'i phyir de dag ma yin zhing /
analyzed: brten pa nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bag chags tsam las byung ba'i phyir de dag ma yin zhing /
translated: Because they arise from the mere imprints of experience, they are not those and they are not blessings.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang gzhi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang gzhi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is connected with the statement, ‚ÄúThey are not blessings,‚Äù it is the common locus of suffering and desire.

original: 'grel par ni bag chags las byung ba nyid kyis gzhan du yang 'thad pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel par ni bag chags las byung ba nyid kyis gzhan du yang 'thad pa bstan pa ni /
translated: In the Commentary, the explanation of the tenability of the arising of desire and so on from imprints alone is as follows:

original: rgyu min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not causes.‚Äù

original: de la brten pa nyid du ma mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la brten pa nyid du ma mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the nonobservation of the self as the basis of desire and so on is as follows:

original: rtag pa 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not permanent.‚Äù

original: rtag pa nyid du khas blangs kyang mi sdod pa dang / rim gyis byed pa nyid 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du khas blangs kyang mi sdod pa dang / rim gyis byed pa nyid 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if one accepts that it is permanent, it is shown that the contradiction of not remaining and of acting gradually is

original: de'i phyir gcig las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it says ‚Äúfrom one.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa'i 'di nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa bzhin ba'i sdug bsngal gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa'i 'di nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa bzhin ba'i sdug bsngal gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This very intention is shown to be the statement by the Transcendent Lord of the suffering of change.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It says ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal 'khor ba'i zhes bstan pa dang sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal 'khor ba'i zhes bstan pa dang sbyor ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù is connected to the teaching of the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams las thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams las thal ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the consequence applies to the uncontaminated.

original: rtag pa kho na las goms pa la sogs pa'i dbang gos dmigs bya gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtag pa kho na las goms pa la sogs pa'i dbang gos dmigs bya gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it that through the power of cultivation and so on, the object of observation changes from one to another, even though it is permanent?

original: ngo bo rtag pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ngo bo rtag pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thinking that the essence is permanent,

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThe object of observation itself.‚Äù

original: rtag pa nyid yin na dmigs bya nyid mi dmigs pa'i dus su yod par 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin na dmigs bya nyid mi dmigs pa'i dus su yod par 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it were permanent, the object of observation would exist at the time of nonobservation. This is shown by

original: thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba ste /
translated: at all times.üîΩThe cause is the apprehension of self and of what belongs to the self.

original: rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin la /üîΩ@330b 'grel pa'i phyir ni dbang du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin la / @330b 'grel pa'i phyir ni dbang du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The self is not a consecrator.

original: mi rtag pa'i sems can gyis byin gyi brlabs pa yin na gzhan du mi 'thad pas don mi rtag par sems pas byin gyis rlob pa thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sems can gyis byin gyi brlabs pa yin na gzhan du mi 'thad pas don mi rtag par sems pas byin gyis rlob pa thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it were consecrated by impermanent sentient beings, it would not be tenable as something else. Therefore, it is taught that one obtains consecration by thinking of impermanent objects.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: mi rtag pa'i sems pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sems pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is by impermanent intention.

original: gal te yang nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: If it arises from the latent potentialities of experience,

original: 'di la gzhan mi rten pa ci las nyin /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan mi rten pa ci las nyin /
translated: why is it not dependent on something else?

original: dbang po las 'das pa la sogs par byed pa yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la dbang po las 'das pa spong bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa la sogs par byed pa yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la dbang po las 'das pa spong bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: One might think that it is not the case that there is a cause that is beyond the senses and so forth. The refutation of that is not that it is beyond the senses,

original: 'on kyang 'di'i rgyu nyid la mthong ba tsam las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di'i rgyu nyid la mthong ba tsam las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: but rather that it is taught that the effect that arises from merely seeing its cause is pervaded by a contradiction:

original: 'bras bu'i skye ba med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: 'bras bu'i skye ba med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste ;
translated: Because there is no arising of the effect.

original: de tsam las mi 'byung ba ni rgyu gzhan nyid khyab par byed pa nyid kyis khyab par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de tsam las mi 'byung ba ni rgyu gzhan nyid khyab par byed pa nyid kyis khyab par byed pa yin la /
translated: The reason for this is that the pervader itself pervades just that much.

original: 'di yang 'gal ba 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di yang 'gal ba 'byung ba yin la /
translated: And this is a contradiction.

original: yod kyang khyab byar byed pa med pa yin na ci ltar khyab bya nus pa yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod kyang khyab byar byed pa med pa yin na ci ltar khyab bya nus pa yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And if, although it exists, it does not pervade, how can it be a pervader?

original: rung ba'i khyad par ni bag chags kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i khyad par ni bag chags kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in suitability is the difference in the latent impressions.

original: gang gis de med par zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pas so //
analyzed: gang gis de med par zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pas so //
translated: By which it does not exist means that the pervader does not exist.

original: khyab par byed pa med kyang khyab bya srid pa yin na rgyu rnams la 'di tsam zhes med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med kyang khyab bya srid pa yin na rgyu rnams la 'di tsam zhes med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni //
translated: If the pervaded exists even when the pervader does not exist, then it is shown that the causes would be without this much.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa tsam //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa tsam //
translated: It is merely the absence of concomitance.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yul la khyab pa med pa'i phyir de la med pas khyab par byed pa med pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yul la khyab pa med pa'i phyir de la med pas khyab par byed pa med pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If one thinks that because the object is not pervaded, it is not pervaded by the absence of the pervader,üîΩthen it is said:

original: rtag pa khyab pa ma yin yang //
analyzed: rtag pa khyab pa ma yin yang //
translated: Even though the permanent is not pervasive,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said:

original: rtag pa nyid kyis skyed byed gcig gi ngo bo yin zhes bya'o don to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis skyed byed gcig gi ngo bo yin zhes bya'o don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of a single producer because it is permanent.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma yang cis thams cad kyi skyed byed ma yin zhes bya ba ni thal 'gyur ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma yang cis thams cad kyi skyed byed ma yin zhes bya ba ni thal 'gyur ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a reductio argument when we say, ‚ÄúWhy isn‚Äôt the impermanent also the producer of everything?‚Äù

original: gang kho na'i phyir sdug bsngal ther zug pa @331a * //
analyzed: gang kho na'i phyir sdug bsngal ther zug pa @331a * //
translated: Since suffering is not permanent, it is intermittent.

original: ma yin pa ni res 'ga' ba yin pa de'i phyir rang nyid grub pa la bag chags la sogs pa can ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyur go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin pa ni res 'ga' ba yin pa de'i phyir rang nyid grub pa la bag chags la sogs pa can ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyur go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it possesses a habitual tendency and so on, it is understood to be the cause because it possesses forward and reverse pervasion.

original: rtag pa bzhin du mi rtag pa yang ji ltar rgyu yin zhes zer ba mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa bzhin du mi rtag pa yang ji ltar rgyu yin zhes zer ba mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is unreasonable to say, ‚ÄúHow can the impermanent be a cause, just like the permanent?‚Äù

original: nges 'ga' ba nyid ces bya ba'o //üîΩrgyu med pa can gyi sdug bsngal ni rtag tu ba yin la /
analyzed: nges 'ga' ba nyid ces bya ba'o // rgyu med pa can gyi sdug bsngal ni rtag tu ba yin la /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúsince it is intermittent.‚ÄùüîΩSuffering that is causeless is permanent.

original: mi rtag pa ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Suffering that is impermanent is nonexistent.

original: sngar bzhin du phyis kyang skye ba'i rgyu med pa yin na /
analyzed: sngar bzhin du phyis kyang skye ba'i rgyu med pa yin na /

analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / rtag tu yod pa'am zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni / rang nyid 'grub pa la gzhan la ltos pa yin na /
translated: If it is not tenable that it exists as a nature,üîΩhow could it be tenable that it exists as a nature?üîΩThe response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.

original: phyis kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:

analyzed: zhes de bzhin du yod pa yang sngar nyid ngo bo yod pas rang bzhin las ma log pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /

analyzed: gzhan las mi ltos phyir zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.

original: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis kun 'byung gi bden pa ston par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis kun 'byung gi bden pa ston par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:

analyzed: sdug bsngal la rgyu med ces zer ba dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.üîΩThe response to that is:üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists as a nature.

analyzed: de la rgyu ni zhes bstan pa'o // rgyu gcig ni gtso bo la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa bzhin du sred pa mi nus pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is not tenable that it

original: mi nus pa spangs pas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde la rnam pa dang po'i bshad pa ni /üîΩres 'ga' ba nyid ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin par bstan pa ni /

translated: Because of the abandonment of the incapable.üîΩThe first kind of explanation is indicated by the verse:

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu yod ces bya ba'o // gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: Sometimes it is said that the cause of suffering exists,üîΩOther means not a cause.

analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'brel pa med pa'o ;

analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ther zug tu gnas pa ni ma yin no //

original: 'on kyang yul thams cad du yang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul thams cad du yang 'byung ba yin no //

original: dper na rab rib can gyi yul gyi rgyu med pa'i skra la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po mngon par phyogs pa tsam las byung ba ni thams cad du 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyi yul gyi rgyu med pa'i skra la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po mngon par phyogs pa tsam las byung ba ni thams cad du 'byung ba yin la /
translated: For example, the consciousness of the hairs and so on, which are without a cause in the visual field of one with eye disease, arises merely from the sense faculty being directed toward its object.

original: sdug bsngal yang rgyu med na de ltar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang rgyu med na de ltar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If suffering were without a cause, it would be like that.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching on that is ‚Äúhowever it is . . . ‚Äù

original: rang rig bas @331b ni zhes bya bas tshad ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: rang rig bas @331b ni zhes bya bas tshad ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy self-awareness‚Äù teaches valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid tsam dmigs pa rtog pa med pa'i shes pa ni rmi lam bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid tsam dmigs pa rtog pa med pa'i shes pa ni rmi lam bzhin du ste /
translated: Therefore, the mere emptiness that is the object of nonconceptual consciousness is like a dream.

original: rmi lam la yang rang gi ngo bo tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrtag tu ba ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rmi lam la yang rang gi ngo bo tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // rtag tu ba ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning is that even in a dream, one‚Äôs own nature is the object of valid knowledge.üîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚Äù

original: res 'ga' ba min mtshan nyid can //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba min mtshan nyid can // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚Äù

original: med par zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /üîΩmo gsham bu sogs zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang /
analyzed: med par zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /üîΩmo gsham bu sogs zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang /
translated: The teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching on the noneternality of that is ‚Äúnot permanent .

original: yang na zhes bya ba'i bshad pa gzhan ni rgyu med na 'bras bu nyid don dam par med do zhes bya ba'i dbu ma pa'i lta ba slar yang brjod bya yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'i bshad pa gzhan ni rgyu med na 'bras bu nyid don dam par med do zhes bya ba'i dbu ma pa'i lta ba slar yang brjod bya yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the other explanation of ‚Äúor‚Äù is that the Madhyamaka view is being stated again, namely, that if there is no cause, then the effect itself does not exist ultimately.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu res 'ga' ba yin du zin kyang de 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu res 'ga' ba yin du zin kyang de 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Even if the cause of suffering is not always present, is it not the case that it has the nature of the great elements?

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi ngo bo ma yin zhing //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi ngo bo ma yin zhing //
translated: It is not the nature of ignorance, craving, and karma.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: 'jig rten pha rol grub pa la 'byung ba chen po rgyu nyid yin pa bkag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol grub pa la 'byung ba chen po rgyu nyid yin pa bkag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Hasn‚Äôt it been refuted that the great elements are the cause of the establishment of the next world?

original: brjod pa / srid ba dang po'i sems ni ma la sogs pa dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i sems kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis sems gzhan rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa / srid ba dang po'i sems ni ma la sogs pa dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i sems kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis sems gzhan rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: We say: The first mind of existence is understood to be a different mind because it is the mental formation of a mother, etc., and it is not similar to the characteristics of the mind.

original: sems kyi ngo bo'i 'jig rten pha rol grub kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo rnams la sogs pa sems pa can gyi rgyu can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo'i 'jig rten pha rol grub kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo rnams la sogs pa sems pa can gyi rgyu can ni ma yin te /
translated: The world of the nature of mind is established in the world beyond, but the nature of the states of suffering and so on are not caused by conscious beings.

original: rgyu 'byung ba chen po tsam yod na grub pa yin no zhes rgol bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu 'byung ba chen po tsam yod na grub pa yin no zhes rgol bar byed pa ni /
translated: They argue that if the cause, the great elements, alone exist, it is established.üîΩThe response to that is stated in the following:

original: ji ltar tsher ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tsher ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Just as a thorn and so onüîΩare not causes of pleasure and so on,üîΩthe great elements are not causes of the world.

original: 'byung ba chen po tsam kho na chos can skyed byed las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po tsam kho na chos can skyed byed las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The great elements alone are the cause of the world because they are the cause of the phenomena that arise.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni sems pa can yin la /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni sems pa can yin la /
translated: The so-called cause is a conscious being.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i ngo bo 'di yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal can la sogs pa yul la yod pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i ngo bo 'di yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal can la sogs pa yul la yod pa ni /
translated: Similarly, the nature of existence, which has pleasure, pain, and so on, exists in the object.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du 'byung ba'i sems can gyi yang rgyu med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhes rgyu med pa can smra ba 'ga' zer ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du 'byung ba'i sems can gyi yang rgyu med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhes rgyu med pa can smra ba 'ga' zer ba yin no //
translated: Some say that the cause of the world beyond is not a conscious being that exists without a cause.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúby their very nature‚Äù is explained by the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe sharpness of thorns.

original: de la khyad par dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mgar pa la sogs pa med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de la khyad par dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mgar pa la sogs pa med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚Äù The passage beginning with ‚Äúeven though there are no such things as blacksmiths‚Äù explains the passage beginning with ‚Äúeven though there are no such things as distinctions.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /üîΩ'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te / 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo ni 'di yin te /
translated: ‚Äù The meaning of this is as follows:üîΩThe nature of the primary elements is the primary elements themselves.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo ni 'byung ba chen po kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo ni 'byung ba chen po kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The nature of the primary elements is the cause of the primary elements themselves.

original: sems pa can gyis byas pa ma yin @332a * //
analyzed: sems pa can gyis byas pa ma yin @332a * //
translated: They are not created by an intelligent being.

original: la ; bde ba can dang sdug bsngal can la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par yin la /
analyzed: la ; bde ba can dang sdug bsngal can la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par yin la /
translated: The distinctions in their natures, such as being painful or pleasant,üîΩare the effects produced by the cause that is the nature of the primary elements.

original: de rnams kyang tsher ma'i rno ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo chos can gyi rgyu'i bskyed bya kho nar snang ba yin gyi sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang tsher ma'i rno ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo chos can gyi rgyu'i bskyed bya kho nar snang ba yin gyi sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no //
translated: They are only the effects produced by the cause that is the nature of the primary elements. They are not the effects of a cause that is an intelligent being.

original: de med kyang ste sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu med kyang ngo //
analyzed: de med kyang ste sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu med kyang ngo //
translated: Even though there is no such thing as an intelligent being,

original: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rno ba dang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rno ba dang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it exists‚Äù is to be construed with ‚Äúsharpness.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe snyam du sems na khyad par ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snyam du sems na khyad par ni /
translated: If you think that it is so, then the difference is

original: mgar ba la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
analyzed: mgar ba la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
translated: that it is not due to a blacksmith, etc.

original: gal te res 'ga' mgar ba las 'di yang 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' mgar ba las 'di yang 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that sometimes this arises from a blacksmith, etc.,

original: rgyu nges pa med pa can 'di nyid da gang gi rgyu nges pa med pa de ni rgyu med pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nges pa med pa can 'di nyid da gang gi rgyu nges pa med pa de ni rgyu med pa can yin no //
translated: then this very lack of a determined cause is causelessness.

original: gal te ma nges pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur na yang rgyu med pa can ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ma nges pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur na yang rgyu med pa can ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it were to have an undetermined cause, it would be like being causeless.

original: brjod pa / ma nges pa'i rgyu can ni de'i rgyu nyid kyi dus su gzhan gyi rgyu nyid spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa / ma nges pa'i rgyu can ni de'i rgyu nyid kyi dus su gzhan gyi rgyu nyid spangs pa yin la /
translated: We say: That which has an undetermined cause is excluded from being the cause of that at the time of being the cause of another.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu nyid kyi dus su yang de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu nyid kyi dus su yang de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And at the time of being the cause of another, it is not the cause of that.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid du tsher ma la sogs pa'i rno ba'i khyad par yang 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid du tsher ma la sogs pa'i rno ba'i khyad par yang 'byung ba tsam gyi bskyed bya ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the difference in sharpness of thorns, etc., is not produced by mere arising.

original: khyab par med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not occur without pervasion.

original: rgyu shug gi sa bon la sogs pa'i ngo bo yongs su gyur pa la ltos nas kha cig tu 'gyur ba kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu shug gi sa bon la sogs pa'i ngo bo yongs su gyur pa la ltos nas kha cig tu 'gyur ba kho na yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is only a transformation of the nature of the cause, such as the seed of a myrobalan fruit,

original: yongs su gyur pa nyid kyang 'byung ba tsam las byung ba yin gyi cis thams cad la ma yin /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa nyid kyang 'byung ba tsam las byung ba yin gyi cis thams cad la ma yin /
translated: then why does transformation occur in some cases and not in all cases?

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba tsam las mi srid pa'i khyad par ni rgyu gzhan las ji ltar rang gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i las dang sems pa'i ngo bor rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba tsam las mi srid pa'i khyad par ni rgyu gzhan las ji ltar rang gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i las dang sems pa'i ngo bor rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the difference that it is not possible from mere elements is understood to be the nature of karma and intention that are different due to their own divisions from other causes.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of causelessness is:

original: gang yod nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'on te rgyu shug gi sa bon gzhan las de'i skyed byed ni de yongs su 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang yod nyid ni zhes bya ba'o // 'on te rgyu shug gi sa bon gzhan las de'i skyed byed ni de yongs su 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The existence of that.üîΩIf the cause of the myrobalan seed is the producer of that transformation,

original: de yang de las gzhan pa las de'i skyed byed yongs su gyur pa yin zhes thog ma med pa'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yin na /
analyzed: de yang de las gzhan pa las de'i skyed byed yongs su gyur pa yin zhes thog ma med pa'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yin na /
translated: and that is the producer of the transformation from that other, then it is the difference of transformation without beginning.

original: shugs kyis las 'thob pa yin zhes zer na /
analyzed: shugs kyis las 'thob pa yin zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that the effect is obtained by the power of the cause,

original: de la yang gang yod nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa slar 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang gang yod nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa slar 'khor ba yin no //
translated: then the same argument will apply to that, as before.

original: snga ma snga ma'i khyad par ji lta ba kho na bzhin du khyad par gyi skyed byed rgyu shug gi tsher ma la sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i khyad par ji lta ba kho na bzhin du khyad par gyi skyed byed rgyu shug gi tsher ma la sogs pa rnams la /
translated: Just as the cause of the special qualities of the seed, such as the thorn of the jujube tree, etc.,üîΩis the special quality of the seed itself, in the same way, the special quality of the effect, such as the thorn of the jujube tree, etc., is the special quality of the cause, such as the seed itself.

original: de kho na bzhin du ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las kyi ngo bo dag 'gegs pa dang khyer ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ni sred pa skyed byed du mthong ba'i phyir thog ma @332b med pa'i yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par ni rgyu nyid du
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las kyi ngo bo dag 'gegs pa dang khyer ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ni sred pa skyed byed du mthong ba'i phyir thog ma @332b med pa'i yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par ni rgyu nyid du
translated: Therefore, the special quality of the transformation without beginning cannot be conceived as the cause, because the activity of the cause is seen to be the production of craving.

original: brtag bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: brtag bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: thog ma med pa'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par la dgongs nas bstan pa ni rgya shug gi tsher ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par la dgongs nas bstan pa ni rgya shug gi tsher ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching with the intention of the special quality of the transformation without beginning is the thorn of the jujube tree.

original: las kyi ngo bo'i sems pas skyed byed yin pa la dgongs nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo'i sems pas skyed byed yin pa la dgongs nas bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching with the intention of the production by the volition of the nature of karma is the thorn of the jujube tree.

original: blo sngon byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo sngon byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: because the mind precedes it.üîΩFrom that very same iron thorn,

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid las ni zhes bya ba lcags kyi tsher ma las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de nyid las ni zhes bya ba lcags kyi tsher ma las so //
translated: there is a difference,

original: khyad par yod mod ces bya ba ni lcags kyi tsher ma la yod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par yod mod ces bya ba ni lcags kyi tsher ma la yod pa'o //
translated: but it is not a difference in kind, because it is a difference in the iron thorn itself.

original: rgyu bcas nyid ni sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: rgyu bcas nyid ni sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu can te /
translated: It is accompanied by its cause, because it is caused by volition.

original: snga ma snga ma'i sems pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni sems dang dbang po la sogs pa bzhin du de'i rgyu can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i sems pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni sems dang dbang po la sogs pa bzhin du de'i rgyu can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is caused by volition, which is the specific cause of each preceding moment, and it follows the cessation and arising of that volition, just as the mind and the sense faculties do.

original: de'i phyir gzhan yang snga ma snga ma'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las mngon par 'byung ba yin yang yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa'i dbang gis nges par byed pa 'phangs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yang snga ma snga ma'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las mngon par 'byung ba yin yang yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa'i dbang gis nges par byed pa 'phangs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, although it arises from the specific transformation of each preceding moment, it is projected by the specific cause of each preceding moment, because it is determined by the power of the determination of the object, time, and so on.üîΩMoreover, it is taught:

original: 'ga' zhig rgya shug sa bon las //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rgya shug sa bon las //
translated: From some sesame seeds,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: oil is produced.

original: las kyi sbyor ba las byas pa'i gser yang ma byas pa lta bur snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: las kyi sbyor ba las byas pa'i gser yang ma byas pa lta bur snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is not gold that is produced by the process of karma seen as if it were not produced?

original: de'i phyir byas pa dang ma byas pa dag la khyad par med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byas pa dang ma byas pa dag la khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between what is produced and what is not produced.

original: de lta yin na bden pa'i so sor snang bar mngon par 'dod pa yang mi bden par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na bden pa'i so sor snang bar mngon par 'dod pa yang mi bden par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then even the appearance of the truth is not true,

original: mi bden pa'i rmi lam na so sor snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rmi lam na so sor snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because there is no difference between the appearance of the individual in an untrue dream and the appearance of the individual in the waking state.

original: khyad par med pa kho na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa kho na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúthere is no difference at all.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na khyad par med pa'i so sor snang ba tsam 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na khyad par med pa'i so sor snang ba tsam 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If that is so, then the mere appearance of the individual is without difference.

original: gnyis med de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis med de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúnondual reality.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir kha cig tu the tshom can du mthong ba las thams cad the tshom za bar bya ba ma yin ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig tu the tshom can du mthong ba las thams cad the tshom za bar bya ba ma yin ba ni /
translated: Therefore, because of seeing some things with doubt, it is not the case that everything should be doubted.

original: de'i phyir gang las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äútherefore, from that.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi skra'i shes pa bzhin du yul dang dus la sogs pa'i khyad par ni ma yin na /üîΩgang yod nyid na zhes bya ba de med na med pas de 'bras bu nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi skra'i shes pa bzhin du yul dang dus la sogs pa'i khyad par ni ma yin na / gang yod nyid na zhes bya ba de med na med pas de 'bras bu nyid dam /
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúfree from a cause‚Äù means that, unlike the consciousness of hair for one with diseased vision, it is not a specific object, time, etc.

original: de'i rgyu nyid du mi rig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid du mi rig pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if something exists, then it is not the case that it does not exist. So how can it be known that it is an effect or its cause?

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu ma yin pa dag gi reg bya dang gzugs kyi shes pa dag ni de med na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu ma yin pa dag gi reg bya dang gzugs kyi shes pa dag ni de med na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: It is not the case that the consciousness of tangible objects and form are not effects and causes, because they do not exist when that does not exist.

original: gal te gang yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gang yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think this, then the phrase ‚Äúif something exists‚Äù is incorrect.

original: mthong ba ni mig gi bskyed bya gzugs kyi shes pa yin zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba ni mig gi bskyed bya gzugs kyi shes pa yin zhing /
translated: Seeing is the consciousness of form that is generated by the eye.

original: @333a * // gzugs kyi rgyu can ni mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: @333a * // gzugs kyi rgyu can ni mthong ba yin la /
translated: Form is the cause of seeing.

original: reg pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gzhan du grub pa yin na rgyu med pa'i sna tshogs pa ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: reg pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gzhan du grub pa yin na rgyu med pa'i sna tshogs pa ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: If it is established that the presence or absence of contact follows the presence or absence of seeing, then the various things that lack a cause are not dependent on a single collection.

original: gzhan du grub pa nyid la rgyu mtshan yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du grub pa nyid la rgyu mtshan yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason for the establishment of the other is taught:

original: tshogs gcig la rag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs gcig la rag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of dependence on the same collection.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ldog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las rgyu nyid kyis rgyu mtshan brjod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ldog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las rgyu nyid kyis rgyu mtshan brjod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason is not stated by way of the cause of suffering, but by way of the cause of the reversal that has such a form.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ldog pa las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩreg pa med na med pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ldog pa las zhes bya ba'o // reg pa med na med pa ni /
translated: This is taught: ‚Äúfrom a reversal that has such a form.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is not stated by way of the cause of suffering, but by way of the cause of the reversal that has such a form.üîΩThe reason is not stated by way of the cause of suffering, but by way of the cause of the reversal that has such a form.üîΩThe reason is not stated by way of the cause of suffering, but by way of the cause of the reversal that has such a form.
