original: brgyud pas ni 'ba' zhig ma yin pa yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩyang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brgyud pas ni 'ba' zhig ma yin pa yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩyang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is not stated by way of the cause of

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid khas len par byed pas brgyud pa yin gyi snga ma dang phyi ma nyid kyis ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid khas len par byed pas brgyud pa yin gyi snga ma dang phyi ma nyid kyis ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is accepted that they are co-originating causes, it is shown that they are indirect, not direct, antecedents.

original: phan tshun mi bral ba nyid kyis shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun mi bral ba nyid kyis shes par bya ba'o //
translated: This should be understood through their mutual inseparability.

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because they are causes.

original: rgyu nyid du sgrub pa la rang nyid med na med par byed pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du sgrub pa la rang nyid med na med par byed pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: In the proof that they are causes, the meaning is that they are causes because they are mutually inseparable.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig bkag pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig bkag pas so //
translated: The second alternative is because one cause is excluded.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa dang po dang 'brel pa yang rgyu gcig nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir de dgag pa'i don du rnam pa gnyis pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa dang po dang 'brel pa yang rgyu gcig nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir de dgag pa'i don du rnam pa gnyis pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause they are not accepted as having the same cause‚Äù is that the second alternative is for the purpose of refuting that.

original: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad par 'gyur te /
translated: They would be permanent means they would exist at all times.

original: dus gcig kho nar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gcig kho nar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they would exist at only one time.

original: ltos pa med pas zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid yin na ltos par bya ba med pas rim pa can du 'gal ba'i phyir dang / cig car ba nyid kyang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ltos pa med pas zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid yin na ltos par bya ba med pas rim pa can du 'gal ba'i phyir dang / cig car ba nyid kyang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no dependence‚Äù means that if there were oneness, there would be no object of dependence, and so it is contradictory to be sequential.

original: de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the sequential and non-sequential.

original: de nyid bkag pa'i rgyu mtshan rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa ma tshang ba nyid la /
analyzed: de nyid bkag pa'i rgyu mtshan rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa ma tshang ba nyid la /
translated: The reason for refuting that is the incompleteness of the sequential and non-sequential.

original: de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dra ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dra ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom those‚Äù and so on are the clarifications that are preceded by the similarity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi bar du skye ba nyid rnam pa gsum pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi bar du skye ba nyid rnam pa gsum pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: For that very reason, it is shown that the arising in between those is not a third type.

original: rnam pa gsum pa rab tu skye ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa rab tu skye ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of a third type does not occur.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na de gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na de gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, whose is it?

original: sred pa nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: sred pa nyid kyi ste /
translated: It is craving‚Äôs.

original: nus pa med cing zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nus pa med cing zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with ‚Äúwithout ability.‚Äù

original: yul gyi khyad par mtho ris la sogs pa'i ris kyi khyad par can @333b yin la /
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par mtho ris la sogs pa'i ris kyi khyad par can @333b yin la /
translated: The object is the special realm, such as the higher realms.

original: de yongs su 'dzin pa ni rang gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su 'dzin pa ni rang gir byed pa'o //
translated: To appropriate is to make one's own.

original: de thob pa'i sems pas byas pa ni yul gyi khyad par thob pa'i byas pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'i sems pas byas pa ni yul gyi khyad par thob pa'i byas pa'o //
translated: To be made by the volition of obtaining is to be made by the volition of obtaining a special object.

original: las dang lus dang ma rig pa rnams rgyu nyid kyang /
analyzed: las dang lus dang ma rig pa rnams rgyu nyid kyang /
translated: Karma, body, and ignorance are causes.

original: yul gyi khyad par la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i sred pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i sred pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that craving alone is the cause of engaging in a special object, etc.

original: rgyu gzhan nam zhes bstan pa'o//üîΩsred pa ni 'dren pa'i byed pa las rab tu skye ba yin du zin kyang ji ltar srid pa 'dod pa yin snyam du sems pa la de kho na de yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan nam zhes bstan pa'o// sred pa ni 'dren pa'i byed pa las rab tu skye ba yin du zin kyang ji ltar srid pa 'dod pa yin snyam du sems pa la de kho na de yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: is taught by the phrase ‚Äúor another cause.‚ÄùüîΩAlthough craving is generated from the act of leading, how is it the desire for existence?

original: de ni srid 'dod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni srid 'dod ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that this is so is taught by the phrase ‚Äúit is the desire for existence.‚Äù

original: kun 'byung ni yang nus pa sred pa tsam yang ma yin la /
analyzed: kun 'byung ni yang nus pa sred pa tsam yang ma yin la /
translated: Is the origin of suffering not simply the ability of craving,

original: srid pa 'dod pa tsam yang ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: srid pa 'dod pa tsam yang ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: or is it simply the desire for existence?

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa la sogs pa gsum kun 'byung ba nyid yin par mdo sde las gsungs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa la sogs pa gsum kun 'byung ba nyid yin par mdo sde las gsungs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The s≈´tras state that the three, craving for desire realm objects, etc., are the origin of suffering.

original: gal te yul gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yul gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is a special object‚Äù means that it is a special object of craving.

original: gang phyir yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni bsdus pa'i don dang 'brel pa'i phyir de yang zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang phyir yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni bsdus pa'i don dang 'brel pa'i phyir de yang zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚Äúand also‚Äù indicates that it is a special object of craving because it is related to the meaning of ‚Äúcompounded things.‚Äù

original: srid pa la srid pa kho na 'ba' zhig sred pa 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de yang ngo //
analyzed: srid pa la srid pa kho na 'ba' zhig sred pa 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de yang ngo //
translated: Craving does not only crave existence, but also that which is compounded.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang gi phyir ni srid pa 'dod pa las so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni srid pa 'dod pa las so //
translated: Because of the desire for existence.

original: srog chags zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: srog chags zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúcreature‚Äù shows that craving is devoid of wisdom.

original: de lta yin na ji ltar 'jug par byed /üîΩces bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na ji ltar 'jug par byed / ces bstan pa ni /
translated: If that is so, how does it engage?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa can 'thob pa dang mi 'thob par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i rgyu sred pa yin par brjod na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa can 'thob pa dang mi 'thob par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i rgyu sred pa yin par brjod na /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe desire for the attainment of pleasure and pain‚Äù shows that craving is the cause of engagement in the object that is to be benefited.

original: de nyid bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la phrad pa dang bral bar 'dod pa dag gi dbye bas dor ba'i sred pa yang mdo sder gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩ'dod dang 'jig sred ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la phrad pa dang bral bar 'dod pa dag gi dbye bas dor ba'i sred pa yang mdo sder gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni / 'dod dang 'jig sred ces bya ba ste /
translated: The S≈´tra also teaches that craving for abandonment is a type of craving, since it is the desire to meet with pleasure and to avoid pain.üîΩSome say that the words ‚Äúcraving for pleasure and for existence‚Äù

original: 'thob pa dang mi 'thob par 'dod ces bya bas dbang phyug 'dzud byed yin pa bsal ba yin pa ni kha cig gis 'dod do //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang mi 'thob par 'dod ces bya bas dbang phyug 'dzud byed yin pa bsal ba yin pa ni kha cig gis 'dod do //
translated: indicate that the desire to obtain or not obtain is not the cause of bondage.

original: de yang ji ltar 'dod pa sred pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'dod pa sred pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is that desire a craving?

original: srid pa'i sgra ni 'khor ba'i rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: srid pa'i sgra ni 'khor ba'i rnam grangs yin la /
translated: The term ‚Äúexistence‚Äù is a synonym for cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba yang gnas dang longs spyod bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang gnas dang longs spyod bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba yang yin te /
translated: And cyclic existence is the meeting with pleasure and the avoidance of pain.

original: de la 'dod pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthree types of desire arise‚Äù is that.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dag bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dag bzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the desire to meet with pleasure and to avoid pain.

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba yin la /
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba yin la /
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: de zhes bya ba ni srid pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni srid pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to craving for existence.

original: thams cad ni gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas ma @334a * //
analyzed: thams cad ni gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas ma @334a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means not just one.

original: lus par brjod pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: lus par brjod pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of the expression of all substances is

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: stated in the line ‚Äúcraving for desire realm objects,‚Äù and so on.

original: phye ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phye ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The classification is stated in the line

original: gang zhig gnas la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gnas la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is based on desire realm objects and so on.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni longs spyod do //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni longs spyod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes enjoyment.

original: 'di la 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du 'byung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du 'byung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is stated to show that there is no contradiction.

original: ma rig pa ni sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt ignorance characterized by obscuration?

original: 'dren pa yang /
analyzed: 'dren pa yang /
translated: The Guide to the Bodhisattva Way of Life says:

original: rnam shes kyis bsgribs pa las yin te /
analyzed: rnam shes kyis bsgribs pa las yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that which is obscured by consciousness,

original: sgro 'dogs pa nyid dang / 'dren pa las zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sred pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa nyid dang / 'dren pa las zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sred pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is said that there is superimposition and guidance, craving is not the cause of ignorance,üîΩbecause it is the cause of attraction.

original: 'gugs pa'i bdag nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la sred pa'i yan lag thams cad la sred pa'i bya ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gugs pa'i bdag nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la sred pa'i yan lag thams cad la sred pa'i bya ba yod pa yin te /
translated: In all the members of craving, the activity of craving exists.

original: chags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩbdag tu chags pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / bdag tu chags pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is the essence of attachment.

original: kun la rab tu 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kun la rab tu 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is fully engaged in all of them.

original: 'khor ba 'dis yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rten 'brel gyi yang lag yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dis yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rten 'brel gyi yang lag yin la /
translated: The engagement of the links of dependent origination, such as ignorance, is samsara.

original: de thams cad de la bdag tu lta ba'i ma rig pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de thams cad de la bdag tu lta ba'i ma rig pa yod pa yin te /
translated: All of them are present in that view of self,

original: de med na mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that they would not occur if it were absent.

original: de yang chags pa'i snying po can yin pa'i phyir sred pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang chags pa'i snying po can yin pa'i phyir sred pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is craving because it has the essence of attachment.

original: de bzhin du bdag gir lta bar yang chags pa'i snying po can du brjod par bya ba yin la /üîΩde med kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩbde min ni bdag gi bar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gir lta bar yang chags pa'i snying po can du brjod par bya ba yin la / de med kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / bde min ni bdag gi bar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the view of mine should be described as having the essence of attachment.üîΩThe root text states:üîΩIt is not happiness, but the desire for what is mine.

original: bde bar 'du zhes pa ni bdag gi ba nyid kyis 'khyud pa nyid las te /
analyzed: bde bar 'du zhes pa ni bdag gi ba nyid kyis 'khyud pa nyid las te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the embrace of happiness‚Äù means that it is the embrace of what is mine.

original: 'gro ba'i yul la sogs pa bde ba yin pa'i phyir chags pa'i yul nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i yul la sogs pa bde ba yin pa'i phyir chags pa'i yul nyid du brjod do //
translated: The object of going, etc., is pleasant, and so it is called the object of attachment.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ming gzhan sred pa zhes bya ba'i chags pa ste rgyu nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ming gzhan sred pa zhes bya ba'i chags pa ste rgyu nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the other name of craving, which is attachment. The word ‚Äúcause‚Äù should be supplied.

original: rab tu 'jug pa ni yan lag la'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa ni yan lag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEngages‚Äù refers to the limbs.

original: yan lag gi yul bstan pa ni gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa bdag gi bar mngon par 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi yul bstan pa ni gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa bdag gi bar mngon par 'dod pa la'o //
translated: The object of the limbs is taught as the ‚Äúenjoyment of the self,‚Äù such as the home, possessions, and so on.

original: phyin ci log ba zhis nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'du shes pa zhes bya ba 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ba zhis nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'du shes pa zhes bya ba 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCorrupted by error‚Äù means ‚Äúperceiving as pleasant,‚Äù as the commentary explains.

original: bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa'i snying po can du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa'i snying po can du bstan pa yin la /
translated: This shows that the essence of attachment is the view of the self and of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'di'i rgyu nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir snying rje dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir snying rje dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the cause of the limbs, it is the limb that benefits by being the cooperative condition. Therefore, it is compassionate.

original: 'di nyid las bya ba ni chags pa'i ngo bo'i sred pa ni thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyis lhan cig byed pa nyid du brjod pa'i @334b phyir ro //üîΩgal te sred pa med pas med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid las bya ba ni chags pa'i ngo bo'i sred pa ni thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyis lhan cig byed pa nyid du brjod pa'i @334b phyir ro // gal te sred pa med pas med pa'i phyir /
translated: In this very text, craving, which is the essence of attachment, is said to be a co-originator by virtue of being helpful to all.

original: rten 'brel nyid yin na lus med na yang skye ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten 'brel nyid yin na lus med na yang skye ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were dependent origination because it does not exist without craving, then it would arise even without a body.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'byung rngub dbang po blo zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung rngub dbang po blo zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the verse Inhalation, exhalation, sense faculties, mind is taught.

original: gal te rkyen nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rkyen nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if it is a condition is said.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don bshad pa yin no //
translated: How is it free from attachment? This is the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba ni de med na med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba ni de med na med pa'o //
translated: This very reasoning is that it does not exist without that.

original: rgyu mtshan khas blangs phyir zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan khas blangs phyir zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of because the reason is accepted is taught.

original: 'dod chags med kyang zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med kyang zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Even without attachment is shown.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni lus rgyu mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig ni nye bar len pa nyid kyi tshig la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni lus rgyu mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig ni nye bar len pa nyid kyi tshig la gnod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis body‚Äù is a reason. The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of‚Äù is a fault in the phrase ‚Äúappropriation.‚Äù

original: zos pa ni gsol pa'o //
analyzed: zos pa ni gsol pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEaten‚Äù means ‚Äúconsumed.‚Äù

original: dpyad pa ni nges par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: dpyad pa ni nges par brtag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExamined‚Äù means ‚Äúinvestigated.‚Äù

original: blo gros 'bar bas ni khyed kyis so //
analyzed: blo gros 'bar bas ni khyed kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúWith blazing intelligence‚Äù means ‚Äúwith you.‚ÄùüîΩThe arising of desire is not the cause of the body because it arises simultaneously with the body.üîΩIf you say that the prior existence of desire is the cause of the body,üîΩwe say that the meaning of the statement ‚Äúarising is simultaneous‚Äù is that the body and its qualities arise simultaneously.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the reason,

original: skye ba ste lus dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ste lus dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: we say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect,

analyzed: sngar yod pa nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na / lhan cig 'byung ba'i nges pa bshad pa'i don du / rdzas yon tan dang bcas pa nyid rgyu mtshan yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: we say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect.

analyzed: gal te yon tan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ste / 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: If you say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.

analyzed: gal te skye ba zhes bya ba ste /üîΩskye ba'i snga rol ma mthong ba'i phyir da ltar mthong ba las lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa yin la /
translated: If you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the effect,üîΩwe say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause.üîΩIf you say that the substance together with its qualities is the cause,

original: de las kyang yon tan dang bcas pa'i rdzas skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las kyang yon tan dang bcas pa'i rdzas skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the reason for the arising of a substance possessing a quality is the cause.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: skal mnyam skye las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skal mnyam skye las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Homogeneity is the cause of the arising of attachment.

original: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu sngar byung bar rtogs pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu sngar byung bar rtogs pa na /
translated: Just as co-arisen attachment is not the cause of arising, so too arising is not the cause of attachment because it co-arises with it.

original: 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs su mthong ba'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs su mthong ba'i phyir skal pa mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: When the cause is understood to be a prior state, it is homogeneity because it is seen to be the life-basis.

original: 'dra ba nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid rgyur btags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid rgyur btags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that similarity is imputed to be the cause of incorrect mental activity.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa'i snying po can rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i chags pa'i snying po can rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the core of attachment the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù?

original: chags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not attachment.

original: 'di bstan pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa'i chags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di bstan pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa'i chags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of this is ‚Äúthrough the attachment produced by the grasping of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de'i phyir der lta ba yang rgyu kho na yin gyi sred pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir der lta ba yang rgyu kho na yin gyi sred pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Therefore, the view is the cause there, but craving is not.

original: rgyu yin yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu yin yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is ‚Äúalthough it is the cause.‚Äù

original: sgrib par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'dzud byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'dzud byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is not the one that draws in, because it has the nature of obscuring.

original: @335a * // de'i phyir mi shes pa ste ma rig pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la ma brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: @335a * // de'i phyir mi shes pa ste ma rig pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la ma brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, ignorance, which is non-knowledge, is not mentioned in the truth of the origin.

original: sred pa ni 'dzud byed yin pa'i phyir brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sred pa ni 'dzud byed yin pa'i phyir brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Craving is mentioned because it is the one that draws in.

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the explanation.üîΩBecause three are causes means that ignorance and karma are also mentioned in the members of dependent origination.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that craving is mentioned because it is the one that draws in.

original: gsum rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams la ma rig pa dang las dag kyang brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsum rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams la ma rig pa dang las dag kyang brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that ignorance and karma are mentioned because they are causes.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that ignorance and karma are also mentioned in the members of dependent origination.

original: bar du mchod pas zhes bya ba ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: bar du mchod pas zhes bya ba ni nyes byas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that craving is mentioned because it is the one that draws in.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that ignorance and karma are mentioned because they are causes.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that ignorance and karma are also mentioned in the members of dependent origination.

original: de ma thag nyid du sgrub par byed pa ni gti mug dang las dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag nyid du sgrub par byed pa ni gti mug dang las dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The immediate cause is ignorance and karma.

original: sred pa med na las la nus pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sred pa med na las la nus pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that karma is powerless without craving is:

original: de yod pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When that exists,

original: las kyis sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyis sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äújoined by karma‚Äù is just this.

original: sred pa med pas yongs su 'dor ba ma yan gyi /
analyzed: sred pa med pas yongs su 'dor ba ma yan gyi /
translated: Even though there is no craving, the one who is liberated is not completely free from karma.üîΩHowever, since the birth of those who have the nature of being liberated is also produced by karma alone, not by the absence of craving, the teaching that it is produced by karma alone is:üîΩIf the mind,üîΩFirst, the one who is free from craving is not projected by the power of another karma, because the one who is free from craving is completely free from karma.

original: 'on kyang las gzhan gyis byas pa kho na de yang yin pa'i phyir grol ba'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi skye ba med ba yang las med pas byas pa kho na yin gyi sred pa med pa nyid kyis byas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang las gzhan gyis byas pa kho na de yang yin pa'i phyir grol ba'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi skye ba med ba yang las med pas byas pa kho na yin gyi sred pa med pa nyid kyis byas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: However, since the birth of those who have the nature of being liberated is also produced by karma alone, not by the absence of craving, the teaching that it is produced by karma alone is:

original: gal te blo zhes bya ba'o //üîΩre zhig srid pa med na 'byung ba yongs su 'dor ba ni las gzhan gyi nus pas 'phangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te blo zhes bya ba'o // re zhig srid pa med na 'byung ba yongs su 'dor ba ni las gzhan gyi nus pas 'phangs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the mind,

original: gzhan du yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the one who is free from craving is not projected by the power of another karma, because the one who is free from craving is completely free from karma.

original: 'on te sred pa med na las nyid mi 'byung ba de'i phyir las med pa byas pa'i yongs su 'dor ba yin gyi las gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sred pa med na las nyid mi 'byung ba de'i phyir las med pa byas pa'i yongs su 'dor ba yin gyi las gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: But if craving does not exist, karma itself does not occur. Therefore, the abandonment of what is done by one who has no karma is not done by another‚Äôs karma.

original: 'di la yang brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: sred pa dang ni rnam bral na //üîΩzhes bya ba ni las med pa'i sgo nas sred pa nyid der bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pa dang ni rnam bral na // zhes bya ba ni las med pa'i sgo nas sred pa nyid der bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: If one is free from craving,üîΩThis shows that craving itself is the agent in that context, from the perspective of the nonexistence of karma.

original: de'i phyir srid pa gtso bo yin te med pa kho na la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa gtso bo yin te med pa kho na la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, craving is primary, because it alone is the agent in the absence of karma.

original: 'on te las med pa nyid sbyor byed yin te /
analyzed: 'on te las med pa nyid sbyor byed yin te /
translated: But if the absence of karma is the agent,

original: sred pa yod kyang de med na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa yod kyang de med na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then craving would not be the agent, because it exists even when that does not exist.

original: de ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa yin te /
translated: That is not established,üîΩbecause if it exists, the absence of that is established.

original: de yod na de med pa nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yod na de med pa nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: To show this, he says:

original: 'on te 'di la sred yod na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la sred yod na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If craving exists in this regard,

original: sdug bsngal de gtan du ba ma yin pa dang mi brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de gtan du ba ma yin pa dang mi brtan pa yin te /
translated: That suffering is not permanent and is unstable,

original: res 'ga' dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa de ci las yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: res 'ga' dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa de ci las yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: because it is sometimes observed.

original: de ni gtan du ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni gtan du ba yin te /
translated: It is permanent,

original: rgyu la ste kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu la ste kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: because of the cause, i.e., the origin.

original: gegs byed pa ni 'gal ba can gyi lam mo //
analyzed: gegs byed pa ni 'gal ba can gyi lam mo //
translated: The obstruction is the path that is incompatible with it.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the incompleteness of the cooperating causes.

original: 'dis ni rgyu med pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu med pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is causeless.

original: de ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa yang 'gog pa nyid @335b ces bstan par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni da ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa yang 'gog pa nyid @335b ces bstan par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni da ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the truth of cessation is also taught as cessation.

original: 'dus byas pa can gyi phung po'i ngo bo gang yin pa de rgyu tshang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa can gyi phung po'i ngo bo gang yin pa de rgyu tshang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Whatever is the nature of the conditioned aggregates, is that not endowed with complete causes, etc.?

original: ji ltar 'di 'gog pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di 'gog pa yin /
translated: How can it be cessation?

original: 'gog pa yin no /
analyzed: 'gog pa yin no /
translated: It is cessation.

original: ji ltar 'khor ba pa yin snyam du sems pa ni 'khor phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba pa yin snyam du sems pa ni 'khor phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can it be in samsara?

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma 'gegs pa'o //
translated: No, is the negation of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'dod pa'i phyir te 'khor ba pa gang yin pa de grol ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir te 'khor ba pa gang yin pa de grol ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Because of the assertion that whatever is in samsara is not liberated. This is the assertion.

original: 'khor ba pa dang 'gog pa yin pa ni skad cig ma la ltos nas 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa dang 'gog pa yin pa ni skad cig ma la ltos nas 'gal ba yin la /
translated: Samsara and cessation are contradictory in terms of momentariness.

original: rgyun la ltos nas 'gal ba ma grub par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun la ltos nas 'gal ba ma grub par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that they are not contradictory in terms of a continuum is:

original: ma grub phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not established.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma can du gyur pa ni 'khor ba pa yin te /üîΩrgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma can du gyur pa ni 'khor ba pa yin te / rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one called ‚Äúself‚Äù is a samsara, because it has a prior and subsequent part.üîΩIt is not a samsara, because it is free from that.

original: 'khor ba pa ma yin pa ni de dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa ma yin pa ni de dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: This is established.

original: 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist anywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad cig ma la ltos nas 'gal ba nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad cig ma la ltos nas 'gal ba nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the contradiction in terms of momentariness.üîΩHowever, the demonstration that the contradiction is not established in terms of a continuum is:

original: 'on kyang sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba nyid rgyun la ltos nas ni 'gal ba mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩma grub phyir zhes bya ba nyid kyi don yang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba nyid rgyun la ltos nas ni 'gal ba mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa yin no // ma grub phyir zhes bya ba nyid kyi don yang bstan pa ni /
translated: because it is not established.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúbecause it is not established‚Äù is also demonstrated:

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ultimately.

original: don dam par yongs su dpyad pa 'khor ba pa nyid ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: don dam par yongs su dpyad pa 'khor ba pa nyid ma grub pa yin la /
translated: But in ultimate reality, the one who cycles is not established through thorough investigation.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'khor ba pa'i phung po ni sdug bsngal nyid yin pa la 'gal ba med do //üîΩgal te gzhan bcings pa yin la gzhan grol ba yin na gzhan 'ga' zhig gi rgyud dam /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'khor ba pa'i phung po ni sdug bsngal nyid yin pa la 'gal ba med do // gal te gzhan bcings pa yin la gzhan grol ba yin na gzhan 'ga' zhig gi rgyud dam /
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that the aggregates of the one who cycles are suffering in conventional reality.üîΩIf one who is bound is different from one who is liberated, then the continuum of one who is bound or one who is liberated would not be the same.

original: gzhan yang bcings pa dang grol pa dag la gnas pa ma yin pa de lta na chad pa dang rgyu med par smra ba dag yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcings pa dang grol pa dag la gnas pa ma yin pa de lta na chad pa dang rgyu med par smra ba dag yin te /
translated: In that case, they would be nihilists and proponents of causelessness.

original: skad cig snga ma ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gags pa yin la /
analyzed: skad cig snga ma ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gags pa yin la /
translated: Because the previous moment ceases in all its aspects,

original: phyi ma yang rgyu med pas mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma yang rgyu med pas mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the subsequent moment would not arise without a cause.

original: de ltar yongs su shes na rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa de lta na chad pa dang rgyu med par smra bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su shes na rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa de lta na chad pa dang rgyu med par smra bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one fully understands this, then one who is realized would not be a nihilist or a proponent of causelessness.

original: drang srong chen pos gsungs pa yang don med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te bcings pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: drang srong chen pos gsungs pa yang don med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te bcings pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that the great sages‚Äô teachings would be meaningless is shown:

original: 'jig rten pa'i bzang po mang po bdag mi 'dod pa la nub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bzang po mang po bdag mi 'dod pa la nub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúthe bound one‚Äù is liberated, then the many worldly goods that the self does not desire would be lost.

original: rgyu mtshan gang gis gang la yang 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dpe mang po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang gis gang la yang 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dpe mang po bstan pa yin no //
translated: For what reason? Because there is no engagement in anything.

original: bdag tu smra ba @336a * //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba @336a * //
translated: The proponent of self

original: yang bdag yod pa kho nas 'jug pa dang ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang bdag yod pa kho nas 'jug pa dang ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: also does not engage in or turn away from anything only because the self exists.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de'i bskyed pa yin na de 'di ni bdag med par smra ba la mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bskyed pa yin na de 'di ni bdag med par smra ba la mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is generated by that, then that is similar to the proponent of selflessness.

original: ji srid bdag chags te /
analyzed: ji srid bdag chags te /
translated: As long as the self is attached,

original: chags pa'i snying po can gyi shes pa ji srid du bcom par ma gyur pa de srid du bdag sdug bsngal can 'khor ba par sgro btags nas ni kun du btags nas so //
analyzed: chags pa'i snying po can gyi shes pa ji srid du bcom par ma gyur pa de srid du bdag sdug bsngal can 'khor ba par sgro btags nas ni kun du btags nas so //
translated: as long as the mind that has the essence of attachment is not destroyed, the self that is imputed to be a suffering transmigrator is imputed.

original: yongs su gdung ba ni sdug bsngal bas gnas pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba ni sdug bsngal bas gnas pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: One is tormented by suffering, and one is tormented by the suffering of others.

original: de nas sdug bsngal de gzhom pa'i don du thabs rjes su sgrub pas dkrigs pa ni bde bar gnas pa nyid 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal de gzhom pa'i don du thabs rjes su sgrub pas dkrigs pa ni bde bar gnas pa nyid 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: One is not tormented by the suffering of others, and one is not tormented by one‚Äôs own suffering.

original: de'i phyir bdag la chags pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na log par sgro 'dogs pa gzhom pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni drang srong chen pos gsungs pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la chags pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na log par sgro 'dogs pa gzhom pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni drang srong chen pos gsungs pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, the one who is engaged in the destruction of the error of self-attachment, which is the characteristic of self-love, is engaged in the practice of the great sages.

original: grol po med na yang zhes bya ba ni bdag med kyang ngo //
analyzed: grol po med na yang zhes bya ba ni bdag med kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven without a self‚Äù means even without a self.

original: de'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the practice of pure action is not fruitless.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the point.

original: 'on te de lta bu zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te de kho na nyid mthong ba po ni don byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te de lta bu zhes bya ba'o // gal te de kho na nyid mthong ba po ni don byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it is like this‚Äù means if it is like this.

original: rang gi don la 'jug pa ma yin gyi gzhan gyi don kho na la 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: rang gi don la 'jug pa ma yin gyi gzhan gyi don kho na la 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the one who sees reality is engaged in the welfare of others, not in his own welfare, because his purpose is fulfilled,üîΩthen

original: 'di'i ched du lam 'di kho pos bstan par bya'o zhes rtogs par mi byed na ji ltar 'bad pa byed pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩ'on te gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ched du lam 'di kho pos bstan par bya'o zhes rtogs par mi byed na ji ltar 'bad pa byed pa yin snyam du sems pa ni / 'on te gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not think, For this purpose I will teach this path, how can one make an effort?üîΩ But if, etc.

original: kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: The expression conventionally, existence means

original: slob ma la rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: slob ma la rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: that the disciple is perfected.

original: ji ltar don dam pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ston pa po rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ston pa po rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How can there be the conventional of the ultimate? means that the teacher is perfected.

original: re zhig slob ma yang ston pa po bdag nyid la yang gcig yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩgcig nyid kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩston pa po ni rnam par rtog pa med kyang snga ma'i shugs kyis 'jug pa ni de kho na nyid du gcig pa nyid dam /üîΩtha snyad du yang mthong ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig slob ma yang ston pa po bdag nyid la yang gcig yin par bstan pa ni / gcig nyid kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'o // ston pa po ni rnam par rtog pa med kyang snga ma'i shugs kyis 'jug pa ni de kho na nyid du gcig pa nyid dam / tha snyad du yang mthong ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the disciple is taught that the one is itself the conventional.

original: ji ltar de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teacher, although without conceptualization, engages by the momentum of the former, but that one is not seen even conventionally, much less in reality. This is taught by How can that one, etc.?

original: ston pa po la ltos nas 'bad pa po'i rtogs pa yang rang rig pa tsam ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ston pa po la ltos nas 'bad pa po'i rtogs pa yang rang rig pa tsam ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In dependence on the teacher, the realization of the one who strives is taught to be just self-awareness, free from attachment.

original: 'bad pa'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Striving‚Äù is also like that.

original: sa bon la sogs pa la rtog pa med kyang myu gu 'byung ba ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba las kyang sngon gyi 'du byed las tha @336b snyad 'byung ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa la rtog pa med kyang myu gu 'byung ba ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba las kyang sngon gyi 'du byed las tha @336b snyad 'byung ba bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as a sprout arises from a seed, etc., even though it is not conceptual, in the same way, even from the non-conceptual, the conventions of prior formative forces arise.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa yang 'bras bu nyid ni rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa tshad ma ma yin par rtogs pa ni yod min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa yang 'bras bu nyid ni rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa tshad ma ma yin par rtogs pa ni yod min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The non-completion of cause and effect is also taught to be the effect, but the understanding that it is not a valid cognition other than conceptual is ‚Äúnon-existent.‚Äù

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog go //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog go //
translated: ‚Äú Fault‚Äù is conceptual.

original: skad cig ma rig pa mngon sum ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i snying rje dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi 'jug par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma rig pa mngon sum ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i snying rje dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi 'jug par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The momentariness of direct perception is taught to be the engagement of compassion and conceptualization, whether complete or incomplete.

original: khas blangs nas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and having promised,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rjes 'gro ba ji srid par bzhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rjes 'gro ba ji srid par bzhugs pa yin la /
translated: The Lord Buddhas remain as long as the world exists, out of compassion.

original: nyan thos rnams ni lus kyi dus nyung zad pa yin yang /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni lus kyi dus nyung zad pa yin yang /
translated: The Sravakas, although they have little time left in their bodies,

original: tshe ring por 'phel ba'i las yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshe ring por 'phel ba'i las yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: have the karma to extend their lives.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid rgol ba ni /üîΩdam pa'i don rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid rgol ba ni / dam pa'i don rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This verse is a challenge.üîΩThe meaning of the verse is applied to the reply.

original: 'di nyid la lan 'debs pa nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i don la sbyor bar byed pa ni dpyod pa'i yul can gyi shes pa de rtogs pa ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid la lan 'debs pa nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i don la sbyor bar byed pa ni dpyod pa'i yul can gyi shes pa de rtogs pa ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The cognition that has an object of investigation is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de las yang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsags pa'i tshe 'phel bar byed pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid la ltos nas so //
analyzed: de las yang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsags pa'i tshe 'phel bar byed pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid la ltos nas so //
translated: And again, in the three incalculable aeons, the accumulation of merit that increases life is possessed by the Blessed One himself.

original: yang na las kyis zhes rnam par brtag par rigs pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang na las kyis zhes rnam par brtag par rigs pa yin pa ni /
translated: Or else, it is reasonable to imagine that it is by karma.

original: ji ltar rgyal po skye dgu la //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po skye dgu la //
translated: Just as a king is to his subjects,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: so is the bodhisattva to sentient beings.

original: rang rgyud la ni bu la'o //
analyzed: rang rgyud la ni bu la'o //
translated: He is like a father to his children.

original: brtson ldan ni rjes su ston pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: brtson ldan ni rjes su ston pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Endowed with effort means endowed with teaching and so on.

original: 'dod bzhin pa'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams rnams yin la /
analyzed: 'dod bzhin pa'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams rnams yin la /
translated: The result that is desired is the merits.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mtha' mi mnga' bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mtha' mi mnga' bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the Blessed One is inexhaustible.

original: smon lam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The prayer isüîΩthe mere desire for the accomplishment of the continuum to be without end.

original: rgyun mtha' med par 'grub pa kho nar 'dod pa nyid ni las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun mtha' med par 'grub pa kho nar 'dod pa nyid ni las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the result of karma is just the desire.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sdug bsngal can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa'o //üîΩgal te las kyi zhes bya ba'i rgol ba la lhan cig byed pa zad phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sdug bsngal can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa'o // gal te las kyi zhes bya ba'i rgol ba la lhan cig byed pa zad phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin la /
translated: Such a form means the superimposition of identity in the statement, ‚ÄúMy suffering. ‚ÄùüîΩIf it is argued that karma is exhausted due to the exhaustion of the cooperating causes, the response is that

original: 'on te dgra bcom pa'i las la nus pa med na zhes bya ba la ni 'phangs ba ldog med ces bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: 'on te dgra bcom pa'i las la nus pa med na zhes bya ba la ni 'phangs ba ldog med ces bya ba 'dis so //
translated: if the karma of an arhat has no power, the response is that the projected cannot be reversed.

original: gal te brtse ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can mthong ba sgrub pa las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can mthong ba sgrub pa las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ma yin nam /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs love not a reason for the result of practice, seeing sentient beings through being free from attachment?‚Äù

original: brjod pa ni sdug bsngal shes la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni sdug bsngal shes la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúKnowing suffering.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal shes na zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi rol gyi rgyu bstan pa @337a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal shes na zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi rol gyi rgyu bstan pa @337a * //
translated: By this, ‚Äúknowing the suffering of others,‚Äù the external cause is taught.

original: yin no // 'grel pa mdzad pas ni sred pa med par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: yin no // 'grel pa mdzad pas ni sred pa med par brjod pa yin la /
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚Äúwithout craving.‚Äù

original: des na 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba ni sdang ba can ma yin la /
analyzed: des na 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba ni sdang ba can ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúwithout contradiction‚Äù means not being hostile.

original: sred pa dang bcas pa ni 'ga' zhig tu de la gnod par byed pa la sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang bcas pa ni 'ga' zhig tu de la gnod par byed pa la sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having craving, one may be hostile to someone who harms it in some way.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi mnga' bar bstan pa ni snga ma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi mnga' bar bstan pa ni snga ma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This teaches the absence of counteragents.

original: nang gi rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The internal cause is taught.

original: dngos chos zhes bya bas ni 'dod pa dang gti mug la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: dngos chos zhes bya bas ni 'dod pa dang gti mug la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa nyid du'o //
translated: By ‚Äúreal thing,‚Äù it is taught that it is independent of desire, ignorance, and so on.

original: sems can rjes 'brel can ma yin //
analyzed: sems can rjes 'brel can ma yin //
translated: It is not associated with sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can du lta ba la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can du lta ba la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not based on the view of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gsum ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo yin no //
translated: The three kinds of suffering are the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of suffering.

original: mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni de rnams bdag kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin par ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni de rnams bdag kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin par ro //
translated: The equality is that they are just the self and not anything else.

original: sems can thams cad la rtag tu byams pa'i sems ni bdag go zhes sam /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rtag tu byams pa'i sems ni bdag go zhes sam /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am always loving toward all sentient beings‚Äù is the self.

original: 'on te bdag nyid yin pa med kyang bu sdug la ma'i tshig rtsub bzhin du ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid yin pa med kyang bu sdug la ma'i tshig rtsub bzhin du ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, if there is no self, how does it function like the harsh words of a mother to her beloved son?

original: sems can mthong ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can mthong ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The seeing of sentient beings is the cause of cyclic existence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: Is it not the cause of suffering?

original: de ltar bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like a mother‚Äôs harsh words to her beloved son.

original: brtse ba ni sems can du lta ba dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: brtse ba ni sems can du lta ba dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni ;
translated: The object of compassion is taught to be contrary to the view of sentient beings.

original: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is,üîΩbecause affection is by nature attachment, even though there is no attachment to the self, there is attachment to the self in sentient beings.

original: brtse ba ni chags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag la chags pa med kyang sems can rnams la bdag gi bar chags pa yin pa'i phyir de med pa'i ngo bo ni 'di'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te 'dod
analyzed: brtse ba ni chags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag la chags pa med kyang sems can rnams la bdag gi bar chags pa yin pa'i phyir de med pa'i ngo bo ni 'di'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te 'dod
translated: Therefore, the absence of that is not the absence of attachment.

original: chags dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that, thenüîΩattachment is attachment to the self or to what is related to the self.

original: bdag la'am de dang 'brel pa can yang rung ba la chags pa ni 'dod chags yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag la'am de dang 'brel pa can yang rung ba la chags pa ni 'dod chags yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught by

original: de bdag min pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bdag min pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not the self.

original: bdag dang 'brel pa can gyi bde ba sgrub pa nyid kyis sems can gyi phung po dang gzur ba la ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa can gyi bde ba sgrub pa nyid kyis sems can gyi phung po dang gzur ba la ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that the self is not the cause of the attainment of pleasure related to the self, but the collection of sentient beings is.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu na ni gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu na ni gzhan gyi ste /
translated: The cause of suffering is other.

original: reg pa ni 'dzin pa yin la de nyid 'ba' zhig na de tsam ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni 'dzin pa yin la de nyid 'ba' zhig na de tsam ste /
translated: Contact is grasping, and that alone is just that.

original: sems can la chags ba tsam ni bdag dang 'brel pa dang bral ba'i brtse ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can la chags ba tsam ni bdag dang 'brel pa dang bral ba'i brtse ba yin no //
translated: Attachment to sentient beings is the affection of being related to the self and being separated from it.

original: gal te yang bde ba dang 'brel pa can nyid kyis bdag tu mi 'dzin pa yang byed pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi bde ba rnams la bdag tu sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba @337b kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gal te yang bde ba dang 'brel pa can nyid kyis bdag tu mi 'dzin pa yang byed pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi bde ba rnams la bdag tu sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba @337b kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If one thinks that the self is imputed to the happiness of others because of the mere fact of being related to happiness,

original: gal te bdag gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúIf it is mine, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag la bde ba gnas pa yin na nges par bdag tu sgro 'dogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag la bde ba gnas pa yin na nges par bdag tu sgro 'dogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If the happiness of others were to be related to the self, then it would be taught that the self would certainly be imputed to it.

original: gal te bdag don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúIf it is for the sake of the self, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan la gnas pa yin na cis bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan la gnas pa yin na cis bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it were related to the self, then why would the self be imputed to it?

original: gzhan don tsam la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan don tsam la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúIf it is merely for the sake of another, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ched ka che ba ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar ched ka che ba ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it not a great purpose?

original: rgyal po'i dpe zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpe zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúIf it is like the example of a king, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is engaged in the sake of others.

original: rnam rtog mi mnga' ba yang sngon gyi mdzad pa'i shugs kyis 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam rtog mi mnga' ba yang sngon gyi mdzad pa'i shugs kyis 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the absence of conceptualization is due to the force of previous performance is:

original: snga ma snga ma las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: from the previous one.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: That very thing is clarified:

original: yod min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: not existing.

original: mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the object of direct perception.

original: gnas pa ma yin pa ni sems can gyi don gyis stong ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin pa ni sems can gyi don gyis stong ba nyid du'o //
translated: Not remaining is due to the emptiness of the purpose of sentient beings.

original: khyed cag ces bya ba ni 'khor ba pa'o //
analyzed: khyed cag ces bya ba ni 'khor ba pa'o //
translated: You is the transmigrator.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa kho na ste /
translated: Delusion is only conceptualization.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: bdag la gnod pa byed pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni zhe sdang yin pa la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i snying po can gyis rgyab kyis phyogs pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa byed pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni zhe sdang yin pa la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i snying po can gyis rgyab kyis phyogs pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Turning one's back on harm to oneself is aversion. Even though one does not turn one's back on the essence of the view of self and mine,

original: phyogs pa tsam yod pa yin no zhes zer ba la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs pa tsam yod pa yin no zhes zer ba la bstan pa ni /
translated: there is merely turning one's back on the harm of others. The teaching on that is:

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: from seeing impurity, etc.

original: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of hatred‚Äù means

original: zhe sdang gi yul gcig la kun du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi yul gcig la kun du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is connected with a single object of hatred.

original: 'di la yang /üîΩbyams sogs rmongs dang 'gal med phyir //
analyzed: 'di la yang / byams sogs rmongs dang 'gal med phyir //
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩBecause it is not incompatible with delusion,

original: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod min //
analyzed: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod min //
translated: it is not a complete remedy for hatred.

original: zhes 'chang par 'gyur ba'i lan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes 'chang par 'gyur ba'i lan bstan pa ni /
translated: The answer to this is:

original: mi sdug pa bsgom pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgom pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThrough the cultivation of the meditation on the impurity of the body.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba la yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba la yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
translated: Why is it not the same with the view of impermanence, etc.?

original: bdag yod na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúWhen there is a self.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid du lta bar 'khrul pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du lta bar 'khrul pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The contradiction with the error of the view of impermanence is shown:

original: gang gi tshe rgyu la rag las pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu la rag las pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is dependence on a cause.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those who are free from passion do not have the view of a self,

original: bdag tu lta ba'i snying po can gyi zhe sdang mi srid de //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i snying po can gyi zhe sdang mi srid de //
translated: hatred, which has the view of a self as its core, is impossible for them.

original: de'i phyir de rnams zhe sdang dang ldan pa can yin gyi snying rje ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams zhe sdang dang ldan pa can yin gyi snying rje ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that they are not compassionate because they are full of hatred:üîΩ‚ÄúBecause they are not compassionate, they are not compassionate.‚Äù

original: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba ste /üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba ste / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The root of faults is ignorance.

original: nyes rgyu la ni gnod par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: nyes rgyu la ni gnod par byed pa la'o //
translated: The cause of faults is that which injures.

original: nyes med ni nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩgal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i @338a * //
analyzed: nyes med ni nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o // gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i @338a * //
translated: The absence of faults is the absence of faults.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa yin na /
translated: If the Bhagavat remains for as long as cyclic existence exists,

original: lus kyi 'ching ba yod pa'i phyir ma grol bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgal te 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'ching ba yod pa'i phyir ma grol bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni / gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then he is not liberated, because he has the bondage of a body.üîΩIf the Bhagavat remains for as long as cyclic existence exists, then he is not liberated, because he has the bondage of a body.

original: thugs rjes 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i sku mnga' nas yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma spangs pa yin pa'i phyir thugs grol ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thugs rjes 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i sku mnga' nas yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma spangs pa yin pa'i phyir thugs grol ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavat has a body that remains for as long as cyclic existence exists due to his compassion, and he is also completely free of the defilements of attachment and so on.

original: nyes pa dang bral ba'i thugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bral ba'i thugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavat has a mind that is completely free of faults.üîΩHe is not without liberation.

original: grol med ma yin zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la ltos nas grol ba med pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang grol ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: grol med ma yin zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la ltos nas grol ba med pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang grol ba kho na yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat is not without liberation, but he is completely liberated.

original: ma grol ba'i ngo bo ni 'di yin te sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i phung po rnams zad pa yin na gzhan dag mtshams sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: ma grol ba'i ngo bo ni 'di yin te sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i phung po rnams zad pa yin na gzhan dag mtshams sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The nature of not being liberated is as follows: If the aggregates that were previously formed were exhausted, then others would be connected.

original: 'di yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga'o //
translated: But this is not the case for the Lord Buddha.

original: de'i phyir ma grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma grol ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not not liberated.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mtshams sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin yang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mtshams sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin yang /
translated: Moreover, although bodhisattvas are connected,

original: snying rje'i dbang gis nyes pa med pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis nyes pa med pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: they are not at fault because of the power of compassion.

original: 'khor ba ba'i 'gro ba lta bu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba ba'i 'gro ba lta bu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that they are not like transmigrating beings.

original: nus pa ma zad pa ste /üîΩsnga ma zad kyang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir bzhugs pa ni 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa ma zad pa ste / snga ma zad kyang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir bzhugs pa ni 'tsho ba'o //
translated: They are not exhausted in their ability,üîΩbecause although the former are exhausted, others arise.

original: yang na snga ma ni nyan thos la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang na snga ma ni nyan thos la ltos pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the former is in relation to the sravakas,

original: phyi ma ni bcom ldan 'das la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bcom ldan 'das la ltos pa'o //
translated: and the latter is in relation to the Lord.

original: 'du byed kyi sgra ni dge ba'i gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sgra ni dge ba'i gnas pa yin no //
translated: The term formation refers to virtuous abiding.

original: 'du byed pa yod pa dang med pa dag kho nas gnas pa dang gnas pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed pa yod pa dang med pa dag kho nas gnas pa dang gnas pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not only the existence and nonexistence of compositional activity that are the causes of abiding and non-abiding, respectively.

original: snying rje yod pa dang med pa dag las kyang 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snying rje yod pa dang med pa dag las kyang 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is also taught that they arise from the existence and nonexistence of compassion:

original: dman pa nyid phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dman pa nyid phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of inferiority.

original: sems can gzhan gyi ngo bor ni gzhan gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi ngo bor ni gzhan gyi dbang gis so //
translated: In the form of other sentient beings, due to the power of others.

original: bdag tu lta ba kho na gti mug ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba kho na gti mug ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the view of the transitory collection that is ignorance.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa las de med kyang gti mug khas len pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa las de med kyang gti mug khas len pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Because it is accepted that stream-enterers have ignorance, even though they do not have that view.üîΩIf you think that, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: gal te lam gyi nus pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te lam gyi nus pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is the power of the path,

original: 'di la rgol ba rjes su brjod nas lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la rgol ba rjes su brjod nas lan brjod pa ni /
translated: Having stated the opponent‚Äôs response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba yod kyang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba yod kyang /
translated: Even though stream-enterers have the innate view of a self,

original: gti mug gzhan du yod par rtog pa la tshad ma med do zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩlhan cig skyes pa ma spangs phyir //
analyzed: gti mug gzhan du yod par rtog pa la tshad ma med do zhes bstan pa ni / lhan cig skyes pa ma spangs phyir //
translated: there is no valid cognition to conceive that other ignorance exists.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is taught by the lines:üîΩBecause the innate is not abandoned.

original: bdag tu lta ba yang mngon par sbyangs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis spang bya yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba yang mngon par sbyangs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis spang bya yin gyi /
translated: The view of self is abandoned by the path of stream-entry,

original: lhan cig skyes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the innate view of self.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gnyis po 'di @338b ni gti mug gzhan du rtog pa 'joms par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gnyis po 'di @338b ni gti mug gzhan du rtog pa 'joms par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, these two aspects are the destroyers of the other-dependent conceptualization of delusion.

original: dbang po rnon po'i yang rnon po kha cig ni dang po'i lam nyid du gti mug gnyi ga spangs pas nyams su myong ba yin pas sred pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i yang rnon po kha cig ni dang po'i lam nyid du gti mug gnyi ga spangs pas nyams su myong ba yin pas sred pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Some who are of sharp faculties abandon both aspects of delusion in the first path itself, and thus are taught to be without craving.

original: spangs na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spangs na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf abandoned‚Äù means ‚Äúif abandoned in the first path.‚Äù

original: lam gyi dang po la gsal po ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi dang po la gsal po ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that they are not clear in the first path.

original: bde ba mthong ba tsam nyid la //
analyzed: bde ba mthong ba tsam nyid la //
translated: ‚ÄúMerely seeing happiness‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: means that they are not clear.

original: bzlog pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is selflessness.

original: bstan pa ni chen por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni chen por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTeaching‚Äù means ‚Äúgreat teaching.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa'i lam nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni goms pa las byung ba'i bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni goms pa las byung ba'i bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the path of cultivation‚Äù means by the teaching that arises from cultivation.

original: gang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po'i yang rnon po ste /
analyzed: gang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po'i yang rnon po ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy whose desire‚Äù refers to those of sharp faculties who are even sharper.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught:

original: shes rab rnon po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnon po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those of sharp wisdom.‚Äù

original: mngon par sbyangs pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos po med na rgyu dang rnam pa dag gis tha mi dad pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par sbyangs pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos po med na rgyu dang rnam pa dag gis tha mi dad pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If the innate is absent due to thorough training, it is taught that it is not different in terms of its cause and aspect.

original: gal te sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the innate view of sentient beings is absent, the innate view of the self is also absent.

original: rnam pa tha mi dad kyang bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid kyis rgyu nye bar ston pa po tha dad pa las lhan cig skyes pa tha dad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa tha mi dad kyang bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid kyis rgyu nye bar ston pa po tha dad pa las lhan cig skyes pa tha dad par bstan pa ni /
