translated: Although the aspect is not different, it is taught that the innate is different due to the difference in the cause that is the mere latent state.

original: bde bar gyur ba 'am zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gyur ba 'am zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That is taught:üîΩ‚ÄúIf there is no innate view of sentient beings, is there an innate view of the self?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du mngon par sbyangs pa'i las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par sbyangs pa'i las ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is not the case that the innate is absent due to the thorough training in the path.

original: de med kyang bstan bcos shes pa rnams dang rgyun du zhugs pa'ang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang bstan bcos shes pa rnams dang rgyun du zhugs pa'ang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even without that, there are those who know the treatises and those who are stream enterers.

original: 'on te de rnams nye bar ston pa med pas bdag go zhes bya ba kho nar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'on te de rnams nye bar ston pa med pas bdag go zhes bya ba kho nar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: But if they are not taught, then it is not the case that ‚ÄúI‚Äù is just a name.

original: ngang zhes mthong ba med par ni de rnams kyi bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa'i bdag la chags pa nyid nyams su myong ba grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngang zhes mthong ba med par ni de rnams kyi bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa'i bdag la chags pa nyid nyams su myong ba grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is established as the experience of attachment to the self that is the aspect of the view of the self of those.

original: chags pa nyams su myong ba la byed pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩbdag la sred pa med par yang //
analyzed: chags pa nyams su myong ba la byed pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags yin par bstan pa ni / bdag la sred pa med par yang //
translated: The teaching that the experience of attachment is a reason for the effect is

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven without craving for a self.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i dbye ba nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye ba nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the divisions of the cause is

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthrough the power of beginningless latent propensities.‚ÄùüîΩSince the connate is not abandoned at the beginning of the path, there is no liberation.

original: lam gyi dang po la lhan cig skyes pa ma spangs pas thar pa ma yin zhes zer bas thar pa la nyon mongs pa med par brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi dang po la lhan cig skyes pa ma spangs pas thar pa ma yin zhes zer bas thar pa la nyon mongs pa med par brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that this is a statement that there is no affliction in liberation is

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this . . .‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra ba yongs su mgu ba med pas gya nom pa ma yin pa'i thar pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba yongs su mgu ba med pas gya nom pa ma yin pa'i thar pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not a liberation that is excellent, it is not a liberation that is delightful.

original: de'i phyir bdag khas len pa nyid gya nom pa'i thar pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag khas len pa nyid gya nom pa'i thar pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the one who thinks that the acceptance of a self is an excellent liberation

original: gal te bdag yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is one who thinks, ‚ÄúIf there were a self. . . ‚Äù

original: bdag khas len na thar pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag khas len na thar pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation that if one accepts a self, it is not liberation is

original: sdug bsngal skye @339a * //üîΩba'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye @339a * // ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of suffering. . . ‚Äù

original: 'khor ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba skye ba'o //
translated: Samsara is the arising of suffering.

original: bcings pa dang thar pa dag gis bdag dang 'brel pa ni rgyu nyid kho na yin la /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa dag gis bdag dang 'brel pa ni rgyu nyid kho na yin la /
translated: The connection of the self with bondage and liberation is only a cause.

original: de ni rtag pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa la mi srid do //
translated: And that is impossible for the permanent.

original: 'du ba dang phrad pa dag kyang de yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag la khyad par med pas med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'du ba dang phrad pa dag kyang de yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag la khyad par med pas med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Since there is no difference between the times of the existence and nonexistence of the self, the connection and contact are nonexistent.

original: / rtogs pa dang ldan pa yang rmongs pa'i dbang gis byed pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: / rtogs pa dang ldan pa yang rmongs pa'i dbang gis byed pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that even the one who is endowed with understanding acts through the power of delusion.üîΩThe explanation that the self is not the object of the view of the self is

original: 'on te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if this. . . ‚Äù

original: bdag shes pa ni de nyid shes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag shes pa ni de nyid shes pa yin te /
translated: The self is known as the knower of reality.

original: rmongs pa'i dus na gal te med pa yin na mi dmigs pa nyid 'di'i med pa sgrub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i dus na gal te med pa yin na mi dmigs pa nyid 'di'i med pa sgrub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it does not exist at the time of delusion, the non-apprehension of it is taught to be the proof of its non-existence:

original: de'i tshe bdag nyid ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyid ces bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, it is said to be the self.‚Äù

original: / de'i rang bzhin ni gti mug nyid do //
analyzed: / de'i rang bzhin ni gti mug nyid do //
translated: Its nature is delusion itself.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang gti mug gis ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang gti mug gis ma yin te /
translated: Suffering is not due to delusion,

original: 'on kyang las kyis bstan pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang las kyis bstan pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: but rather it is taught to be due to karma.

original: 'on te bdag nyid shes kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid shes kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúeven though the self is known,‚Äù

original: rnam par rtag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir bcings pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir bcings pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: because the view of the self is untenable, it is taught that it is not bound:

original: gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that ‚Äòthis‚Äô . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dngos po med kyang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i rang bzhin med pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po med kyang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i rang bzhin med pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Even though the nature of another does not exist, the nature of suffering does not exist.

original: rig pa ma yin pas bdag dang bdag ces bya ba'i 'khrul pa ma gtogs pa'i bdag rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pas bdag dang bdag ces bya ba'i 'khrul pa ma gtogs pa'i bdag rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the error of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù the self is not reasonable.

original: gal te yod pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtha' thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtha' thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If you say that the end of the existent self is the same as the end of all,

original: de'i rang bzhin rig ce na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rig ce na /
translated: then you must know its nature.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: dga' ba'i ngo bo tshangs pa yin //
analyzed: dga' ba'i ngo bo tshangs pa yin //
translated: Brahma is the essence of joy.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gal te thar kyang bde nyid la /
analyzed: gal te thar kyang bde nyid la /
translated: If you are liberated, you are happy.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: bdag med pa khas len pa gya nom pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa khas len pa gya nom pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of selflessness is taught to be excellent:

original: yongs su tshim pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the complete satisfaction of the self.

original: non pa med pa ni bdag dang bdag gir sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: non pa med pa ni bdag dang bdag gir sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not overwhelmed, because there is no superimposition of self and what belongs to the self.

original: mi rigs pa med pa ni rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs pa med pa ni rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not improper, because there is no permanence.

original: gal te nga sngon gyur to zhes bya ba ni dper na skye bo la phan pa'i rgyal po zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: gal te nga sngon gyur to zhes bya ba ni dper na skye bo la phan pa'i rgyal po zhes bya bar ro //
translated: If you say that I existed in the past, it is like saying that I was a king who benefited beings.

original: rtag pa bzhin du brjod bya ma yin pa yang khas blangs par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa bzhin du brjod bya ma yin pa yang khas blangs par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not appropriate to accept that which is not to be expressed as if it were permanent.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is not appropriate because it contradicts reason:

original: mi rtag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúImpermanence‚Äù is stated.

original: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i rim pa dang cig car ba nyid kyis byed pa po la khyab pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyis kyang khyab pa yin zhes bya ba'i @339b don to
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i rim pa dang cig car ba nyid kyis byed pa po la khyab pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyis kyang khyab pa yin zhes bya ba'i @339b don to
translated: Since the order of the opposite of permanence, etc., and the simultaneity of the opposite of the agent are subsumed under impermanence, the meaning of ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is that they are also subsumed under impermanence.

original: // 'on te bcings pa dang thar pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid med pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: // 'on te bcings pa dang thar pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid med pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf bondage and liberation, etc.,‚Äù is the thought that the cause of the nonexistence of both is the opposite of the two.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis te bzlog pa la ni gzhan du grub pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis te bzlog pa la ni gzhan du grub pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy both natures‚Äù is the statement of the reason for the establishment of the opposite.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPermanence and impermanence‚Äù is stated.

original: mi 'jig pa 'jig pa dang 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa 'jig pa dang 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-destruction‚Äù is stated as the opposite of destruction.

original: gang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhose nature‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te kho bo cag gi 'dod pa las bzlog pa brjod par bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te kho bo cag gi 'dod pa las bzlog pa brjod par bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: If the opposite of what we assert is to be stated, it is definite that it must be stated.

original: rtag pa yin zhes bya bar brjod bya yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa yin zhes bya bar brjod bya yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is said to be permanent‚Äù teaches that it is an object of expression.

original: de ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrtag pa dang cig shos 'gal bar tshad mas grub par byed par 'dod pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'o // rtag pa dang cig shos 'gal bar tshad mas grub par byed par 'dod pas bstan pa ni /
translated: That is called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: zhig pa dang ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is established by valid cognition that destruction and non-apprehension are contradictory‚Äù teaches that he asserts that permanence and impermanence are contradictory.

original: gal te sngon mthong ba da ltar snang bzhin ba dang gcig pa nyid du de nyid yin no zhes shes bzhin du ji ltar gzhan du ma yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gal te sngon mthong ba da ltar snang bzhin ba dang gcig pa nyid du de nyid yin no zhes shes bzhin du ji ltar gzhan du ma yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúI know that what was seen before is the same as what is appearing now,‚Äù how can one think, ‚ÄúIt is not different‚Äù?

original: gcig nyid du rtogs bzhin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid du rtogs bzhin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúwhile one is understanding that it is the same‚Äù refers to that.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to what was seen.

original: gcig nyid du zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa dang / lhan cig rtogs pa de nyid 'di yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid du zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa dang / lhan cig rtogs pa de nyid 'di yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same‚Äù refers to the understanding that it is the same as what is appearing now.

original: de ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'o //
translated: That is what was seen.

original: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni med pa dang ma skyes pa'i ngo bo ni 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni med pa dang ma skyes pa'i ngo bo ni 'gal ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-understanding‚Äù refers to the contradiction between non-existence and the nature of what has not arisen.

original: mthong ba las ma rtogs pa ni mthong ba ni la rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba las ma rtogs pa ni mthong ba ni la rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúThat which is seen is not realized,‚Äù

original: 'on te gzhan rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it means that ‚Äúthat which is other is realized.‚Äù

original: lan ni des na ma rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni des na ma rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúTherefore, that which is not realized does not exist.‚Äù

original: gzhan rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: It means that ‚Äúthat which is other is the nature of realization.‚Äù

original: gcig nyid du rtogs par khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid du rtogs par khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is accepted as being the realization of one thing.

original: de zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the present.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Other‚Äù refers to realization.

original: de'i mthong ba ma rtogs pa zhes rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba ma rtogs pa zhes rgol ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument is that ‚Äúthe seeing of that is not realized.‚Äù

original: 'di yang da ltar ba nyid mthong ba yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang da ltar ba nyid mthong ba yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is also a contradiction, as indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthat seeing is present.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'o na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means that

original: snga ma gang yin pa de nyid 'di yin na /
analyzed: snga ma gang yin pa de nyid 'di yin na /
translated: if that which is past is just that which is present,

original: de la ltos nas kyang gzhan yin pa'i rang nyid kho na la ltos nas de gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ltos nas kyang gzhan yin pa'i rang nyid kho na la ltos nas de gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then in dependence on that, it is other. And in dependence on itself, it is that. The meaning is that it is other.

original: de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat also is not tenable‚Äù is the contradiction.

original: 'gal ba nyid bstan pa ni gzhan pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid bstan pa ni gzhan pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The contradiction itself is shown by ‚Äúbecause of being different.‚Äù

original: gzhan pa nyid ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid ni dbye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifference‚Äù is the distinction.

original: gal te 'di sngar mthong ba las gzhan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di sngar mthong ba las gzhan pa yin na /
translated: If this is different from what was seen before,üîΩit would not be non-different.

original: gzhan ma yin pa kho nar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa kho nar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbye ba yin te /
translated: This is the distinction.

original: gcig nyid de rtogs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan @340a * //
analyzed: gcig nyid de rtogs pa ni ma yin no // gzhan @340a * //
translated: It is not understood as the same.

original: du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù is the observation.

original: 'on te snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi khyad par tha dad pa dag la gcig tu rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni de dang ma bral bar rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi khyad par tha dad pa dag la gcig tu rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni de dang ma bral bar rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that the difference between the prior and subsequent moments is understood as the same because of being connected with that without separation,

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: then ‚Äúthe same‚Äù is the assertion.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba ni dus gcig la gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba ni dus gcig la gzhan med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeparation‚Äù is the non-existence of another at one time.

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is the objection.

original: lan ni ji ltar gcig can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ji ltar gcig can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúHow could it be the same?‚Äù

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma bral ba dang bral ba'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma bral ba dang bral ba'i ngo bo ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSo too‚Äù refers to the nature of non-separation and separation.

original: snga ma'i ngo bo dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa nyid de dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: snga ma'i ngo bo dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa nyid de dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The nature that is not in accordance with the nature and characteristics of the former is the nature that is free from that.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la rim pa med pa rim gyis 'byung bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la rim pa med pa rim gyis 'byung bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since they arise in sequence, it is not logical that they arise without sequence. This is the meaning.

original: rim pa ma yin pa yang snang bzhin pa ni dus dang yul gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩsnga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo la khyab par byed pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la /üîΩsnga phyi'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na //üîΩzhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo snang ba nyid de las gzhan pa'i snang ba yin te /
analyzed: rim pa ma yin pa yang snang bzhin pa ni dus dang yul gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir / snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo la khyab par byed pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la / snga phyi'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na // zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo snang ba nyid de las gzhan pa'i snang ba yin te /
translated: Since the non-sequential is also seen, it is not the case that the single time and place pervade the former and latter natures.üîΩThe meaning of ‚ÄúIf the former and latter natures are not realized‚Äù is that the nature that is free from the identity that possesses the former and latter natures is the appearance that is different from that.

original: nye bar snang ba'i ngo bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar snang ba'i ngo bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of the appearance that is present‚Äù is that it is the nature of the appearance that is present.

original: snga ma'i ngo bo dang ldan pa phyi ma'i ngo bo dang ldan par mthong ba'i dus su ma mthong ba ni tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: snga ma'i ngo bo dang ldan pa phyi ma'i ngo bo dang ldan par mthong ba'i dus su ma mthong ba ni tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: When the entity of the former is seen to possess the entity of the latter, the non-seeing of the former is the object of the convention of difference.

original: tha snyad de'i rgyu mtshan ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad de'i rgyu mtshan ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason for that convention is just that.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong bar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong bar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúseeing and not seeing.‚Äù

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù is the entity of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po ni bzlog pa dang 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po ni bzlog pa dang 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The object of seeing is the opposite of the opposite.

original: gcig phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúbecause of being one.‚Äù

original: rtag pa med pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa med pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that there is no permanence.üîΩThe conception ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù is the entity of the direct perception of memory.

original: de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba dang / snang bzhin pa dag la gcig tu zhen pa ni dran pa'i mngon sum gyi ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba dang / snang bzhin pa dag la gcig tu zhen pa ni dran pa'i mngon sum gyi ngo bo yin la /
translated: It is conceived as one in regard to what is seen and what is appearing.

original: dran pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i bsam pas dogs pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i bsam pas dogs pa ni /
translated: The doubt that arises from the thought ‚ÄúIt arises from the collection of memory, sense faculties, and so on‚Äù is eliminated by the following.

original: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain and again‚Äù means repeatedly.

original: lan ni / dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni / dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúBecause memory is not a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: gzung ba tsam 'dzin pa ni dran pa yin la ;
analyzed: gzung ba tsam 'dzin pa ni dran pa yin la ;
translated: Memory is the apprehension of mere objects.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case.

original: ma bzung ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ma bzung ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The thought is that even what is not apprehended is taken to be the same as what was previously and subsequently apprehended.

original: ma rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúNon-realization.‚Äù

original: 'di yang sngar mthong ba nyid kyis bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang sngar mthong ba nyid kyis bzung ba yin te /
translated: The thought is that this is also apprehended by the very seeing of what was previously seen.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same.

original: dngos po gcig yin pa dang sngar bzung ba nyid du ni bden @340b mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po gcig yin pa dang sngar bzung ba nyid du ni bden @340b mod kyi /
translated: It is true that it is the same thing and that it was previously apprehended.

original: de ni da ltar gyi dus na yod pa nyid sdang bzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni da ltar gyi dus na yod pa nyid sdang bzung ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not apprehended as existing in the present.

original: de'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgal te da ltar yod pa nyid //
analyzed: de'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni / gal te da ltar yod pa nyid //
translated: The thought is that it does not exist at that time.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúIf it exists in the present . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe thought is that it is not the case that it is not apprehended as existing in the present.

original: sngon dang phyis 'byung ba'i dus zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis 'byung ba'i dus zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no time that is called ‚Äúprevious‚Äù or ‚Äúsubsequent.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: dpyid dang dgun la sogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dpyid dang dgun la sogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: Spring and winter, etc.

original: dpyid dang 'brel pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa yin na dgun dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpyid dang 'brel pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa yin na dgun dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: If it apprehends the entity connected with spring, it does not apprehend the entity connected with winter,

original: cig car ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not simultaneous.

original: 'brel pa can ma bzung na 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa can ma bzung na 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if the connected thing is not apprehended, the connection is not apprehended.

original: de dngos po'i cha dran pa'i phyir sngar nyid bzung ba yin pas de la dran pa dang 'brel pa la tshad ma gzhan mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de dngos po'i cha dran pa'i phyir sngar nyid bzung ba yin pas de la dran pa dang 'brel pa la tshad ma gzhan mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: Since it is the entity that is remembered, it is apprehended first. Therefore, the cognition of the connection with memory is a separate valid cognition, namely, perception. Thus, it is a valid cognition that recognizes what was seen before.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is demonstrated:

original: tha dad med phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad med phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because there is no difference.

original: dngos po'i cha dran pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i cha dran pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it is just the memory of the entity.

original: snga ma 'am phyi ma rung ba mthong ba ni dus ring mo yin pas dngos po rtogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snga ma 'am phyi ma rung ba mthong ba ni dus ring mo yin pas dngos po rtogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that it does not cognize, because it is a long time since the thing was seen, whether it was seen before or after, and it lacks the capacity to cognize the thing?

original: 'on kyang rang gi dus ni yin te gcig pa nyid du sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi dus ni yin te gcig pa nyid du sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: However, you think that the time of the object is the same as the time of the cognition, because the recognition of the object is understood through the perception of the object as being the same as it was seen before.üîΩTo this, the present verse replies:

original: mthong zin nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthong zin nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe recognition of what was seen before‚Äù

original: sngar dang phyis mthong ba dag gis rang gi dus kyi ngo bo rnam par 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar dang phyis mthong ba dag gis rang gi dus kyi ngo bo rnam par 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: means that the object‚Äôs own nature at the time of the previous and later perceptions is destroyed.

original: des gnod pa'i sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni bag chags kyi nus pa la brten pa yin gyi gcig nyid du sdud pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des gnod pa'i sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni bag chags kyi nus pa la brten pa yin gyi gcig nyid du sdud pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The recognition of the object seen before is based on the potential of the latent impressions, but it is not the case that the object is included in the same time as the cognition.

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni sngar dang phyis mthong ba dag cig car rtogs pas /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni sngar dang phyis mthong ba dag cig car rtogs pas /
translated: You may think that the recognition of the object seen before is the simultaneous understanding of the object seen before and later.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: So, isn‚Äôt it the case that the previous and later perceptions understand the object?

original: de'i phyir de dag gis 'di la gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis 'di la gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, you may think that the previous and later perceptions do not invalidate each other.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But if you think that there is no contradiction,

original: snga phyi'i shes pa las she na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga phyi'i shes pa las she na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how is it that the previous and later perceptions are different?

original: shes bya bzhin du shes pa yang sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa las ngo shes pa gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes bya bzhin du shes pa yang sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa las ngo shes pa gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as there is an object of knowledge, there is also a consciousness, because it is the recognition of what was seen before.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu rtogs pa ni tshad ma las ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu rtogs pa ni tshad ma las ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the realization of the former and the latter is not by means of a valid cognition is:

original: de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the former and the latter.

original: rang rig ba la ni snga ma dang phyi ma nyid shes pa'am shes bya la mi srid par bstan pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig ba la ni snga ma dang phyi ma nyid shes pa'am shes bya la mi srid par bstan pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that the former and the latter are impossible in self-awareness or in the object of knowledge is ‚Äúthere is no realization.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi zhig pa yin yang nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir snga mas phyi ma'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhig pa yin yang nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir snga mas phyi ma'am /
translated: Even though the former is destroyed, it is apprehended by the latter.

original: des snga ma 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des snga ma 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the former is not apprehended by the latter is:

original: med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-existent is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: med pa ni 'dzin par byed pa'i dus na nye ba ma yin pa'o //üîΩsnga ma'am @341a * //
analyzed: med pa ni 'dzin par byed pa'i dus na nye ba ma yin pa'o // snga ma'am @341a * //
translated: The non-existent is not present at the time of apprehension.

original: phyi ma yang rung phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi ma yang rung phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: The former and the latter are not mutually different.

original: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that they are the same is:

original: myong ba de dag gcig yin na /üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba de dag gcig yin na /üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf those experiences are the same.‚Äù

original: gal te yang mngon sum byad pa la snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ma yin yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni ;
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum byad pa la snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ma yin yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni ;
translated: If you think that even though the prior and subsequent moments are not directly perceived, they are only perceived by conceptual cognition,üîΩthen it is said:

original: gal te snga ma nyid med na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ni mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te snga ma nyid med na // zhes bya ba'o // rnam par rtog pa ni mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa ma yin la /
translated: If the prior moment does not exist,

original: dran pa'i ngo bo ni bag chags kyi stobs kho na las dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩmngon du byed nyid ma yin pas //
analyzed: dran pa'i ngo bo ni bag chags kyi stobs kho na las dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni / mngon du byed nyid ma yin pas //
translated: Conceptual cognition does not have the nature of direct perception, and the nature of memory is taught to be the object that arises from the power of latent propensities alone.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said:üîΩBecause it is not direct perception,

original: zhen pas 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams la yod pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /üîΩlan ni sngon du byed pa nyid //
analyzed: zhen pas 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams la yod pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la / lan ni sngon du byed pa nyid //
translated: If you think that the apprehension of adherence exists only in conceptual cognitions,

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: the response is:üîΩThe prior action itself,

original: phyin ci log tu zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to adherence to error.

original: rgyu nyid ni gzung ba nyid yin la 'bras bu nyid ni 'dzin pa nyid ma yin nam rig pa shes pa bzung ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu nyid ni gzung ba nyid yin la 'bras bu nyid ni 'dzin pa nyid ma yin nam rig pa shes pa bzung ba ni /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cause itself the object of apprehension and the effect itself the apprehender? The understanding of the object of apprehension is realized as the cause itself.üîΩIt is said:

original: rgyu nyid kho nar rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kho nar rtogs pa yin //
translated: The object of apprehension is realized as the cause itself.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: de 'di ni dran pa la yang ma nyams pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de 'di ni dran pa la yang ma nyams pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: When one thinks that memory is not impaired in this way,

original: don las dran pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don las dran pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the meaning of memory is stated.

original: dran pa la ni myong ba kho na nus pa can yin te /
analyzed: dran pa la ni myong ba kho na nus pa can yin te /
translated: For memory is only capable of experience,

original: de'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is connected with the latent impressions of that. This is the meaning.

original: myong ba nus pa las byung ba'i dran pa de ni de'i bya ba'i yul tsam las zhen pa yin gyi /
analyzed: myong ba nus pa las byung ba'i dran pa de ni de'i bya ba'i yul tsam las zhen pa yin gyi /
translated: That memory which arises from the capacity of experience is only attached to the mere object of its activity,

original: snga ma nyid la sogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma nyid la sogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: not to the very same thing that existed before, etc.

original: 'di ni myong bas 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de myong ba snga mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni myong bas 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de myong ba snga mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words: ‚Äúbecause it is the apprehension of experience.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir snga ma nyid la sogs par thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma nyid la sogs par thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the very same thing that existed before, etc., is to be understood through conceptual differentiation that arises from beginningless latent impressions.

original: 'das pa mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words: ‚Äúthe manifestation of the past.‚Äù

original: 'di tsam gyis snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi rjes su 'jug pa gcig gi ngo bo bsal nas /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi rjes su 'jug pa gcig gi ngo bo bsal nas /
translated: By this much, having refuted the identity of the one who engages in the prior and subsequent states,

original: da ni snga ma dang phyi ma la gnas pa'i gcig nyid du 'dod pa tshad ma can ma yin pa'i phyir sel bar byed pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni snga ma dang phyi ma la gnas pa'i gcig nyid du 'dod pa tshad ma can ma yin pa'i phyir sel bar byed pa bstan pa ni /
translated: now, in order to refute the assertion of identity of the one who endures in the prior and subsequent states, he demonstrates the refutation, saying:

original: 'on te skye 'jig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te skye 'jig ces bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that it is the arising and ceasing,

original: 'di nyid kyi 'brel pa nyid ces bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'brel pa nyid ces bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gang tshe zhig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that it is the enduring,

original: yod pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang zhig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang zhig pa med pa ste /
translated: An existent that possesses arising does not have ceasing,

original: rab tu nyams par 'gal ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu nyams par 'gal ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is contradictory for it to be completely destroyed.

original: sngar rtogs pa'i brtan pa dang skye ba dag la yul nye ba'i mngon sum gyis bstan par mi rigs pa kho na ni brtan la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar rtogs pa'i brtan pa dang skye ba dag la yul nye ba'i mngon sum gyis bstan par mi rigs pa kho na ni brtan la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not reasonable for the prior understanding of enduring and arising to be demonstrated by direct perception that is proximate to the object, as he says: But even in enduring.

original: lam gyi zhar la zhes bya ba ni @341b lam bstan pas zhar la 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi zhar la zhes bya ba ni @341b lam bstan pas zhar la 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth mode of cessation is demonstrated as a corollary by the demonstration of the path, as he says: In the path.

original: nges par 'byung ba 'di lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba 'di lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the essential point of renunciation.

original: bstan zin zhes bya ba ni de'i gnod byed ni bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin zhes bya ba des so //
analyzed: bstan zin zhes bya ba ni de'i gnod byed ni bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin zhes bya ba des so //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù refers to the fact that the antidote to that is the vision of selflessness.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa'i chags pa gzhom par ni gnas gyur pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba goms pa las gyur pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas byas pa'i chags pa gzhom par ni gnas gyur pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba goms pa las gyur pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The transformation that is taught to overcome the attachment created by the grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the result of the cultivation of the vision of selflessness.

original: de goms pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de goms pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúThrough the cultivation of that.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa goms pa bdag tu gyur pa kho na yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa goms pa bdag tu gyur pa kho na yin yang /
translated: Just as the cultivation of the grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the cause of the ‚ÄúI‚Äù-grasping,üîΩin the same way, the cultivation of the vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of selflessness.üîΩJust as the grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the cause of the ‚ÄúI‚Äù-grasping,

original: bdag med pa dang 'gal ba can yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang 'gal ba can yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way, the vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of selflessness.

original: 'di bdag tu gyur pa yin yang bdag la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'di bdag tu gyur pa yin yang bdag la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba kho na yin na /
translated: If you think that just as the cultivation of the grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the cause of the ‚ÄúI‚Äù-grasping,üîΩin the same way, the cultivation of the vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of selflessness,

original: ji ltar gnas gyur pa yin te 'gal bar khyad par med do snyam du sems pa ni bdag gyur kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas gyur pa yin te 'gal bar khyad par med do snyam du sems pa ni bdag gyur kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then how can it be a transformation? There is no difference between the two in terms of being contradictory.

original: lam gyi skyon bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba ni skyon gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa la lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: lam gyi skyon bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba ni skyon gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa la lam lta bu'o //
translated: The faults of the path, such as the apprehension of self, are the nature of faults, but they are like the path.

original: nus pa med pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa khyab bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa med pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa khyab bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are powerless because the apprehension of self, etc. are not the lords.üîΩSince the path is the opposite of that, it is not reasonable that the faults arise when the path exists.

original: lam ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir lam yod na skyon 'byung ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba bzlog pa ni yon tan rnams la skyon yod pas gnod pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir lam yod na skyon 'byung ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba bzlog pa ni yon tan rnams la skyon yod pas gnod pa'o //
translated: The faults exist in the virtues, so they are harmful.

original: yon tan rnams ni zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa mthong ba'o //
translated: The virtues are the vision of selflessness.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ni dngos po'i yul nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ni dngos po'i yul nyid kyis so //
translated: Because they are the nature of things, they are the objects of things.

original: nyes pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The faults are the apprehension of self, etc.

original: bdag la sogs par 'jin pa yang rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs par 'jin pa yang rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The apprehension of self, etc. are also consciousness.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin la bdag med par mthong ba'i dmigs pa'i rgyu can las tha mi dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin la bdag med par mthong ba'i dmigs pa'i rgyu can las tha mi dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Because it arises from beginningless latent impressions, it has a cause. But it is not different from the cause of the object of the view of selflessness.

original: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen dag la khyad par ci yang med na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen dag la khyad par ci yang med na /
translated: If there is no difference at all between the objective condition and the dominant condition,

original: gang gis gcig gnod pa can yin la cig shos rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang ma yin zhes 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis gcig gnod pa can yin la cig shos rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang ma yin zhes 'dri ba ni /
translated: why is it asked, ‚ÄúHow is it that one is a harm and the other has a cause?‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that question is ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

original: khyad par bstan pa ni rnam shes yul 'dzin pa'i chos ni rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: khyad par bstan pa ni rnam shes yul 'dzin pa'i chos ni rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The explanation of the difference is that the nature of consciousness is to apprehend objects,

original: gnod bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not something to be harmed.

original: nya phyis 'dzin pa bzhin du yul dang bral ba 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang dngul gyi shes pa bzhin du skyes nas zhig pa yin la rang bzhin 'di ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: nya phyis 'dzin pa bzhin du yul dang bral ba 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang dngul gyi shes pa bzhin du skyes nas zhig pa yin la rang bzhin 'di ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Even though it has a cause that apprehends objects, like a mother-of-pearl shell that is apprehended as silver, it is produced and then ceases. But this nature is not like that.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: ji ltar yod de 'dzin pa dang // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba @342a * //
analyzed: ji ltar yod de 'dzin pa dang // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba @342a * //
translated: How can it exist?

original: ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba don du yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba don du yang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas will be explained‚Äù is connected with the phrase ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: 'dis kyang rnam shes la yod pa gnod bya ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rnam shes la yod pa gnod bya ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pa yin no //
translated: This passage also explains the reason why the existence of consciousness is not refuted.

original: yul la yod pa yang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul la yod pa yang bstan pa ni /
translated: The existence of objects is also taught:

original: des te yul 'di'i ste rnam shes kyi skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des te yul 'di'i ste rnam shes kyi skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object, which is the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: 'khrul pa la yang de mtshungs yin pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni yod pa'i ni bdag nyid kyi ste rang gi bdag nyid rang gi rnam pa rgod pas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang de mtshungs yin pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni yod pa'i ni bdag nyid kyi ste rang gi bdag nyid rang gi rnam pa rgod pas so //
translated: Since error is the same in both cases, the existence of consciousness is distinguished as the cause of the arising of consciousness by its own nature, that is, by its own form.

original: 'khrul pa la skyed byed yin yang rang gi bdag nyid kyi skyed byed ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la skyed byed yin yang rang gi bdag nyid kyi skyed byed ma yin no //
translated: Even though error is the cause of the arising of consciousness, it is not the cause of the arising of consciousness by its own nature.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni shes pa la yod pa'i rgyu mtshan la ltos pa sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni shes pa la yod pa'i rgyu mtshan la ltos pa sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the reason for the existence of consciousness.

original: yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù means ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa mthong ba la yang rgyu mtshan gnyis yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin kho nar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba la yang rgyu mtshan gnyis yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin kho nar bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, there are two reasons for seeing selflessness.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgrar blta bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgrar blta bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúthis also‚Äù should be supplied.

original: 'grel par yang 'di lta bur gtong ba kho nar sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩrgyu mtshan 'di gnyis dang bral ba'i 'dzin pa tsam ni gnod bya yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel par yang 'di lta bur gtong ba kho nar sbyar bar bya'o // rgyu mtshan 'di gnyis dang bral ba'i 'dzin pa tsam ni gnod bya yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In the Commentary, it should be supplied in the same way as ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúthis also.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since mere grasping, which is devoid of these two reasons, is what is to be refuted, the root text says, ‚ÄúThe other is not its nature,‚Äù and it is supplied.

original: rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba ni yul la yod pa'i rgyu mtshan med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba ni yul la yod pa'i rgyu mtshan med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Other conditions‚Äù indicates that there is no reason for the existence of the object.

original: gol 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes pa rang la yod pa'i rgyu mtshan med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gol 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes pa rang la yod pa'i rgyu mtshan med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Deviation‚Äù indicates that there is no reason for the existence of consciousness.

original: bzlog pa la rgyu mtshan 'di gnyis ci las rtogs pa yin zhes zer ba la /üîΩldog pa la ni ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa la rgyu mtshan 'di gnyis ci las rtogs pa yin zhes zer ba la / ldog pa la ni ste /
translated: What are the reasons for the reversal of these two?üîΩThe reversal is

original: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan du'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan du'o //
translated: the reason for the reversal.

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa can gyi rkyen la ltos pa de'i phyir mi brtan pa ni rang bzhin ma yin pa ste ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa can gyi rkyen la ltos pa de'i phyir mi brtan pa ni rang bzhin ma yin pa ste ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it depends on a condition that is a harm, therefore it is not stable, it is not an essence.

original: rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dpe ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dpe ni /
translated: The example of what is not an essence is

original: sbrul gyi blo bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul gyi blo bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: like the idea of a snake.

original: rtsa ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed byed kyi yul med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed byed kyi yul med par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is without a root‚Äù shows that there is no object that produces it on its own.

original: bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa rang bzhin ma yin na skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir mi skye ba kho na 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa rang bzhin ma yin na skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir mi skye ba kho na 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If the conception of a self and so on is not an essence, then because it is not produced, it would not arise at all.

original: gal te thag pa la sbrul gyi blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thag pa la sbrul gyi blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the idea of a snake‚Äù is an example.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgol ba la bshad pa ni phyogs gzhan nas bstan pa'i lan te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgol ba la bshad pa ni phyogs gzhan nas bstan pa'i lan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this regard‚Äù is explained as follows. The response is presented from another perspective.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yod pa la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir yod pa dmigs pa ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pas 'dus byas pa des nang gi 'khrul pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //üîΩde ltar ni mthong ba'i yod pa'o //üîΩde dogs pa ni des @342b bslus pa lam de'i rgyu yul la yod par bstan pa ni /üîΩ'dra ba zhes bya ba'o //

This is the explanation of the internal cause of error.üîΩThe phrase in this way, one sees existence refers to the observation of existence.üîΩThe phrase one doubts that refers to the fact that one is deceived by that ignorance. The phrase the cause of that indicates the object of that ignorance.üîΩThe phrase a semblance of that refers to the cause of error.üîΩ

original: gnas skabs de'i 'og tu da ltar yun ring por 'tsho ba nyid kyi rtags mthong ba bzhin du yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa dmigs par des te de yod par dogs pa srid pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin la des bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs de'i 'og tu da ltar yun ring por 'tsho ba nyid kyi rtags mthong ba bzhin du yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa dmigs par des te de yod par dogs pa srid pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin la des bslus pa yin no //
translated: Because it is observed that it exists at the present time, just like the sign of long life, it is possible that there is doubt about its existence, and that is inference.

original: yod pas ni da ltar ba nyid kyis dmigs pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir sngon yang byung bar gyur to zhes bya bas de yod par rjes su dpog par bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pas ni da ltar ba nyid kyis dmigs pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir sngon yang byung bar gyur to zhes bya bas de yod par rjes su dpog par bslus pa yin no //
translated: But it is deceived, because it infers the existence of the past by the existence of the present, since it is not tenable that it exists in any other way.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyis kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means in the past and future.

original: yod pa dmigs pa ni da ltar dmigs pas rgyu 'am 'bras bu nyid du srid par byed pas mi rtag pa nyid du nges bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pa ni da ltar dmigs pas rgyu 'am 'bras bu nyid du srid par byed pas mi rtag pa nyid du nges bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The observation of existence is the observation of the present, and it is not certain that it is impermanent, since it is possible that it is a cause or an effect.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni gang gi tshe sngar mthong ba'i dngos po'i bar du ma mthong la yang snang ba de'i tshe bar du yod pa srid pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du nges par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni gang gi tshe sngar mthong ba'i dngos po'i bar du ma mthong la yang snang ba de'i tshe bar du yod pa srid pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du nges par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The author of the commentary explains that when one does not see the thing that was previously seen, and yet it appears, then, because it is possible that it exists in the interval, one cannot ascertain its impermanence.

original: gang gi tshe ji srid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji srid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhen it is asked, ‚ÄòFor as long as . . .‚Äô ‚Äù

original: tha snyad pa rnams la yang so sor snang ba tha dad pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams la yang so sor snang ba tha dad pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt the conventionalists have different individual appearances?

original: bden mod kyi yod kyang tha snyad pa rnams mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi yod kyang tha snyad pa rnams mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is true, but even though they do, the conventionalists do not hold them to be supreme.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The author of the commentary explains that they do not do so because it would be pointless.

original: tha snyad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha snyad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe conventionalists . . . ‚Äù

original: 'dis ni don byed pa can gyis tshim pa'i phyir so sor snang ba tha dad pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin pa ni de kho na nyid ma mtshon pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni don byed pa can gyis tshim pa'i phyir so sor snang ba tha dad pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin pa ni de kho na nyid ma mtshon pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the reason they do not hold their individual appearances to be supreme is that they are satisfied with what is causally effective.

original: 'dra ba gzhan du 'byung ba yang rgyu yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan du 'byung ba yang rgyu yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The author of the commentary explains that the occurrence of other similar things is also a reason.

original: 'dra ba gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother like it‚Äù is the name.

original: 'dra ba nyid la gcig la sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dpe ni mtshe ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid la gcig la sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dpe ni mtshe ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example of the reason for superimposing oneness on mere similarity is ‚Äútwins.‚Äù

original: yod pa las dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa las dmigs pas zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the perception of what exists‚Äù is the name. Here, the arising of another like it is shown to be nonexistent.

original: snga mar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga mar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the former‚Äù is the name.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba med pa nyid 'dod pa'i dbye bas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba med pa nyid 'dod pa'i dbye bas bstan pa ni /
translated: The arising of another like it is shown to be nonexistent by the division of desire.

original: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother and another‚Äù is the name.

original: 'dod pa gzhan gyis 'dra ba gzhan byung ba bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan gyis 'dra ba gzhan byung ba bstan pa ni ;
translated: The arising of another like it is shown by another desire.

original: yang na me de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na me de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOr that very fire‚Äù is the name.

original: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang bas rjes su dpag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang bas rjes su dpag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is inferred by following what is seen.

original: rtsva la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyogs la me la sogs pa ci las skye ba yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyogs la me la sogs pa ci las skye ba yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: In the position that the arising of another like it is nonexistent, the arising of another like it is shown by the arising of another and another of grass and so on.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom a dissimilar type‚Äù is the name.

original: @343a * // 'dod pa 'di gnyis la brten nas 'dra ba gzhan byung bas bslus pa 'am zhes bya ba brtags pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @343a * // 'dod pa 'di gnyis la brten nas 'dra ba gzhan byung bas bslus pa 'am zhes bya ba brtags pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase or else, having arisen, it is destroyed is a hypothetical statement.

original: don byed par dmigs pa 'ba' zhig gam /
analyzed: don byed par dmigs pa 'ba' zhig gam /
translated: The only thing to be focused on is the benefit of others.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yang rung ste /
translated: The cause of non-apprehension is only the non-observation of the object, or the observation of something else that is similar to it.

original: de nyid mi mtshon pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid mi mtshon pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: But that alone is not the cause of non-apprehension.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is?

original: thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i 'du byed nyid kyang yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i 'du byed nyid kyang yin par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The formative forces of beginningless ignorance are also included.

original: de'i phyir nang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äòinternally‚Äô.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rang bzhin kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rang bzhin kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the grasping of the self also natural?

original: gang gi phyir sems nyid yul dang dus rnam par 'chad pa ma yin pa ni bdag gam gzhan pa'i phung po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems nyid yul dang dus rnam par 'chad pa ma yin pa ni bdag gam gzhan pa'i phung po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Since the mind itself is not interrupted in regard to place and time, it is not in conformity with the aggregates of self or other.

original: sems 'di'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems 'di'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says: ‚Äòthis mind‚Äô.

original: snga ma nyid dang phyi ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma nyid dang phyi ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the prior and subsequent.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: From what?

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni nye ba mngon sum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni nye ba mngon sum pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄòThis‚Äô refers to the proximate and the manifest.

original: rang rig pa la ni dus la sogs pa ma chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rang rig pa la ni dus la sogs pa ma chad pa ma yin la /
translated: In the case of self-awareness, there is no interruption in regard to time, etc.

original: 'di'i gzung ba de kho na 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i gzung ba de kho na 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The object of this is just like that.

original: gzhan du ni des rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du ni des rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not possible to understand it in any other way.

original: de lta yin na 'di'i grub pa yin par bstan pa pa ni ;
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di'i grub pa yin par bstan pa pa ni ;
translated: That being so, it is taught that this is its establishment:

original: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The defilements are adventitious.

original: rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not natural.

original: dri ma ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The defilements are the apprehension of self, etc.

original: rtsa ba med pa can ni yul med pas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa can ni yul med pas so //
translated: They are rootless because they have no object.

original: glen pa'i rgya tsam du zad pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma dpyad pa'i mngon par 'dod pa tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: glen pa'i rgya tsam du zad pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma dpyad pa'i mngon par 'dod pa tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are mere imputations because they are mere imputations of the ignorant.

original: rnam par dpyad na rang rig pa tsam nyid yin pas sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na rang rig pa tsam nyid yin pas sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When analyzed, they are mere self-awareness, so there is no superimposition. This is the meaning.

original: bdag tu gyur pa la yang skyon yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgol ba spangs par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: bdag tu gyur pa la yang skyon yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgol ba spangs par nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary is the rejection of objections such as ‚ÄúThere is also a fault in becoming a self,‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: de phyir sngar yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de phyir sngar yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúeven before,‚Äù

original: bdag gyur pa'i sngar ni tshu rol mthong ba'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gyur pa'i sngar ni tshu rol mthong ba'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: before becoming a self, in the state of seeing only the present,

original: bdag tu @343b grub pa'i lam gang la yang kha cig tu skyon yin pa ni de la yang gnas pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu @343b grub pa'i lam gang la yang kha cig tu skyon yin pa ni de la yang gnas pa can ma yin te /
translated: There is no path for establishing a self that is not also a path for eliminating the self.

original: gang las phul du byung ba thob pa'i lam de nyid kyis gnod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang las phul du byung ba thob pa'i lam de nyid kyis gnod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The path that leads to the attainment of the highest goal is the very one that eliminates the self.

original: nus yod na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nus yod na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúEven though the capacity is present‚Äù explains this.

original: gnod pa can ni lam mo //
analyzed: gnod pa can ni lam mo //
translated: The capacity is the path.

original: nus pa nyid ni nus mthu ste bag chags kyi 'du byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa nyid ni nus mthu ste bag chags kyi 'du byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The capacity itself is the power, which is to say the formative force of the instinct.

original: de'i snying po can dngos la ni sems la ste /
analyzed: de'i snying po can dngos la ni sems la ste /
translated: The capacity is in the mind that has the essence of that instinct.

original: nus pa yang skyes pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: nus pa yang skyes pa tsam gyis so //
translated: The capacity is produced merely by the arising of the instinct.

original: yun du ni rgyun gyis 'phel ba'i nus pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yun du ni rgyun gyis 'phel ba'i nus pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The capacity increases through the duration of the continuum.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúEven though the capacity is present‚Äù explains the objection that faith is not the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.

original: gal te dad pa zhes bya ba'i rgol ba la tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa ni gal te de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dad pa zhes bya ba'i rgol ba la tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa ni gal te de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams ni goms pa las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams ni goms pa las byung ba yin la /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúJust as the stains‚Äù explains the reply that the instincts of the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúJust

original: 'bad pas bzlog par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du goms pas bdag tu gyur pa'i lam yang 'bad pas bzlog byar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pas bzlog par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du goms pas bdag tu gyur pa'i lam yang 'bad pas bzlog byar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'o //
translated: Just as the path that has become one‚Äôs own through practice can be stopped by effort, so too can the path that has become one‚Äôs own through practice be stopped by effort.

original: skyon mthong na gsal ba'i 'bad rtsol 'byung ba yin na de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon mthong na gsal ba'i 'bad rtsol 'byung ba yin na de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa yin no //
translated: If one sees a fault, one makes an effort to clarify it, but since that is not present, there is no cause.

original: yang dag don dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni gsal bar mi nus pa nyid dang 'bad pa med pa la rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag don dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni gsal bar mi nus pa nyid dang 'bad pa med pa la rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The two words ‚Äúreal object‚Äù and ‚Äúnature‚Äù indicate the cause for the inability to clarify and the absence of effort.

original: phyin ci log gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis te bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so ;
analyzed: phyin ci log gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis te bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so ;
translated: By the opposite, by the counteragents, that is, by the grasping of self, etc.

original: / gsal ba la 'bad pa nyid dgag pa la rgyu 'gal ba'i yon tan mthong ba'i dmigs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / gsal ba la 'bad pa nyid dgag pa la rgyu 'gal ba'i yon tan mthong ba'i dmigs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The cause for the cessation of the very effort to clarify is shown to be the observation of the qualities that are the opposites of the faults.

original: de'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat side‚Äù is the side of the faults.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: That is explained.

original: phyogs su lhung bas na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs su lhung bas na zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of falling to a side‚Äù means because of falling to the side of the faults.

original: bral ba'i chos can gyi dgra bcom pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni /üîΩdngos po ma lus pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩskyon rnams la 'jug bzhin pa yang de la gnod pa kho na'i phyir 'bad pa med pa yin na /üîΩyon tan rnams la 'jug bzhin pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bral ba'i chos can gyi dgra bcom pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni / dngos po ma lus pa zhes bya ba ste / skyon rnams la 'jug bzhin pa yang de la gnod pa kho na'i phyir 'bad pa med pa yin na / yon tan rnams la 'jug bzhin pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one who is a candidate for the state of an arhat who is a non-returner is the one who is called ‚Äúthe one who has no more to do with all things.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩSince he is engaged in the faults, he is only harmed by them, and so he makes no effort.üîΩWhat need is there to speak of his being engaged in the virtues?üîΩüîΩ
