original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i phyir yang yin gyi de bzhin du bdag tu @344a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i phyir yang yin gyi de bzhin du bdag tu @344a * //
translated: It is also because of the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'dzin pa dang / bdag med par mthong ba dag ni rgyu gcig pa'am rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / bdag med par mthong ba dag ni rgyu gcig pa'am rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: But the apprehension of self and the vision of selflessness are not the same cause, nor are they cause and effect.

original: nang nyid dam phyi rol yang 'gal pa la khyad par du byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nang nyid dam phyi rol yang 'gal pa la khyad par du byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement that ‚Äúthere is no distinction in the absence of self‚Äù is taught:

original: bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe apprehension of self has the same cause.‚Äù

original: gang kho na'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin pa de kho na'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba can bdag med bar mthong ba nyid la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang kho na'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin pa de kho na'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba can bdag med bar mthong ba nyid la ma yin gyi /
translated: Because attachment, etc. have the apprehension of self as their cause, the vision of selflessness, which is incompatible with the apprehension of self, is not their cause.

original: de dang 'gal ba can ma yin pa'i byams pa la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba can ma yin pa'i byams pa la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that ‚Äúit is not love, etc.‚Äù teaches that love, etc. are not incompatible with it.

original: chags par bya ba dang 'khrug par bya bar kun du rtog pa nyid gti mug ma yin nam /
analyzed: chags par bya ba dang 'khrug par bya bar kun du rtog pa nyid gti mug ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the imagination of the graspable and the grasper itself delusion?

original: de yang byams pa la sogs pas ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar lam ma yin snyam du sems pa la /üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang byams pa la sogs pas ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar lam ma yin snyam du sems pa la / de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, since love, etc., are the very opposites of these, how can they be paths?

original: chags par bya ba kun du rtog pa yang bdag la phan byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: chags par bya ba kun du rtog pa yang bdag la phan byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa kho na yin la /
translated: Moreover, means that the conception of something as desirable is just the apprehension of it as beneficial to the self.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa nyid ni gti mug yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa nyid ni gti mug yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the verse is that the apprehension of a self is just delusion.

original: chos su 'dzin pa yang gti mug kho na ma yin nam de yang ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin snyam du sems pa la /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos su 'dzin pa yang gti mug kho na ma yin nam de yang ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin snyam du sems pa la / nyon mongs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the apprehension of dharmas just delusion? How can that be the view of the transitory collection?üîΩThe word afflicted in the verse means that delusion is the cause of attachment and hostility.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro dag gi rgyu gti mug ni 'dir gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro dag gi rgyu gti mug ni 'dir gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Here, the context is that of delusion.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs pas ma rig pa ni rig pa med pa tsam gyi gti mug ma yin na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs pas ma rig pa ni rig pa med pa tsam gyi gti mug ma yin na /
translated: If ignorance is not just the absence of knowledge, as it is said, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, the karmic forces,‚Äù

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la //
translated: then the view of the transitory collection is not just delusion.

original: rig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúof awareness‚Äù is added.

original: dgag pa ni mi bden pa dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'gal ba rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir med pa gti mug ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa ni mi bden pa dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'gal ba rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir med pa gti mug ma yin no //
translated: Since negation is the expression of contradiction, as in ‚Äúnot true‚Äù and ‚Äúnot a phenomenon,‚Äù it is not the absence of delusion.

original: so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gti mug la mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gti mug la mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: As for the claim that the nature of non-discursive awareness is the opposite of seeing,

original: so sor rtog med rang bzhin ni shin tu khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: so sor rtog med rang bzhin ni shin tu khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is shown that it is not a characteristic because it is a pervasive entity:

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it is a characteristic,üîΩit is not a pervasive entity.‚Äù

original: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid phyir //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the opposite of awareness‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni /
translated: is explained as

original: rigs dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause it is the opposite of reason.‚Äù

original: mi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rtogs par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir yang dag par rtogs par byed pa la bsam ba gzhan pa nyid kyis mi bden pa nyid 'dod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rtogs par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir yang dag par rtogs par byed pa la bsam ba gzhan pa nyid kyis mi bden pa nyid 'dod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: This means that because the thing that is being cognized does not exist, it is not that one wishes to assert that it is not true because of the difference in the intention of the one who cognizes it.

original: // med @344b pa la yod par rlom pa ni yod do zhes rtogs par byed na bsam pa la mi slu ba yin yang /
analyzed: // med @344b pa la yod par rlom pa ni yod do zhes rtogs par byed na bsam pa la mi slu ba yin yang /
translated: If one cognizes what is nonexistent as existent, thinking, ‚ÄúIt exists,‚Äù then it is not deceptive with regard to the intention.

original: don de bzhin du med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: don de bzhin du med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: But because the object does not exist in that way, it is said to be false speech.

original: med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúwith regard to what is nonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'di la yang sems pa zhes bya ba'i de ma thag tu yod do zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang sems pa zhes bya ba'i de ma thag tu yod do zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúone cognizes what is nonexistent as existent‚Äù should be applied to the phrase ‚Äúone cognizes what is existent as existent.‚Äù

original: snga mas ni mi 'dod pa thob pa dang / phyi mas ni 'dod pa mi 'thob par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snga mas ni mi 'dod pa thob pa dang / phyi mas ni 'dod pa mi 'thob par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The former teaches that one obtains what is not desired, and the latter teaches that one does not obtain what is desired.

original: bsam pa la yod pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid dam yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid yin gyi don la yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bsam pa la yod pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid dam yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid yin gyi don la yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The existence in thought is either real or unreal, but it is not existence in fact.

original: sgra rnams rnam rtag yul can te //
analyzed: sgra rnams rnam rtag yul can te //
translated: The existence in thought is either real or unreal, but not in the object.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by:üîΩThe objects of words are conceptual.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni don ji bzhin pa'i bsam pa ji bzhin pa'i tshig ni bden pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni don ji bzhin pa'i bsam pa ji bzhin pa'i tshig ni bden pa yin la /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattvas that is in accord with the object is the truth.

original: cig shos mi bden par bstan pa ni /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni //
analyzed: cig shos mi bden par bstan pa ni / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni //
translated: The opposite of that is taught to be the untruth.üîΩThis is taught by:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas

original: dmigs pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the object, because of the nature of the object.

original: de ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: de ni dbang po'o //
translated: That is the sense faculty.

original: rnam pa ni blo'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni blo'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the aspect of the mind.

original: rdzas ni shes pa gcig go ;
analyzed: rdzas ni shes pa gcig go ;
translated: The substance is the single consciousness.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ni re re zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ni re re zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The concomitant is each.

original: shes par ni sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: shes par ni sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The knowledge is the nature free from superimposition.

original: de las bzlog pa nyid du rtogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa nyid du rtogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa kho na yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is just superimposition.

original: gsungs pa gzhan yang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa gzhan yang bstan pa ni /
translated: Another statement is taught:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: So too,

original: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin la /
analyzed: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin la /
translated: the view is the view of the perishable constituents.

original: de yang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: And that is the notional attachment to a self.

original: bdag tu mngan par zhen pa las byung ba'i phyir bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i sgras de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma rig pa nyid du brjod do zhes rgol ba ma rig yan lag ces bya ba ni yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i ma rigüîΩpa'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu mngan par zhen pa las byung ba'i phyir bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i sgras de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma rig pa nyid du brjod do zhes rgol ba ma rig yan lag ces bya ba ni yan lag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i yan lag yin la /
translated: Since it arises from the notional attachment to a self, the notional attachment to a self is described as ignorance, which is a member of the twelve-membered dependent origination.üîΩIf it is to be described in its own nature, what is the point of a designation?üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.

original: de rang gi ngo bor brjod par bya ba yin na nye bar btags pas ci dogs zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: bzlog pa la ni tshad ma dag // ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la so sor rtog pa med pa'i skyon tshad ma yin no //
translated: The reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.

original: khyad par gyi sgra zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions.üîΩThe reversal of this is established by the valid cognitions

original: ma rig pa la lta ba la dbye ba med pa yin na so sor rtog pa'i tshig dbye ba'i yul du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa la lta ba la dbye ba med pa yin na so sor rtog pa'i tshig dbye ba'i yul du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If ignorance were not divided into views, then the term ‚Äúindividually discriminating‚Äù would not be the object of division.

original: de bzhin du gal te zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, this is the opponent‚Äôs position: ‚ÄúIf it were so, then this would contradict the statement,

original: 'gal ba ni 'gal ba can gyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni 'gal ba can gyi tshig yin no //
translated: because contradiction is a term for that which is contradictory.

original: bshad bya zhas bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi rtog pas te ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: bshad bya zhas bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi rtog pas te ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /
translated: The term ‚Äúthat which is to be explained‚Äù refers to the conception of the general and the specific. Ignorance is the general term,

original: @345a * // lta ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //üîΩgcig la yang tha snyad can nyid kyis tha dad par nye bar btags pa yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: @345a * // lta ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no // gcig la yang tha snyad can nyid kyis tha dad par nye bar btags pa yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: while views are the specific term.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs position is that even in one thing, through the power of convention, it is designated as different.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis kun du sbyor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis kun du sbyor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i'o //
translated: The other position is that it is a connection by way of its very nature.

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa mthong ba ni yul la sogs pa'i dbang gis stobs dang ldog bya ma yin pa nyid kyang bstan nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa mthong ba ni yul la sogs pa'i dbang gis stobs dang ldog bya ma yin pa nyid kyang bstan nas /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the seeing of selflessness is not to be stopped by the power of the object and so on.

original: bdag tu lta ba la yang ldog bya ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan nam /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la yang ldog bya ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan nam /
translated: The reason why the view of self is not to be eliminated

original: srog chags kyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: srog chags kyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: is because the nature of living beings

original: rang bzhin 'di yin 'di las te //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di yin 'di las te //
translated: is such that it is not

original: rkyen gzhan gyis ni gol 'gyur zhing //üîΩzhes bya bas bkag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyis ni gol 'gyur zhing // zhes bya bas bkag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: due to other conditions.üîΩThis is the refutation.

original: zad min te ldog pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zad min te ldog pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not that it is not exhausted, that is, not eliminated.

original: srog chags chos nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rang bzhin phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags chos nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rang bzhin phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of living beings, that is, because of the nature of living beings.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid kyis srog chags kyi rang bzhin nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid kyis srog chags kyi rang bzhin nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehension of a self arises from mere beginningless latent propensities, it is not established as the nature of living beings.üîΩThe thesis that the apprehension of a self is not eliminated is like saying that fire is not hot.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang mi ldog pa nyid du dam bca' ba ni me dro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du mngon sum dang 'gal ba can yin par bstan pa ni 'brel ba na ni mngon par phyogs pa yin na'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang mi ldog pa nyid du dam bca' ba ni me dro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du mngon sum dang 'gal ba can yin par bstan pa ni 'brel ba na ni mngon par phyogs pa yin na'o //
translated: The contradiction with direct perception is shown by the phrase ‚Äúif it were connected, it would be manifest.‚Äù

original: gnyen po'i phyogs dang zhes bya ba ni bdag med par lta ba dang ngo //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs dang zhes bya ba ni bdag med par lta ba dang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe side of the antidote‚Äù refers to the view of selflessness.

original: bdag med par lta bas bdag tu 'dzin pa ldog kyang me dang phrad pa las zangs kyi sra ba bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bsam pas dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa la nges pa ni bdag tu
analyzed: bdag med par lta bas bdag tu 'dzin pa ldog kyang me dang phrad pa las zangs kyi sra ba bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bsam pas dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa la nges pa ni bdag tu
translated: The view of selflessness does stop the view of self, but it is as if the view of self will arise again, just as copper becomes hard again when it comes in contact with fire.

original: 'dzin pa yin la 'gal ba ni bdag med par lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin la 'gal ba ni bdag med par lta ba ste /
translated: The view of selflessness is the antidote to the view of self.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa ni nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa ni nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of selflessness is not related to the view of self, because they are incompatible.

original: me dang phrad pa ni de ltar rtag tu gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me dang phrad pa ni de ltar rtag tu gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: When copper comes in contact with fire, it does not remain hard.

original: 'brel na yang des ldog par thams cad du slar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel na yang des ldog par thams cad du slar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if they were related, it is not the case that the view of self would arise again after it has been stopped by the view of selflessness.

original: me ldog pa'i thal ba bzhin du yang snga mar mi ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: me ldog pa'i thal ba bzhin du yang snga mar mi ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is because, like the ashes of a fire, the view of self cannot arise again after it has been stopped.

original: ma nges phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma nges phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not ascertained‚Äù refers to this.

original: de ltar bdag med par lta ba'i lam la bdag tu 'dzin pa dgongs pa can ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag med par lta ba'i lam la bdag tu 'dzin pa dgongs pa can ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that the path of the view of selflessness is not intended to be a grasping at self,

original: lam nyid yin no snyam du sems ba bsal ba ni /
analyzed: lam nyid yin no snyam du sems ba bsal ba ni /
translated: he dispels the thought that it is the path itself.

original: gal te bdag bsgoms pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag bsgoms pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks that the self is to be contemplated, etc.

original: bdag bsam par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag bsam par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: The two terms are used because the self is to be known and perceived.

original: de'i phyir bdag bsam par bya zhes bya ba ni lus dang dbang po la @345b sogs pa 'byung ba chen po ma gtogs pa 'byung ba chen po las tha dad par bsam par bya ba dang / blo la sogs pa las tha dad par dmigs par bya zhes bya bar yang 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag bsam par bya zhes bya ba ni lus dang dbang po la @345b sogs pa 'byung ba chen po ma gtogs pa 'byung ba chen po las tha dad par bsam par bya ba dang / blo la sogs pa las tha dad par dmigs par bya zhes bya bar yang 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe self is to be contemplated‚Äù means that it is to be contemplated as separate from the great elements, such as the body and the sense faculties, and as separate from the mind, etc.üîΩIt is to be perceived.

original: yul 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dang bral bas sems dga' ba'i ngo bo gcig pu'i bdag gi de kho na nyid bsgom bya yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yul 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dang bral bas sems dga' ba'i ngo bo gcig pu'i bdag gi de kho na nyid bsgom bya yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he teaches that the reality of the self, which is the essence of the mind alone, free from the nature of the apprehension of objects, is to be contemplated.

original: gal te re zhig rigs pa can la sogs pa tha dad par smra ba po de skad smra na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig rigs pa can la sogs pa tha dad par smra ba po de skad smra na /
translated: If the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on, who are proponents of difference, say this,

original: de'i bdag tu lta ba ni bdag gi ba'i rjes su 'jug pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag tu lta ba ni bdag gi ba'i rjes su 'jug pa kho na yin te /
translated: then their view of self is only engaged with what belongs to the self.

original: chags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir // zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is the nature of attachment.üîΩThis is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúWhoever sees self‚Äù and ending with ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: gang zhig bdag mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de la ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de la ni bdag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the self.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the speaker.

original: nga zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i bdag nyid kho nar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i bdag nyid kho nar mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI‚Äù refers to seeing only the nature of attachment.

original: bdag ni rigs pa nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir der lta ba yang chags pa'i snying po can dang bral ba ma yin pa kho nar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag ni rigs pa nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir der lta ba yang chags pa'i snying po can dang bral ba ma yin pa kho nar bstan pa ni /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe self‚Äù and ending with ‚ÄúI‚Äù teaches that because the self is not free from being reasonable, the view of self is also not free from being the essence of attachment.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ste chags pa yod na chags pa'i yul phan 'dogs par byed pa rnams la dang / de sgrub par byed pa rnams la yang sred pa yin la /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ste chags pa yod na chags pa'i yul phan 'dogs par byed pa rnams la dang / de sgrub par byed pa rnams la yang sred pa yin la /
translated: If there is attachment, there is craving for the objects of attachment that benefit and for those that accomplish them.

original: des de rnams la sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skyon gyis cha bsgribs pa'i phyir de nyid mthong ba kho na mi 'thob pa ni chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des de rnams la sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skyon gyis cha bsgribs pa'i phyir de nyid mthong ba kho na mi 'thob pa ni chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the faults that are related to suffering obscure that part, one does not obtain the vision of reality itself, and thus one does not become free from attachment.

original: 'on te bdag gnyis su med par smra ba ni bdag mthong ba 'ba' zhig la thar pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gnyis su med par smra ba ni bdag mthong ba 'ba' zhig la thar pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if one who advocates the nonexistence of the two selves realizes the path to liberation in that way, that is, by seeing the self,

original: thar pa'i lam de lta bur rtogs par byed na 'khor ba pa'i 'gro bar grub pa'i spros pa thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: thar pa'i lam de lta bur rtogs par byed na 'khor ba pa'i 'gro bar grub pa'i spros pa thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir yin na /
translated: then all the elaborations that are established as the transmigrating beings of cyclic existence would be confused.

original: 'di la yang gang zhig bdag mthong zhes bya ba nyid rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang gang zhig bdag mthong zhes bya ba nyid rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And in that case, the statement ‚ÄúOne who sees the self‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: bde ba rnams dang bde ba sgrub par byed pa rnams ji lta ba de lta ba rnams la sred par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bde ba rnams dang bde ba sgrub par byed pa rnams ji lta ba de lta ba rnams la sred par byed pa yin la /
translated: One craves the objects that are pleasant and the means of achieving pleasure.

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i cha de nyid kyis 'khrul pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i skyon nam /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i cha de nyid kyis 'khrul pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i skyon nam /
translated: By that very powerful part, one is confused about the nature of faults.

original: de'i mthong ba yang ma mthong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid mi thob pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbdag tu lta ba las gzhan pa'i chags pa'i dbang du byas nas rgol ba ni /
analyzed: de'i mthong ba yang ma mthong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid mi thob pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to // bdag tu lta ba las gzhan pa'i chags pa'i dbang du byas nas rgol ba ni /
translated: With regard to attachment that is different from the view of the transitory collection, the objection is stated:üîΩIf one sees the self,

original: gal te bdag tu mthong ba las //üîΩzhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag tu mthong ba las // zhes bya pa'o //
translated: there is attachment to the self.

original: 'di nyid la lan ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la lan ni /
translated: The response to this is:

original: tha dad par mthong bas bud med gzhan la sogs pa la bdag la phan 'dogs par byad pa ni chags pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par mthong bas bud med gzhan la sogs pa la bdag la phan 'dogs par byad pa ni chags pa yin la /
translated: Since one sees the self as separate, one is attached to women and so on, thinking, ‚ÄúThey benefit me.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag la chags pa med na gzhan du mi @346a * //
analyzed: gal te bdag la chags pa med na gzhan du mi @346a * //
translated: If one is not attached to the self, one will not be attached to others.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of this is presented in the line:üîΩ‚ÄúOne who is attached to the self.‚ÄùüîΩThe view of the transitory collection is taught to be the essence of attachment:

analyzed: gang zhig gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is attached to the self.‚ÄùüîΩThe view of the transitory collection is taught to be the essence of attachment:üîΩ‚ÄúOne who is attached to the self.‚Äù

analyzed: bdag tu lta ba kho na chags pa'i snying po can yin par bstan pa ni /

analyzed: bdag tu lta bas bdag las gzhan pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni ma brtags pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is taught to be the essence of attachment:üîΩ‚ÄúOne who is attached to

original: gal te bdag nyid chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is a great being,

original: rang las byung pa'i 'bras bu med na gzhan la phan pa tsam la 'jug pa ni byol song rnams bu la spud pa bzhin du gti mug las byung ba kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang las byung pa'i 'bras bu med na gzhan la phan pa tsam la 'jug pa ni byol song rnams bu la spud pa bzhin du gti mug las byung ba kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is no result that arises from itself, then the mere engagement in benefiting others is born from delusion, like the wool of the animal being shorn.üîΩThe meaning is that it is born from delusion.

original: rang gi don la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba'o ;
analyzed: rang gi don la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba'o ;
translated: Abiding in one‚Äôs own aim is the view of self.

original: / bdag kho na dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis nye ba yin pa'i phyir sred pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: / bdag kho na dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis nye ba yin pa'i phyir sred pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Since the self is the nature of one‚Äôs own joy, craving is not the nature of the desire for future happiness.

original: yon tan mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The seeing of good qualities is the cause of craving.

original: bud med la sogs pa de dang de sgrub par byed pa las byung ba'i bde ba de med na yid tsam gyis ni 'grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bud med la sogs pa de dang de sgrub par byed pa las byung ba'i bde ba de med na yid tsam gyis ni 'grub pa ma yin la /
translated: The pleasure that arises from the accomplishment of this or that woman, and so on, is not accomplished by the mind alone.

original: mngon par gsal bar bya ba yang gsal bar byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir gsal byed dam de'i sgrub byed blang bya kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar bya ba yang gsal bar byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir gsal byed dam de'i sgrub byed blang bya kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that which is to be manifested is only that which is to be taken up, the manifestor or its producer.

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams la bdag tu lta ba yod na bdag gi ba bzhin du bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa dang / phye ba las byung ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams la bdag tu lta ba yod na bdag gi ba bzhin du bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa dang / phye ba las byung ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: For those who believe in a self, if there is the view of a self, then like the view of mine, there is the distinction of self and other, and the faults that arise from that distinction.

original: bdag yod na ni zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gir lta ba bzhin du rang dang gzhan du 'byed pa yang skyon gyi rgyur 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gir lta ba bzhin du rang dang gzhan du 'byed pa yang skyon gyi rgyur 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúif there is a self‚Äù is that the distinction of self and other, like the view of self and mine, is only the cause of faults.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: ‚Äú Attachment‚Äù is desire.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni chags pa'i ngo bo yin par mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni chags pa'i ngo bo yin par mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it unreasonable that the view of a self is the nature of desire?

original: sngon po'i snang ba bzhin du bdag gi dngos po'i snang ba yang chags pa ma gtogs par yod pa'i phyir de'i snang ba yod na de nyid dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i snang ba bzhin du bdag gi dngos po'i snang ba yang chags pa ma gtogs par yod pa'i phyir de'i snang ba yod na de nyid dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as the appearance of blue exists apart from attachment to blue, so too the appearance of the self exists apart from attachment to the self. Therefore, when the appearance of the self exists, the self does not become a real entity.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi bar chags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi bar chags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, attachment to the self does not exist.

original: lta ba 'ba' zhig kho na yin la de 'ching ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba 'ba' zhig kho na yin la de 'ching ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that only the view of the self exists and that does not bind is the view of the self.

original: 'on te bdag kho na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag kho na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But the self is not the object of attachment.

original: bdag kho na la chags pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi la dor ba yin te /üîΩsems ring rig pa ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag kho na la chags pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi la dor ba yin te / sems ring rig pa ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe self alone‚Äù is a locution.

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is not the self because it is momentary.

original: gzhan yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i rtogs bya ji ltar nyams su myong ba ni skad cig ma kho na yin no //üîΩ'on kyang @346b khar rtsang gi yang bdag nyid kho na yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i rtogs bya ji ltar nyams su myong ba ni skad cig ma kho na yin no // 'on kyang @346b khar rtsang gi yang bdag nyid kho na yin /
translated: Moreover, the object of nonconceptual consciousness is just what is experienced, which is momentary.

original: de ring gi bdag nyid yin pa'i rnam par rtogs pa'i rtogs bya yin na /
analyzed: de ring gi bdag nyid yin pa'i rnam par rtogs pa'i rtogs bya yin na /
translated: But the object of conceptual consciousness is the self of yesterday and the self of today.

original: rnam par rtogs pa yang de ltar 'jug bzhin pa chags pa las gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtogs pa yang de ltar 'jug bzhin pa chags pa las gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the conceptualization which is engaged in that way is not different from attachment.

original: nges par bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges par bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is attachment to self.

original: bdag tu rtog pa nyid bdag la chags pa 'dor ba yin gyi bdag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog pa nyid bdag la chags pa 'dor ba yin gyi bdag ni ma yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of self is itself attachment to self, not the self.

original: des na rnam rtog yongs su bor ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na rnam rtog yongs su bor ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, because of the abandonment of conceptualization, there is no absence of freedom from attachment.

original: bdag yod pas thar pa med pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bdag yod pas thar pa med pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: And it is not the case that there is no liberation because of the existence of self.

original: nyes med bdag la chags pa ni bdag la tshad mas grub pa nyid du blo la yod pa yin na blo de kho na chags pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes med bdag la chags pa ni bdag la tshad mas grub pa nyid du blo la yod pa yin na blo de kho na chags pa yin te /
translated: The thought that there is attachment to a faultless self is the existence of the cognition that the self is established by a valid cognition. That cognition itself is attachment.

original: tshad ma la sogs pa med na bdag med pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma la sogs pa med na bdag med pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if there were no valid cognition, etc., the self would be non-existent.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba las gzhan pa nyid chags par khas len pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba las gzhan pa nyid chags par khas len pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it accepted that attachment is something other than the view of self and of being mine?

original: de yang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skyon can dor bya yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de yang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skyon can dor bya yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that that is also faulty and to be abandoned because it is the cause of cyclic existence is as follows.

original: 'on te bdag dang zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'on te bdag dang zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Or, ‚ÄúI am attached to myself‚Äù?

original: /'dir zhes bya ba ni khas len pa la'o //
analyzed: /'dir zhes bya ba ni khas len pa la'o //
translated: Here, ‚ÄúI‚Äù refers to the one who accepts.

original: gal te chags pa skyon bcas na //
analyzed: gal te chags pa skyon bcas na //
translated: If attachment is faulty,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then what is not faulty?

original: tha dad pa khas len na yang 'dod pa cung zad kyang grub pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa khas len na yang 'dod pa cung zad kyang grub pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: If you accept that the self is different from the aggregates, then nothing is established at all.

original: de las cir te cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩtha dad pa'i chags pa ni dor bar nus pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni de spong ste chags pa'i'o //
analyzed: de las cir te cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to // tha dad pa'i chags pa ni dor bar nus pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni de spong ste chags pa'i'o //
translated: What is the point of that? Nothing at all, is the meaning.üîΩThe thought that attachment to something different can be given up is rejected:üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment to something different can be given up only by seeing the faults of the object.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa'i chags pa yang yul gyi skyon mthong ba kho na las 'dor ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩsngon byung med par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩskyon gzhan gyis ni skyon gzhan gyis te rang gi skyon gyis zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis skyon can ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yul la'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i chags pa yang yul gyi skyon mthong ba kho na las 'dor ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin par bstan pa ni / sngon byung med par zhes bya ba'o // skyon gzhan gyis ni skyon gzhan gyis te rang gi skyon gyis zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis skyon can ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yul la'o //
translated: Another fault is that the self would be the cause of suffering:üîΩ‚ÄúIf the self were different from the aggregates, it would not be the cause of suffering.‚ÄùüîΩThe self would not be the cause of suffering, because it is not the cause of the aggregates.üîΩAnother fault is that the self would be the cause of pleasure:

original: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba'i rgyu la'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba'i rgyu la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the self were different from the aggregates, it would be the cause of pleasure.‚Äù

original: chags pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po bzhin du 'dod pa dang zhe sdang dag gis len par byed pa'am /üîΩ'dor bar byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chags pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po bzhin du 'dod pa dang zhe sdang dag gis len par byed pa'am / 'dor bar byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Attachment is not like a pot, etc., that is taken up or put down by desire and hatred.

original: de la yul gyi yon tan dang skyon la brten pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /üîΩ'dod dang sdang sogs spangs pa ste //
analyzed: de la yul gyi yon tan dang skyon la brten pa yin no snyam du sems pa la / 'dod dang sdang sogs spangs pa ste //
translated: If you think that it is dependent on the good qualities and faults of the object, then the root verse states:

original: yul gyi yon tan dang skyon dang rjes su 'brel pa dang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩyul gyi yon tan dang skyon de dag mthong ba med pa ni 'dor ba ni yul gyi yon tan mthong ba la sogs pa dang / skyon mthong ba las zhe sdang @347a * //
analyzed: yul gyi yon tan dang skyon dang rjes su 'brel pa dang zhes bya bar sbyar ro // yul gyi yon tan dang skyon de dag mthong ba med pa ni 'dor ba ni yul gyi yon tan mthong ba la sogs pa dang / skyon mthong ba las zhe sdang @347a * //
translated: Attachment is not dependent on the good qualities and faults of the object.üîΩThe good qualities and faults of the object are not the cause of attachment.üîΩAttachment does not arise from seeing the good qualities of the object, etc., and hatred does not arise from seeing its faults.

original: mi 'dor ba mi 'byung ba yul gyi yon tan dang skyon mthong ba'i rgyu mi skye ba'i ngo bo ni phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i yul rnams la yon tan dang skyon mthong ba las nye bar len pa dang 'joms pa'i chags pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dor ba mi 'byung ba yul gyi yon tan dang skyon mthong ba'i rgyu mi skye ba'i ngo bo ni phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i yul rnams la yon tan dang skyon mthong ba las nye bar len pa dang 'joms pa'i chags pa'o //
translated: The nonarising of attachment and hatred is the nonarising of the cause of seeing the good qualities and faults of the object. The essence of nonarising is the attachment to taking up and putting down external objects such as pots, etc., that arise from seeing their good qualities and faults.

original: yul ni bdag dang bdag gi ste de'i dngos po nyid de yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang spyar ro //
analyzed: yul ni bdag dang bdag gi ste de'i dngos po nyid de yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang spyar ro //
translated: The object is the self and what pertains to the self, and the state of that is called ‚Äúendowed with qualities.‚Äù

original: de med pa'i phyir ni yon tan dang ldan pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ni yon tan dang ldan pa med pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no endowment with qualities.

original: de'i phyir / rigs pa 'di chags pa ma yin par bstan pa ni zhen pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rigs pa 'di chags pa ma yin par bstan pa ni zhen pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement that this reasoning is not attached is called ‚Äúnon-attachment.‚Äù

original: phyi tshul gang yin min zhes bya ba 'di gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: phyi tshul gang yin min zhes bya ba 'di gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The clarification of ‚Äúwhat is external is not‚Äù is

original: chags yon tan gyi chags min gyi //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags yon tan gyi chags min gyi // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not attachment to qualities.

original: rigs pas brjod nas rnal ma la sbyor bar byed pa ni bdag dang bdag gi ba la ma tshang ba med pa'i yon tan mthong ba yin na bdag tu lta ba'i 'bras bu chags pa mi ldog par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pas brjod nas rnal ma la sbyor bar byed pa ni bdag dang bdag gi ba la ma tshang ba med pa'i yon tan mthong ba yin na bdag tu lta ba'i 'bras bu chags pa mi ldog par bstan pa ni /
translated: Having stated the reasoning, the application to the real thing is: If one sees the self and what pertains to the self as complete with qualities, the result of the view of self, attachment, is not reversed.

original: ma tshang med rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma tshang med rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that there is no cause for the incompleteness is

original: 'dod dang sdang sogs spong ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod dang sdang sogs spong ba ni /
translated: Abandoning desire, anger, and so onüîΩis not the cause for the incompleteness of the view of the transitory collection.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: nyes med bdag la chags pa dang // bral ba'i rgyu yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: nyes med bdag la chags pa dang // bral ba'i rgyu yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no cause for the absence of faults in one who is attached to the self.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis kyang /
translated: is a summary verse, because it teaches the meaning of the verse that goes:üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment is not a virtue, because of attachment.‚Äù

original: chags yon tan gyi chags min gyis //
analyzed: chags yon tan gyi chags min gyis //
translated: The meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i don rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚Äù

analyzed: ma tshang med rgyu de la ni //
translated: The meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blocked

original: 'bras bu gang gis zlog par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gis zlog par byed //
translated: for one who has the complete cause?‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚Äù

analyzed: ces bya ba'i dgongs pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚Äù

analyzed: kho bos ji ltar bshad pas ni des rtogs pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚Äù

analyzed: chags pa skyon dang ldan pa nyid yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rten yin no //
