translated: The meaning of the verse is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can the result be blockedüîΩfor one who has the complete cause?‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of the

original: bdag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dang de'i 'bras bu za ba po yin la /
analyzed: bdag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dang de'i 'bras bu za ba po yin la /
translated: I am the consciousness that creates all happiness and suffering and I am the experiencer of its effects.

original: de'i phyir bdag kho na bzhin du yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag kho na bzhin du yin la /
translated: Therefore, just like the self,

original: chags pa yang bdag gir lta ba'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chags pa yang bdag gir lta ba'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: I am the object of the view of mine.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yul du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yul du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of how it is not the object of freedom from attachment:

original: skyon yang gang zhig mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon yang gang zhig mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What fault do you see?

original: bdag kyang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa po dang za ba po dang za ba po nyid yin pas 'dod chags @347b dang bral ba'i yul kho nar 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag kyang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa po dang za ba po dang za ba po nyid yin pas 'dod chags @347b dang bral ba'i yul kho nar 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since the self is the knower, the experiencer, and the experiencer of the consciousness that creates suffering, isn‚Äôt it the object of freedom from attachment?

original: de ltar yin na 'di'i ngo bo gzhan med pa'i phyir thar pa 'dod pas ji ltar bdag shes par bya ba dang 'dod par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar yin na 'di'i ngo bo gzhan med pa'i phyir thar pa 'dod pas ji ltar bdag shes par bya ba dang 'dod par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba zhes bya ba yin /
translated: If that is so, since it has no other nature, how can those who desire liberation know the self, desire the self, and observe the self?

original: dor bya nyid du shes par bya ba yin na bdag med par lta ba thar pa sgrub par byed pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dor bya nyid du shes par bya ba yin na bdag med par lta ba thar pa sgrub par byed pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is to be known as something to be rejected, then the view of selflessness will be established as the means to attain liberation.

original: bdag yod na zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi shes pa po dang za ba po'i 'du ba can gyi rgyu yod na'o //
analyzed: bdag yod na zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi shes pa po dang za ba po'i 'du ba can gyi rgyu yod na'o //
translated: If the self exists, then the cause of the collection of the knower and the experiencer exists.

original: chags pa la sogs pa bskyed bya sdug bsngal gyi bdag dang du ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi bdag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa bskyed bya sdug bsngal gyi bdag dang du ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi bdag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Attachment and so on are the cause of suffering, but the self is not the cause of suffering,üîΩbecause it is not known to arise when it exists.

original: de yod na 'byung ba nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni 'on te 'di snyam du bdag gi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid zer ba ni /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni 'on te 'di snyam du bdag gi zhes bya ba'o // de nyid zer ba ni /
translated: If you think this, then the response is:

original: gal te de med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de med ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then what?

original: 'du ba can bdag yod na chags pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'du ba can bdag yod na chags pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ji ltar yin /
translated: If the self that is the collection of the aggregates exists, how can attachment and so on be the cause of suffering?

original: de'i phyir skyon can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore it is not faulty.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa yin te /
translated: It is impossible to be free from attachment,

original: yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object.

original: bdag sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin yang dor bya ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin yang dor bya ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the self the cause of suffering and not to be abandoned?

original: 'dor ba ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dor ba ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: Abandonment is the cause of the attainment of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa ni sdug bsngal bsgoms pas yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa ni sdug bsngal bsgoms pas yin te /
translated: And the connection with suffering is due to the cultivation of suffering.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i phyir bdag kyang de dang 'du ba can nyid dang bral ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i phyir bdag kyang de dang 'du ba can nyid dang bral ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thus, the self is also separated from the state of being connected with suffering, because suffering does not arise.

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cultivation of suffering is the cause of abandonment.

original: bdag gi ba nyid kyi blos byas pa ni bdag mi 'dor ba'i yul nyid yin na bdag gi ba la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi ba nyid kyi blos byas pa ni bdag mi 'dor ba'i yul nyid yin na bdag gi ba la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The object of the thought ‚Äúit is mine‚Äù is not to be abandoned, because the self is not to be abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pa 'dor ba'i rgyu ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pa 'dor ba'i rgyu ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: How can the cultivation of suffering be the cause of abandonment?

original: bdag gi ba'i blo bcom bas 'dir 'dor bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ba'i blo bcom bas 'dir 'dor bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this is stated: ‚ÄúBecause the thought ‚Äòit is mine‚Äô is destroyed, it is abandoned.‚Äù

original: de bcom na ji ltar bral ba yin yang len pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bcom na ji ltar bral ba yin yang len pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is destroyed, how can it be connected? It is only appropriated. This is stated:

original: bdag gi nyid kyi blo kho na de la med pa yin par mi rigs te /üîΩde'i longs spyod kyi gnas ni lus yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi nyid kyi blo kho na de la med pa yin par mi rigs te / de'i longs spyod kyi gnas ni lus yin la /
translated: It is not reasonable that the self alone does not exist in that body,üîΩbecause you say that the body is the basis of the self‚Äôs enjoyment,

original: longs spyod sgrub par byed pa ni dbang po yin zhes smras pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: longs spyod sgrub par byed pa ni dbang po yin zhes smras pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ;
translated: and the faculties are the means by which the self enjoys objects.

original: longs spyod kyi rten nyid du ni gzung ba la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rten nyid du ni gzung ba la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The body is the basis of enjoyment,üîΩbut the faculties are the means by which the self enjoys objects.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang 'gal ba yin na /
translated: If it is contradictory to cultivate the view of the self as miserable,

original: bdag bzhin du bdag gi ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag bzhin du bdag gi ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the same would be true of the view of the self as happy.

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas cir 'gyur na zhes bya ba 'dri ba'i don zer ba ni /üîΩgal te bde ba'i rgyu nyid ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas cir 'gyur na zhes bya ba 'dri ba'i don zer ba ni / gal te bde ba'i rgyu nyid ni //
translated: The meaning of the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of cultivating the view of the self as miserable?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is as follows:üîΩIf the cause of happinessüîΩis the cause of misery,

original: @348a * // de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yod pa las so //
analyzed: @348a * // de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yod pa las so //
translated: then the cause of misery is the cause of happiness.

original: lus la sogs pa rang nyid kyi blo khas len par grub pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi mngon sum gyis grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rang nyid kyi blo khas len par grub pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi mngon sum gyis grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The body and so on are not established as the self merely by the acceptance of one‚Äôs own mind, but are established by direct perception.

original: mngon sum yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is direct perception.

original: ma'i ming can bzhin du lus dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams la bdag gi yin pa la /
analyzed: ma'i ming can bzhin du lus dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams la bdag gi yin pa la /
translated: Just as in the case of a son of a woman named ‚ÄúMother,‚Äù the body, faculties, etc. are ‚Äúmine‚Äù in the sense that they belong to the self.

original: bdag gi ma'i ming can la gnas pas sdug bsngal bsgoms pas sdug bsngal bcom pa thob pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bdag gi ma'i ming can la gnas pas sdug bsngal bsgoms pas sdug bsngal bcom pa thob pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The self is the basis of the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and when one meditates on suffering in relation to it, one attains the destruction of suffering.

original: 'du sogs 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du sogs 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe thought ‚Äòmine‚Äô arises in dependence on the thought ‚ÄòI.‚Äô‚Äù

original: lus dang dbang bo la sogs pa kun du dmigs nas sdug bsngal bsgom pa bsnyad par byed la de la dmigs pa yang longs spyod kyi rten nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin gyi de yang 'du ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa ni bdag gi ba'i blo'iüîΩyul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang dbang bo la sogs pa kun du dmigs nas sdug bsngal bsgom pa bsnyad par byed la de la dmigs pa yang longs spyod kyi rten nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin gyi de yang 'du ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa ni bdag gi ba'i blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When one meditates on suffering in relation to the body, faculties, etc., which are perceived as a collection, one thinks that the self is the basis of the experience of pleasure and pain. The object of the thought ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the self, which is related to the collection, etc.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa thob bzhin pa ji ltar bdag gir 'dzin pa'i blo dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa thob bzhin pa ji ltar bdag gir 'dzin pa'i blo dang bral ba yin /
translated: How can one who is meditating on suffering be free from the thought ‚Äúmine‚Äù?

original: longs spyod kyi rten la sogs pa blo nyid dang 'brel pa'i blo nyid kyis bdag gi ba'i blo yin pa'i phyar mthong du zin kyang ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid shes kyang ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rten la sogs pa blo nyid dang 'brel pa'i blo nyid kyis bdag gi ba'i blo yin pa'i phyar mthong du zin kyang ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid shes kyang ngo //
translated: Even though one sees that the body, etc. are the basis of experience, etc., and that the idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is due to the mind‚Äôs relation to the mind, still, one does not see the suffering that is the cause of the idea of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ma'i 'du shes ni mthong ba'i ma'i ngo bor sgro btags pas yin la /
analyzed: ma'i 'du shes ni mthong ba'i ma'i ngo bor sgro btags pas yin la /
translated: The idea of ‚Äúmother‚Äù is a superimposition, since one sees the mother‚Äôs present form.

original: sdug bsngal ni 'brel ba dang bral ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir sgro btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'brel ba dang bral ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir sgro btags pa ma yin no //
translated: But suffering is not a superimposition, since one does not observe the separation from the mother.

original: 'on te phan 'dogs pa nyid kho na lus la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te phan 'dogs pa nyid kho na lus la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: But if the idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is due to the relation of the body, etc. to the benefactor,üîΩand not to contact, union, etc., then, since the reason for the idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the benefactor, one would not see the suffering that is due to separation from the benefactor, and so the self would not be the principal factor.

original: phrad pa dang 'du ba la sogs pa nyid ma yin na de lta yin na bdag gi ba'i phan 'dogs pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan thams cad la yin pa'i phyir de dang bral ba la sdug bsngal nyid ma mthong bas gtso bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan
analyzed: phrad pa dang 'du ba la sogs pa nyid ma yin na de lta yin na bdag gi ba'i phan 'dogs pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan thams cad la yin pa'i phyir de dang bral ba la sdug bsngal nyid ma mthong bas gtso bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan
translated: This is demonstrated in the following:

original: pa ni / 'du ba la sogs med na yang //
analyzed: pa ni / 'du ba la sogs med na yang //
translated: Even without contact, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ste kun la zhes bya ba ni gtso bo med pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste kun la zhes bya ba ni gtso bo med pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all‚Äù means that there is no primary cause.

original: gal te gtso bo gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ba dag gi lus dang dbang po la sogs pa nyid sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdag gi yin yang bdag gi blo'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gtso bo gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ba dag gi lus dang dbang po la sogs pa nyid sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdag gi yin yang bdag gi blo'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the body, faculties, etc. are the cause of suffering, then what is the use of a primary cause? Even if they belong to a self, they are not the object of the idea of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: sprul gyis zos pa'i mngar mo bzhin du yin la /
analyzed: sprul gyis zos pa'i mngar mo bzhin du yin la /
translated: They are like the sweet fruit eaten by a snake.

original: de yang bdag gi blo kho na bdag gi ba ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩsdug bsngal bskyed phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi blo kho na bdag gi ba ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni / sdug bsngal bskyed phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And that idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù itself would not be ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa ni de ni gcig tu sdug bsngal ma yin te /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa ni de ni gcig tu sdug bsngal ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it produces suffering‚Äù means that the body, faculties, etc. are not exclusively suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kho na ma yin zhing phal che ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na ma yin zhing phal che ba yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not only suffering, nor are they mostly suffering.

original: @348b dug dang 'dres pa'i bza' ba ji lta ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @348b dug dang 'dres pa'i bza' ba ji lta ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that they are like food mixed with poison, he says:

original: gcig tu de ni sdug bsngal min //
analyzed: gcig tu de ni sdug bsngal min //
translated: They are not exclusively suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kho na'am sdug bsngal phal che ba kho na ma yin du zin kyang bde ba'i ngo bo kho na phal che bar yod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na'am sdug bsngal phal che ba kho na ma yin du zin kyang bde ba'i ngo bo kho na phal che bar yod pa'i phyir la /
translated: Even though it is not only suffering or mostly suffering, it is to be rejected because it is mostly the nature of pleasure.

original: de lta na yang sdug bsngal gyis sun phyung ba yin pa'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'i bza' ba bzhin du blang bya ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sdug bsngal gyis sun phyung ba yin pa'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'i bza' ba bzhin du blang bya ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And even though it is so, it is to be rejected because it is defiled by suffering, like food mixed with poison.

original: lus mdzes pa yang mdze nad gcig pus skal ba ngan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las so snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: lus mdzes pa yang mdze nad gcig pus skal ba ngan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las so snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The body is beautiful, but it is unfortunate because of just one disease, leprosy.

original: khyad par can ni sdug bsngal gyi cha yang med pas lhag pa ni gcig tu bde ba'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can ni sdug bsngal gyi cha yang med pas lhag pa ni gcig tu bde ba'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special is not even a part of suffering, because it is the nature of pleasure.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni sdug bsngal gyi cha dang 'dres pa dang khyad par yod pa la dug dang bcas pa bzhin du chags pa dang bral ba nyid ni rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni sdug bsngal gyi cha dang 'dres pa dang khyad par yod pa la dug dang bcas pa bzhin du chags pa dang bral ba nyid ni rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The opposite of that is mixed with a part of suffering and has a special quality. Like food mixed with poison, one is detached from it and turns away from it.

original: de med na ni bdag chags pa dang ldan pa dag ji ltar rnyed pa la 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de med na ni bdag chags pa dang ldan pa dag ji ltar rnyed pa la 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If there were no such thing as pleasure, how could those who are attached to the self engage in the pursuit of pleasure?

original: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is:

original: 'dod chags kyis non pa khyad par can gyi bud med ma rnyed na mo tsam la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis non pa khyad par can gyi bud med ma rnyed na mo tsam la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: If one does not obtain the woman one desires, one engages in intercourse with any woman.

original: rgyu'i stobs las zhes bya ba ni snga ma snga ma'i bde ba la goms pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs las zhes bya ba ni snga ma snga ma'i bde ba la goms pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the power of the cause‚Äù means that the power of habituation to the pleasure of the previous moment is the cause of the pleasure of the next moment.

original: sdug bsngal gyi cha dang ldan pa kho na bde ba nye bar len pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi cha dang ldan pa kho na bde ba nye bar len pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that only that which is associated with pain is avoided?

original: 'gros gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gros gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other way.

original: bde ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas rigs pa yin gyi shin tu ba'i sdug bsngal las grol ba'i bdag gi ngo bo la ltos nas ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: bde ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas rigs pa yin gyi shin tu ba'i sdug bsngal las grol ba'i bdag gi ngo bo la ltos nas ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say this in relation to the absence of a special kind of pleasure, but it is not reasonable to say this in relation to the nature of the self that is free from the most intense pain.

original: shin tu ba'i sdug bsngal las grol ba ni sdug bsngal bsgoms pas de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: shin tu ba'i sdug bsngal las grol ba ni sdug bsngal bsgoms pas de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The thought is that one who is free from the most intense pain will see reality by meditating on pain.

original: bdag bsgom pa ci mi srid pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bdag bsgom pa ci mi srid pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: And so on up to:

original: de ni 'gar yang gzhan 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de ni 'gar yang gzhan 'gyur phyir //
translated: Because it never becomes something else,

original: mir zhes bya ba'i bar de'o //
analyzed: mir zhes bya ba'i bar de'o //
translated: It is called a human being.

original: don 'di kho na la rnam 'grel dang sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: don 'di kho na la rnam 'grel dang sbyor ba ni /
translated: The Application of the Commentary to this very point is:

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore,

original: sdug bsngal gyis byas pa'i ngo bo las gzhan pa kho na de med pas byas pa yin pa'i phyir de la ltos nas snga ma'i zhig pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis byas pa'i ngo bo las gzhan pa kho na de med pas byas pa yin pa'i phyir de la ltos nas snga ma'i zhig pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not something other than the nature created by suffering, it is created. Therefore, in dependence on that, the previous state is just destroyed. This is the meaning.üîΩWhose?

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
translated: The yogi's.

original: 'dod pa ni chags pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni chags pa'i yul lo //
translated: Desire is the object of attachment.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: That is the self.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: That is the yogi.

original: gang gi bdag ste bdag ste bdag gi rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: gang gi bdag ste bdag ste bdag gi rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: Whose self? The self is one's own nature.

original: chags pa yul yin la /üîΩde'i ni rang gi ngo bo'i'o //
analyzed: chags pa yul yin la / de'i ni rang gi ngo bo'i'o //
translated: It is the object of attachment.üîΩIt is the nature of that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i bdag go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i bdag go //
translated: That is the self.

original: @349a * // 'dod chags la sogs pas ni bdag la 'gar yang phan mi 'dogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: @349a * // 'dod chags la sogs pas ni bdag la 'gar yang phan mi 'dogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that attachment and so on never benefit the self?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sbyor ba tsam yin la thar pa la ni de dang bral ba tsam yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba tsam yin la thar pa la ni de dang bral ba tsam yin no //
translated: Liberation is merely the separation of the self from them.

original: de'i phyir bdag zhig pa thar pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag zhig pa thar pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Therefore, the self‚Äôs destruction is not liberation.

original: skyon can zhes bya ba ni /üîΩmin zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyon can zhes bya ba ni / min zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The response to this is:

original: de ldan bas ni 'dod chags la sogs ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de ldan bas ni 'dod chags la sogs ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self is not the locus of attachment and so on‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúbecause it is not the case.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúEndowed with‚Äù means ‚Äúpossessing.‚Äù

original: rang ni rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: rang ni rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means ‚Äúby its own nature.‚Äù

original: bdag ni log pa kho na yin te de dang gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /üîΩdbyug pa can ni dbyug pa min //
analyzed: bdag ni log pa kho na yin te de dang gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i don ni / dbyug pa can ni dbyug pa min //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe self is just a misconception‚Äù is that it is not identical to them.

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te / myong phyir de ni chags bral te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // gal te / myong phyir de ni chags bral te //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe self is not the locus of attachment and so on‚Äù is like the statement ‚ÄúThe stick is not the man.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument is: ‚ÄúIt is detached because it experiences.‚Äù

original: de nyid sgrub par byed pa ni myong ba las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid sgrub par byed pa ni myong ba las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The response to this is: ‚ÄúIt is not detached because of experience.‚Äù

original: bdag gis 'dod chags la sogs par rang rig par yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad gzhan rig kho na yin gyi rang rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dod chags la sogs par rang rig par yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad gzhan rig kho na yin gyi rang rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were reflexive awareness of desire and so on, it would be desire and so on itself. Therefore everything is only the awareness of others and not reflexive awareness.

original: de ltar bud med la sogs pa rig pas de'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes lan du zer ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bud med la sogs pa rig pas de'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes lan du zer ba ni /
translated: In response to the statement that it follows that the yogi would become a woman and so on because he is aware of a woman and so on, he says:

original: bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWoman‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar na 'dod chags can ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod chags can ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúHow could he be desirous?‚Äù

original: 'brel phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause of the connection.‚Äù

original: rigs pa de dang ldan pa nyid yin na rnal 'byor pa yang de dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rigs pa de dang ldan pa nyid yin na rnal 'byor pa yang de dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: If he possesses that reasoning, then the yogi would also possess it.üîΩTherefore, although he is aware, it is contradictory to assert that he is without desire.

original: / de'i phyir rig pa yin yang 'dod chags med pa nyid du 'dod pa 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: / de'i phyir rig pa yin yang 'dod chags med pa nyid du 'dod pa 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: He says:

original: chags sogs myong bas rnal 'byor pa //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags sogs myong bas rnal 'byor pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The yogi experiences desire and so on.

original: grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the conclusion is:

original: tha dad pa ni bdag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams 'du ba las 'dod chags can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni bdag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams 'du ba las 'dod chags can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Attachment and so on are not related to the self through contact, but through inherence.

original: phrad pa las ni ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa las ni ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The self is related to attachment and so on through inherence, but not through contact.

original: de'i bdag ni yid dang ldan pa yin zhing yid ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin la de la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag ni yid dang ldan pa yin zhing yid ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin la de la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang 'du ba yin no //
translated: The self is related to the mind, and the mind is related to the self, and attachment and so on that exist in the mind are related to the self.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa'i bdag gzhan gyi bdag dang ldan pa yin pas mi skye pa'i phrad pas de la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang yang ldan pa'i 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa'i bdag gzhan gyi bdag dang ldan pa yin pas mi skye pa'i phrad pas de la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang yang ldan pa'i 'du ba yin no //
translated: Or, the yogi is related to the self of another, and attachment and so on that exist in the self of another are related to the yogi through contact, which is not arising.

original: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir khyod kyi rnal 'byor pa yang gzhan gyi 'dod chags dang 'brel ba las 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir khyod kyi rnal 'byor pa yang gzhan gyi 'dod chags dang 'brel ba las 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference, your yogi would become attached through being related to the attachment of another.

original: 'du ba dang phrad pa la khyad par yod ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'du ba dang phrad pa la khyad par yod ces zer ba ni /
translated: If you say that contact and inherence are different,

original: tha dad rtogs med ces bya @349b ba'o ;
analyzed: tha dad rtogs med ces bya @349b ba'o ;
translated: then it would not be recognized as different.

original: / bdag gi ngo bo yang rang rig pa dang ma 'khrul ba yin na /
analyzed: / bdag gi ngo bo yang rang rig pa dang ma 'khrul ba yin na /
translated: And the nature of the self is self-awareness and non-error.üîΩHow can it be non-different?

original: ji ltar tha mi dad par 'gyur ba yin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar tha mi dad par 'gyur ba yin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: bdag ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The self is the nature of everything.

original: bdag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The self is not the nature of awareness,

original: thams cad kyang thams cad rig par thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyang thams cad rig par thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: because it would follow that everything would be aware of everything.üîΩThe objection is:

original: 'on te 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But this is not so.

original: lan ni gzung bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzung bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is:üîΩThe object of experience and the experiencer are the same reality.

original: longs spyad par bya ba dang longs spyod par byed pa de dag gcig pa'i de nyid yin zhes bya ba 'di la dpe med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyad par bya ba dang longs spyod par byed pa de dag gcig pa'i de nyid yin zhes bya ba 'di la dpe med par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that there is no example for this, it is said:

original: ro sogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ro sogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Taste, etc.

original: longs spyad par bya ba las gzhan pa nyid longs spyod par byed pa de las kyang gzhan yin na /
analyzed: longs spyad par bya ba las gzhan pa nyid longs spyod par byed pa de las kyang gzhan yin na /
translated: If the experiencer were different from the object of experience, and that experiencer were also different from that,üîΩand that were also different from that, and that were also different from that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de las kyang gzhan yin zhing de las kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang gzhan yin zhing de las kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni skyon ma yin no //
translated: This is not a fault.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid la thug pa med pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid la thug pa med pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Because, like the effect and the cause, there is no infinite regress in the case of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de lta bu'i dgongs pa ni gal te yul nyams su myong ba ma yin na rtags med pa'i phyir ji ltar longs spyod pa por rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dgongs pa ni gal te yul nyams su myong ba ma yin na rtags med pa'i phyir ji ltar longs spyod pa por rtogs par byed /
translated: If the object is not experienced, how can it be known to be the experiencer, since there would be no evidence?

original: de nyams su myong na yang rang rig pa yin na ji ltar longs spyod par byed par rtogs pa'i thug pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyams su myong na yang rang rig pa yin na ji ltar longs spyod par byed par rtogs pa'i thug pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is experienced, and it is self-awareness, how can it be known to be the experiencer? There is no infinite regress,

original: longs spyod dang 'du ba can longs spyod pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni //
analyzed: longs spyod dang 'du ba can longs spyod pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni //
translated: because the experiencer is the one who experiences the object.

original: gal te de dang zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gal te de dang zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: If it is that, it is not the experiencer.

original: / longs spyod kyi gzhi longs spyod pa po yin na gzugs la spyod pa'i yul nyid longs spyod pa por 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / longs spyod kyi gzhi longs spyod pa po yin na gzugs la spyod pa'i yul nyid longs spyod pa por 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If the experiencer is the basis of the object, the object itself, which is the basis of experience, would be the experiencer.

original: longs spyod nyams su myong las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod nyams su myong las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúFrom the experience of the object. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni bdag bzhin du yul nyid la yang blo'i gzhi nyid du mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni bdag bzhin du yul nyid la yang blo'i gzhi nyid du mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The mundane convention is the same as the self, and is also the basis of the mind with regard to the object.

original: dmyal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúthe hell being.‚Äù

original: longs spyod par bya ba la yod pa'i longs spyod ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas longs spyod pa po rjes su dpog pa po yin no snyam du sems pa kho na zer ba ni /üîΩci ste rjes su dpag bya de //
analyzed: longs spyod par bya ba la yod pa'i longs spyod ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas longs spyod pa po rjes su dpog pa po yin no snyam du sems pa kho na zer ba ni / ci ste rjes su dpag bya de //
translated: Since it is not tenable that the object of enjoyment exists elsewhere, the enjoyer is inferred.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what you think.üîΩBut if the object of enjoyment is inferred,üîΩthen the enjoyer is not established.

original: gzhan gyis rig pa'i longs spyod pa po bsal nas rang rig pa nyid nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig pa'i longs spyod pa po bsal nas rang rig pa nyid nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: Having refuted the enjoyer known by another, the author now summarizes the self-awareness itself.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //üîΩji ltar me long dang ba'am //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o // ji ltar me long dang ba'am //
translated: Therefore, the self is the nature of self-awareness.üîΩJust as a clear mirror

original: ji ltar shel sgong dag pa la //üîΩde dang nyer gnas gang dang gang //
analyzed: ji ltar shel sgong dag pa la // de dang nyer gnas gang dang gang //
translated: or a clear crystalüîΩreflects whatever is placed near it,

original: de la de'i gzungs brnyan rtogs //
analyzed: de la de'i gzungs brnyan rtogs //
translated: so the self is said to be self-awareness.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas nye ba'i rung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad rig par thal bar 'gyur ba ma @350a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas nye ba'i rung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad kyang thams cad rig par thal bar 'gyur ba ma @350a * //
translated: The meaning of the above is that it is not the case that everything is the cognition of everything, because the principle of the apprehension of the object of cognition is not violated.

original: yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that it is not the case that everything is the cognition of everything, because the principle of the apprehension of the object of cognition is not violated.

original: gnas skabs pa sdud pa ni /
analyzed: gnas skabs pa sdud pa ni /
translated: The temporary collection is as follows:

original: gal te nges bdag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te nges bdag ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is the so-called self,

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid shel sgo bzhin du dang ba la /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid shel sgo bzhin du dang ba la /
translated: it is clear like a crystal ball, with the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: tshon sngon po la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi gzungs brnyan nyid 'byung ba dang nub pa dang ldan pa yin gyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshon sngon po la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi gzungs brnyan nyid 'byung ba dang nub pa dang ldan pa yin gyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo la ni ma yin te /
translated: and the reflection of another, such as a blue color, arises and disappears in it, but not in the nature of the realization.

original: mngon par shes pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩji ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems pa ni / ji ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought is that it is the object of superknowledge.üîΩIf, however, the cognition is not different from the blue color, etc.,

original: tshon sngon po la sogs pa dang tha mi dad par rig pa ni de kho na bzhin du tha dad pa mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshon sngon po la sogs pa dang tha mi dad par rig pa ni de kho na bzhin du tha dad pa mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: the meaning of the statement that it would be just as impermanent and different is taught:

original: bde la sogs pa tha dad phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde la sogs pa tha dad phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because pleasure and so on are different.

original: tha dad pa'i sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa dang tha mi dad par rig pa yang sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i bdag tu rig par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa dang tha mi dad par rig pa yang sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i bdag tu rig par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Nor does the awareness of the difference between blue and pleasure, etc. make one aware of a self that is not different from blue and pleasure, etc.

original: bdag tu gyur pas ni tha dad pa'i sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / de kho na bzhin du tha dad pas tha mi dad par rang bzhin gcig tu shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu gyur pas ni tha dad pa'i sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / de kho na bzhin du tha dad pas tha mi dad par rang bzhin gcig tu shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The self, being different from blue and pleasure, etc., is not known as having the same nature as they, since it is not different from them in the same way that they are not different from each other.

original: ci dad 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci dad 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the similarity?

original: ji ltar de nyid ni tshon sngon po la sogs pa'i tha snyad pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid ni tshon sngon po la sogs pa'i tha snyad pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that the self is the basis of the conventions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù while blue, etc. are the basis of the conventions of ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: gal te rang rig pa tha dad par rig pa ma yin du zin kyang rnam rtog ni rig pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa tha dad par rig pa ma yin du zin kyang rnam rtog ni rig pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If you say that although self-awareness is not the awareness of a difference, conceptual thought is awareness,

original: rig pa rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we reply that awareness is called ‚Äúawareness‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is the awareness of an object that is different from itself.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gcig pa nyid ni rang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gcig pa nyid ni rang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The identity that is imagined is in the nature of self and other.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore,

original: 'on te gzhan gyi bdag gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi bdag gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if the self of one person is not known by another,üîΩthen the self would not exist.üîΩIf the self is not an object of knowledge,

original: rig pa'i dngos po min na ni //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: rig pa'i dngos po min na ni // zhes smos te /
translated: then the self would not exist.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan gyi bdag mi rig na gzhan ni bdag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan gyi bdag mi rig na gzhan ni bdag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self of one person is not known by another, then the self would not exist.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag dag phan tshun 'jug pa ma yin par rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag dag phan tshun 'jug pa ma yin par rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the self of one person and the self of another are not mutually cognized,üîΩif the self were different, then the self would be different in every moment.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.

original: dbye ba yin na rang gi bdag la yang skad cig re re'i rig pa tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /üîΩde ni so sor rig ce na /
analyzed: dbye ba yin na rang gi bdag la yang skad cig re re'i rig pa tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / de ni so sor rig ce na /
translated: If the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.

original: gang du'ang gcig pa nyid mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /üîΩgcig mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcig la'o //
analyzed: gang du'ang gcig pa nyid mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste / gcig mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcig la'o //
translated: If the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩbshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nye bar bsdu ba ni de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbshad pa gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o // bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nye bar bsdu ba ni de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o // bshad pa gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: If the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.üîΩIf the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self.

original: ther zug rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ther zug rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the self were different in every moment, then the self would not be one and the same self

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid la ni 'khor ba nyid la @350b ste yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de nyid la ni 'khor ba nyid la @350b ste yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is.üîΩIn that very thing, i.e., in cyclic existence, because it is complete.

original: der zhes bya ba ni ther zug tu gnas pa nyid de kho na la yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni ther zug tu gnas pa nyid de kho na la yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that, i.e., in the very thing that is eternal, because it is complete.

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni srid pa ma yin la /
translated: Recognition of what was seen before is not possible.

original: srid na yang gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa de kho na'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid na yang gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa de kho na'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: And even if it were possible, it would occur only when the thing exists,

original: dngos po'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the power of the thing.

original: dus phyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus phyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not at a later time,üîΩbecause the thing does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of this is:

original: de'i rang bzhin yod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the existence of its intrinsic reality.

original: yul gyi stobs la mi rten pa bag chags las byung ba sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul gyi stobs la mi rten pa bag chags las byung ba sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that recognition of what was seen before, which arises from residual impressions and is not based on the power of an object, is not a valid cognition is:

original: yul med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Without an object.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa yang 'gyur ba can ma yin ba'i phyir dang / dmigs pa'i rim pa med pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir rtag pa yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te ther zug rtag nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa yang 'gyur ba can ma yin ba'i phyir dang / dmigs pa'i rim pa med pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir rtag pa yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te ther zug rtag nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not subject to change, and because it is not perceived in a sequential order, it is permanent.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid bshad pa ni //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid bshad pa ni //
translated: This verse is explained as follows:

original: gal te ther zug ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te ther zug ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is permanent,

original: 'gyur ba can ma yin pa nyid dang / dmigs pa'i rim pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gnyis po rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed par 'dod pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rim pa'i dmigs par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba can ma yin pa nyid dang / dmigs pa'i rim pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gnyis po rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed par 'dod pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rim pa'i dmigs par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: if you maintain that the two reasons, ‚Äúbecause it is not subject to change‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it is not perceived in a sequential order,‚Äù establish its permanence, then you are maintaining that it is perceived in a sequential order in samsara and nirvana.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: But if it is perceived in a sequential order, it is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa rim pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa rim pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not perceived in a sequential order.

original: ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ther zug tu gnas par ro //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ther zug tu gnas par ro //
translated: If it is not perceived, it is not permanent.

original: mtshungs pa nyid du dmigs pa yang //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid du dmigs pa yang //
translated: It is perceived in a uniform way.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad ba ni /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúIf the self were the aggregates‚Äù explains the meaning of the verse beginning ‚ÄúIf the self were the aggregates, it would have the nature of arising and disintegration.‚Äù

original: bshad pa gzhan bstan pa ni /

The meaning is that it is destroyed.üîΩIf the self of the liberated one and the self of the transmigrator are undifferentiated, then it is shown that the transmigrator would be liberated.üîΩThe meaning is that the self of the transmigrator would be the self of the liberated one.

original: de'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gal te bum pa'i nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the self of the transmigrator would be the self of the liberated one.üîΩIf the self of the liberated one and the self of the transmigrator are undifferentiated, then the transmigrator would be liberated.üîΩThe meaning is that the self of the transmigrator would be the self of the liberated one.üîΩIf the self of the liberated one and the self of the transmigrator are undifferentiated, then the transmigrator would be liberated.üîΩThe meaning is that the self of the transmigrator would be the self of the liberated one.üîΩIf the self of the liberated one and the self of the transmigrator are undifferentiated, then the transmigrator would be liberated.

original: dbye ba med pa'i gnas skabs la bdag tu shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa'i gnas skabs la bdag tu shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning is that the self of the transmigrator would be the self of the liberated one.üîΩIf the self of the liberated one and the self of the transmigrator are undifferentiated, then the transmigrator would be liberated.

original: nam mkha' nyid du nye bar son pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid du nye bar son pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the self of the transmigrator would be the self of the liberated one.üîΩIf the self of

original: 'o na ni bdag med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag tu shes pa'i yul ma yin pa ni bdag ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni bdag med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag tu shes pa'i yul ma yin pa ni bdag ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is not the object of the cognition of self, it is not a self, because it is not the self.

original: sems kyi ngo bo'i rtag tu'am khyab pa can yang ma yin te snang ba dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo'i rtag tu'am khyab pa can yang ma yin te snang ba dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the nature of the mind permanent or all-pervading, because it appears and disappears.

original: thag nye ba'i snang bzhin pa ni yul gzhan nam dus gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: thag nye ba'i snang bzhin pa ni yul gzhan nam dus gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: What is near appears, not what is far away or in the future.

original: de lta bu nyid ma yin na yang khyad par can du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo yang de ltar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /üîΩrang gi rang bzhin tsam rig pa //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ma yin na yang khyad par can du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo yang de ltar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / rang gi rang bzhin tsam rig pa //
translated: To show that the nature of something that is not like that, which is accepted as having a special nature, is also like that, he says:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The awareness of mere self-existence.

original: gcig la mthong ba'i yod pa'i ngo bo'am sems kyi ngo bo ni gzhan la yang de nyid sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gcig la mthong ba'i yod pa'i ngo bo'am sems kyi ngo bo ni gzhan la yang de nyid sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If the nature of something that is seen in one place is the same in another place, is the nature of the mind the same in another mind?

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Or is it a pot, etc.?

original: / sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni grol ba dang 'khor ba dag kyang gcig pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ni shin tu gsal bar bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni grol ba dang 'khor ba dag kyang gcig pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ni shin tu gsal bar bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that the previously seen is recognized establishes that liberation and cyclic existence are the same.

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i yul ni yul 'khor ba po'i bdag ni grol ba'i gnas skabs na yang thams cad nyams su myong ba dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa'i yul gyi tha snyad thams cad dang yon tan kun te
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i yul ni yul 'khor ba po'i bdag ni grol ba'i gnas skabs na yang thams cad nyams su myong ba dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa'i yul gyi tha snyad thams cad dang yon tan kun te
translated: It is very clear that the previously seen is not unrecognized.üîΩThe object of the experience of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and so on, the object of the transmigrator, the self, is not nonexistent even in the state of liberation, because all conventions of objects such as sons and wives and all qualities such as wisdom and intelligence are not averted.

original: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa ldog pas de la chags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa ldog pas de la chags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since there is no reason for attachment to them, they are not nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa 'di la don du gnyer bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni kun ldog pa ni nyams su myong ba dang yon tan dang ngo bo chags pa'i rten zlog pa gang la grol ba'i gnas skabs na ldog pa gang yin pa
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa 'di la don du gnyer bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni kun ldog pa ni nyams su myong ba dang yon tan dang ngo bo chags pa'i rten zlog pa gang la grol ba'i gnas skabs na ldog pa gang yin pa
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúreversal‚Äù is the reversal of the experience, the qualities, and the basis of attachment.

original: de la ji ltar 'dod pa ste chags pa ji ltar bdag gir byed /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'dod pa ste chags pa ji ltar bdag gir byed /
translated: How could one who is free in the state of reversal have desire, that is, attachment, for that?

original: de chags pa ji ltar bdag gir byed de chags pa'i rgyu @351b mtshan med na ji ltar chags pa yin zhes bya ba'i don yin zhing /
analyzed: de chags pa ji ltar bdag gir byed de chags pa'i rgyu @351b mtshan med na ji ltar chags pa yin zhes bya ba'i don yin zhing /
translated: How could one who is free have attachment for that? The meaning is that if there is no reason for attachment, how could there be attachment?

original: chags ba'i yul ni 'di 'dra ba yang ji ltar gzhan 'dra bar 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags ba'i yul ni 'di 'dra ba yang ji ltar gzhan 'dra bar 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that how could one who is free have desire, that is, attachment, for an object of attachment that is similar to that?

original: rdo ba dang ras bal la sogs pa la khyab pa can nam mkha'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rdo ba dang ras bal la sogs pa la khyab pa can nam mkha'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of space, which pervades such things as stones and cotton,

original: rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de kho na bdag yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de kho na bdag yin la /
translated: is just that which is its own nature. That is the self.

original: tha snyad du thams cad ni dor bya dang blang bya la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du thams cad ni dor bya dang blang bya la sogs pa ste /
translated: Conventionally, everything is to be rejected or accepted, and so on.

original: de las 'das pa ni chags pa'i yul las bzlog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las 'das pa ni chags pa'i yul las bzlog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the opposite of the object of attachment.

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i ngo bo las bzlog pa thar pa'i ngo bo la rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa la bar du gcod pa yin te don du gnyer ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i ngo bo las bzlog pa thar pa'i ngo bo la rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa la bar du gcod pa yin te don du gnyer ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Such means that it is an obstruction to the engagement of the conception of the nature of liberation, which is the opposite of the previous nature, because the desire to strive for it does not arise. The meaning is that it is an obstruction to the engagement of the conception of the nature of liberation, which is the opposite of the previous nature, because the desire to strive for it does not arise. The meaning is that it is an obstruction to the engagement of the conception of the nature of liberation, which is the opposite of the previous nature, because the desire to strive for it does not arise. The meaning is that it is an obstruction to the engagement of the conception of the nature of liberation, which is the opposite of the previous nature, because the desire to strive for it does not arise.

original: bdag la chags pa ni mngon du byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa ni mngon du byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with the manifest attachment to self.

original: grol ba'i gnas skabs na bdag nam mkha' bzhin du dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: grol ba'i gnas skabs na bdag nam mkha' bzhin du dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it unreasonable that in the state of liberation, the self would become non-existent like space?

original: bdag tu shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the cognition of self.

original: 'di rnams kyi bdag dang bdag gi 'di rnams zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa'am thun mong ba ma yin pa nyid ni 'ching ba yin pa ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi bdag dang bdag gi 'di rnams zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa'am thun mong ba ma yin pa nyid ni 'ching ba yin pa ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: The non-commonality of these are my self and mine is bondage. It is expressed as self and mine.

original: de ni thar pa la yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni thar pa la yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúin every way.‚Äù

original: bdag go zhes bya bar rig pa 'di yang /
analyzed: bdag go zhes bya bar rig pa 'di yang /
translated: This knowledge of ‚ÄúI am‚Äù

original: de'i med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i med pa kho na yin no //
translated: is just non-existent in liberation.

original: rmi lam mthong ba ma yin pa'i gnyid log pa grol ba'i dper byed do //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba ma yin pa'i gnyid log pa grol ba'i dper byed do //
translated: The example of the liberated one is the one who is asleep and not dreaming.

original: yin na yang bdag go zhes bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa ni 'brel pa'i rnam pa'am de dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa yang bdag tu 'dzin pa ni thams cad du chags pa'i ngo bo'i snying po can kho na yin no //üîΩde'i phyir yang bdag gi ba la mi thun mong ba la'am /
analyzed: yin na yang bdag go zhes bdag tu lta ba'i rnam pa ni 'brel pa'i rnam pa'am de dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa yang bdag tu 'dzin pa ni thams cad du chags pa'i ngo bo'i snying po can kho na yin no // de'i phyir yang bdag gi ba la mi thun mong ba la'am /
translated: But the form of the view of self, ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù is the form of attachment or the form of non-distinction. The grasping of self is always the essence of attachment.

original: thun mong ma yin pa la yang chags pa 'dren pa yin te de med na rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa la yang chags pa 'dren pa yin te de med na rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is my explanation that attachment to ‚Äúmine‚Äù is drawn to what is not shared or to what is shared, because when it is absent, it itself is absent.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pa ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pa ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: The author of the commentary is quite clear on this point.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su 'dor ba yin na 'jug pa'i yan lag med do //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su 'dor ba yin na 'jug pa'i yan lag med do //
translated: If one were to completely abandon the belief in self, then there would be no basis for engaging in the process of cyclic existence.

original: gang gi phyir de yod na snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa'i sdug bsngal can sgro btags nas de la sogs pa 'jug pa yin no //üîΩskad cig mar rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa kho nar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yod na snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa'i sdug bsngal can sgro btags nas de la sogs pa 'jug pa yin no // skad cig mar rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa kho nar bstan pa ni /
translated: Because, when it exists, one superimposes a single, enduring, and suffering self upon the prior and subsequent lives, and then engages in the process of cyclic existence.üîΩThe following two verses are stated to show that the knowledge of selflessness is not the basis for engaging in the process of cyclic existence.

original: gal te 'di la bdag 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gal te 'di la bdag 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: If one has the belief in self,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: If one has no belief in self, then one engages in the welfare of others.

original: @352a * // bdag tu smra ba don med par bstan pa ni gzhan gyis phyed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩyun ring bde ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba tsam gyis bdag gi ngo bo ni rtag tu gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: @352a * // bdag tu smra ba don med par bstan pa ni gzhan gyis phyed pa zhes bya'o // yun ring bde ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba tsam gyis bdag gi ngo bo ni rtag tu gsal ba yin la /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the belief in a self is pointless.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i bde ba yongs su 'dor ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i bde ba yongs su 'dor ba yin no //
translated: The self is not the support for the experience of the results of action, because the self is permanent, and because the self is unitary and without parts.üîΩThe following verse is stated to show that the self is not the basis for the experience of the results of action.

original: med pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso non-existent‚Äù means

original: the tshom za ba yod pa dang med pa'i thun mong ba nyid kyis med pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ni med par yang srid pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba yod pa dang med pa'i thun mong ba nyid kyis med pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ni med par yang srid pa'o //
translated: that the doubt is common to both existence and non-existence. The engagement in the position of non-existence is ‚Äúalso possible in non-existence.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma'i dngos po snang ba tsam la spre'u'i zla ba zhes pa dang sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i dngos po snang ba tsam la spre'u'i zla ba zhes pa dang sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The mere appearance of momentary things is like the ‚Äúmoon of the monkey.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du bdag tu lta ba can ni bdag gi bar chags pa ldog pa la 'bad pa dang bcas pa yin yang yon tan gyi cha mthong bas de la skyon du mthong ba bsgribs pa'i phyir mi rnyed pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du bdag tu lta ba can ni bdag gi bar chags pa ldog pa la 'bad pa dang bcas pa yin yang yon tan gyi cha mthong bas de la skyon du mthong ba bsgribs pa'i phyir mi rnyed pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni
translated: Therefore, in the same way, the one who has the view of self, although striving to turn away from attachment to the self, does not find it, because the perception of faults is obscured by seeing the aspect of good qualities. This is taught by

original: / brtson yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / brtson yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúalthough striving.‚Äù

original: chags pa dang bral ba la 'bad pa yin yang /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba la 'bad pa yin yang /
translated: Although striving for freedom from attachment,

original: chags pa dang bral ba la gegs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba la gegs byed pa yin no //
translated: one is obstructed from freedom from attachment.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: From what?

original: yon tan cha brten nas gang la 'jug pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan cha brten nas gang la 'jug pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: From engagement in that which is based on the aspect of good qualities.

original: bdag kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa po'i ngo bo dang de'i 'bras bu'i za ba po'i ngo bos kyang chags pa dang bral ba'i yul yin pas dor bya kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: bdag kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa po'i ngo bo dang de'i 'bras bu'i za ba po'i ngo bos kyang chags pa dang bral ba'i yul yin pas dor bya kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: I am also an object to be abandoned, since I am the nature of one who creates pleasure and pain, and the nature of one who experiences their result.üîΩThe thought is:

original: gal te bdag la 'ang zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gal te bdag la 'ang zhes bya ba /
translated: If I am also an object to be abandoned,

original: ngo bo gang gis bdag dor bya yin pa de kho na 'di'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis bdag dor bya yin pa de kho na 'di'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: by whatever nature the self is an object to be abandoned, that very nature is his.

original: ngo bo gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir bdag blang bya nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir bdag blang bya nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is not another nature, he teaches that the self is not an object to be taken up.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Now, he says,

original: ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis bdag 'dor ba ni dor byar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis bdag 'dor ba ni dor byar byed pa'o //
translated: by what manner, by what kind, is the self an object to be abandoned?üîΩHe says,

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni smra ba pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni smra ba pa'o //
translated: that is, the speaker.

original: blang bya la chags pa dang bral ba rnam pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: blang bya la chags pa dang bral ba rnam pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other manner of being free from attachment to an object to be taken up.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgom par bstan pa don med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgom par bstan pa don med do //
translated: For that reason, the teaching of the meditation on suffering is pointless.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni rgal ba'i don //
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni rgal ba'i don //
translated: The commentator explains the meaning of the objection:

original: ji ltar yod pa de ltar min //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa de ltar min //
translated: It is not as it exists.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the verse beginning with ‚ÄúIf one were to give up one‚Äôs body, etc.

original: bdag gi bzhin du bdag nyid 'dor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi bzhin du bdag nyid 'dor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: one gives up one‚Äôs self as if it were one‚Äôs own body.

original: ci zhig 'dor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'dor ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is given up?

original: chags pa 'ba' zhig 'dor ba yin //
analyzed: chags pa 'ba' zhig 'dor ba yin //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly attachment is given up.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is said.

original: chags pa dang bral ba ni chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba ni chags pa med pa ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment is non-attached.

original: bral ba'i sgra ni dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag la chags pa dang bral ba ni thar pa'i bde ba yin gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pa la mi srid par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bral ba'i sgra ni dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag la chags pa dang bral ba ni thar pa'i bde ba yin gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pa la mi srid par bstan pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúfree‚Äù has the meaning of negation.

original: bde bar gnas pa ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩda ni chags ba la gang yin med //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa ni zhes bya ba'o // da ni chags ba la gang yin med //
translated: Freedom from attachment to self is the bliss of liberation. It is not possible for one who has the notion of self. This is taught by ‚Äúone who abides in bliss.

original: @352b ces bya ba'i don bstan pa ni gal te bdag las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @352b ces bya ba'i don bstan pa ni gal te bdag las zhes bya'o //
translated: Now, the meaning of ‚Äúthere is no attachment to anything‚Äù is taught: ‚ÄúIf one were to give up one‚Äôs self, etc.

original: 'di la ni rgol ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni rgol ba la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúto one who objects‚Äù means to one who argues.

original: smras pa ni rnam 'grel lo //
analyzed: smras pa ni rnam 'grel lo //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù means in the Pramanavarttika.

original: de ni ji ltar bdag 'dor ba de bzhin du sdug bsngal bsgom pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar bdag 'dor ba de bzhin du sdug bsngal bsgom pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as one gives up one‚Äôs self, so the cultivation of suffering is not meaningless.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de'i phyir de dor ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dor ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is to be abandoned.

original: dor ba ni chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dor ba ni chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Abandonment is not the separation from attachment,

original: gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the existence of another.

original: bdag ni dor ba nyid du mi nus so zhes bya ba brtags pa ni chags pa dang bral ba la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni bdag la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag ni dor ba nyid du mi nus so zhes bya ba brtags pa ni chags pa dang bral ba la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni bdag la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The examination of the statement, ‚ÄúI am not able to abandon myself,‚Äù is taught to be the same in the case of separation from attachment:

original: ji ltar de med pa dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar de med pa dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as that does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te chags pa nyid chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te chags pa nyid chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
translated: But if attachment itself becomes separated from attachment, the response to that is, ‚ÄúThat is attachment.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is separation from attachment.

original: de ltar ni chags pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: de ltar ni chags pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù is by the nature of attachment.

original: zad pa dang phyogs gcig ces bya ba'i bdag nyid kun nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang phyogs gcig ces bya ba'i bdag nyid kun nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to the nature of exhaustion and one part.

original: gcig ni cha shas med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni cha shas med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äù is partless.

original: gcig la yang yan lag can bzhin du phyogs gcig yod pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gcig la yang yan lag can bzhin du phyogs gcig yod pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: One should think that just as the whole exists in each part, so too does one part exist in each whole.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú That which‚Äù refers to the whole.

original: de lta yin na yan lag can de yan lag re re la yongs su rdzogs pas tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na yan lag can de yan lag re re la yongs su rdzogs pas tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the whole would be completely different from each part.

original: tha dad pa la yang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo rig pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa la yang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo rig pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to show that even in the case of difference, the state of awareness of a nondifferent nature exists, he says,

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so. . .

original: ji ltar thug pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thug pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù How is there an infinite regress?

original: gzhan dang gzhan brtags pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan brtags pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú By postulating another and another. . .

original: ngo bo gcig byung ba yin na ngo bo snga ma bor ba dang ngo bo gzhan byung pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig byung ba yin na ngo bo snga ma bor ba dang ngo bo gzhan byung pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù If a single nature arises, it is reasonable to say that it abandons the former nature and that another nature arises.

original: de ni ji ltar bdag 'dor ba //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar bdag 'dor ba //
translated: ‚Äú How is it that the self is abandoned? . . .üîΩ‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to show that this is explained, he says,

original: de'i phyir des ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Therefore, by that . . .üîΩ‚Äù

original: / rnam pa gang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: / rnam pa gang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy any means‚Äù means by the nature of being free from attachment.

original: rnam pa gzhan du sbyar ba ni gal te bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du sbyar ba ni gal te bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other way of applying it is if I were to have attachment to it.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni de nyid ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni de nyid ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthat very thing.‚Äù

original: gang la chags pa dang bral ba med pa de 'dor ba min zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la chags pa dang bral ba med pa de 'dor ba min zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is not free from attachment is not to be abandoned‚Äù is connected.

original: yul la ltos nas don med pa yin no //
analyzed: yul la ltos nas don med pa yin no //
translated: It is meaningless in relation to the object.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not done in another way.

original: med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is not done.

original: gal te don med pa yin na de las kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don med pa yin na de las kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is meaningless, what is the point of that?

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBy cultivating suffering.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa ni mngon du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa ni mngon du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: Cultivating suffering is not for the sake of manifest freedom from attachment.

original: 'on kyang @353a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang @353a * //
translated: However,
