original: sems la dbang du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yin la sems dbang du bya ba yang skyes bu'i gnas skabs thams cad na yod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgom pa bstan pas ci dgos te ma bstan kyang zhes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems la dbang du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir yin la sems dbang du bya ba yang skyes bu'i gnas skabs thams cad na yod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgom pa bstan pas ci dgos te ma bstan kyang zhes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: It is for the purpose of gaining control over the mind. And since gaining control over the mind exists in all situations of a person, what is the use of teaching the meditation on suffering?üîΩThe meaning of the statement ‚Äúeven though it is not taught‚Äù is as follows.

original: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas te nye bar bstan pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgoms pas te nye bar bstan pas kyang ngo //
translated: Even though the meditation on suffering is taught,

original: de dag ces bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: ‚Äúthey‚Äù refers to persons.

original: sdug bsngal nyid ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuffering‚Äù is the establishment of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'dres par rnam par shes par byed pa ni nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'dres par rnam par shes par byed pa ni nges par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuffering is mixed with consciousness‚Äù is the ascertainment.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the essence.

original: sngar yang ni bstan pa'i snga rol du yang mngon du byed pa kho na yin gyi de las chags pa dang ma bral na nye bar bstan pa las kyang chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar yang ni bstan pa'i snga rol du yang mngon du byed pa kho na yin gyi de las chags pa dang ma bral na nye bar bstan pa las kyang chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even before the teaching, they make it manifest, but if they are not free from attachment to that, they will not become free from attachment through the teaching.

original: gang gi phyir de yang de'i rjes su smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yang de'i rjes su smra ba yin no //
translated: because he is a follower of that.

original: sngar chags pa dang bral ba'i yul med par bstan nas /
analyzed: sngar chags pa dang bral ba'i yul med par bstan nas /
translated: Having previously shown that there is no object of detachment,

original: da ltar ni chags pa dang bral bsgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni chags pa dang bral bsgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: now he shows that it is not the cause of detachment.

original: kho bo cag gis ni 'du byed pa'i sdug bsngal nyid du rtogs nas blang bya dang dor bya dang bral ba'i phyir ste'u dang tsan dan dag gi 'dra ba nyid ni chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i bsgom pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni 'du byed pa'i sdug bsngal nyid du rtogs nas blang bya dang dor bya dang bral ba'i phyir ste'u dang tsan dan dag gi 'dra ba nyid ni chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i bsgom pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: We, however, having realized the suffering of conditioned existence, are free from the acceptance and rejection of desirable and undesirable things, and are like a lump of earth and a lump of sandalwood, because we are detached. Therefore, he teaches the cultivation of that.

original: chags pa dang bral pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid kho na bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid kho na bstan pa ni /
translated: He shows that it is not the cause of detachment:

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThis does not lead to detachment.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal sgom pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal sgom pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He clarifies this: ‚ÄúThe cultivation of suffering.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshogs su mngon sum gyi nges pa yin yang bde ba 'dod pas dbang byas pa'i yid can ni dran pa med pas nye bar zhi ba las mi ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshogs su mngon sum gyi nges pa yin yang bde ba 'dod pas dbang byas pa'i yid can ni dran pa med pas nye bar zhi ba las mi ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even though the collection of suffering is directly ascertained, how can those who are dominated by the desire for pleasure possess the peace that is free from memory?

original: dga' ba'i ro yis tshim rnams kyis //
analyzed: dga' ba'i ro yis tshim rnams kyis //
translated: Those who are satisfied by the taste of pleasure

original: zhi ba'i sems kyi bde gang yin //üîΩnor la brkam pa de dang der //
analyzed: zhi ba'i sems kyi bde gang yin // nor la brkam pa de dang der //
translated: do not have the bliss of a peaceful mind.üîΩHow can those who are greedy for wealth

original: rgyug pa rnams la ga la yod //
analyzed: rgyug pa rnams la ga la yod //
translated: and run here and there have that?

original: gzhan yang rgya mtsho'i ska rags can gyi sa gzhi ma lus pa dang / ba lang dang rta la sogs pa thob kyang nor la brkam chags can ni de rnams kyis kyang tshim par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgya mtsho'i ska rags can gyi sa gzhi ma lus pa dang / ba lang dang rta la sogs pa thob kyang nor la brkam chags can ni de rnams kyis kyang tshim par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, even if those who are greedy for wealth obtain the entire earth girded by the ocean, and even if they obtain cattle, horses, and so on, they are not satisfied by those things.

original: 'on kyang bde ba ni no rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba ni no rnyed pa yin no //
translated: However, it is said that wealth is the cause of happiness.

original: bde ba la sbyor bzhin pa ni de tshol ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas sdug bsngal ba kho na la bde bar mngon par sems pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgom pa drang srong rnams kyis bstan pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩgal te rab tu zhi ba'i ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sbyor bzhin pa ni de tshol ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas sdug bsngal ba kho na la bde bar mngon par sems pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bsgom pa drang srong rnams kyis bstan pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni / gal te rab tu zhi ba'i ste /
translated: Since those who are engaged in pleasure are suffering due to the discursive thought of seeking pleasure, etc., and they think that suffering is pleasure, the sages taught the meditation on suffering.üîΩIf one does not crave the pleasure of cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba'i bde ba la sred par mi 'gyur ba ni sdug bsngal bsgoms @353b pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bde ba la sred par mi 'gyur ba ni sdug bsngal bsgoms @353b pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: one is liberated through the meditation on suffering.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa yin yang bdag tu mngon par zhugs pa can ni bdag gi ba la chags pa ldog par mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa yin yang bdag tu mngon par zhugs pa can ni bdag gi ba la chags pa ldog par mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though one meditates on suffering, one who is engaged in the view of self does not stop attachment to mine.

original: 'dir ni zhi ba bdag tu lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhi ba bdag tu lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, peace is the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba la yang kha cig tu sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du mthong ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid snang ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la yang kha cig tu sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du mthong ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid snang ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that in some places the view of self is seen as the cause of suffering and one becomes free from attachment?

original: rigs pa de nyid kyis thams cad du de bzhin du 'gyur ba srid do snyam du sems pa la //
analyzed: rigs pa de nyid kyis thams cad du de bzhin du 'gyur ba srid do snyam du sems pa la //
translated: It is possible that the same reasoning applies in all cases.

original: gal te de la nyes pa yis //
analyzed: gal te de la nyes pa yis //
translated: If there were no fault in that,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: there would be no liberation.

original: bdag tu lta ba la chags pa dang bral bas ldog par snang ba yin gyi mthong ba dang 'gal ba srid pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la chags pa dang bral bas ldog par snang ba yin gyi mthong ba dang 'gal ba srid pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one would not be liberated from attachment to the view of self. It is not possible that the view of self contradicts seeing.

original: chags pa'i nus pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i nus pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The power of attachment is the apprehension of self and entities connected to the self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa'i shes rab ldog pa'i don du 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa'i shes rab ldog pa'i don du 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The meaning of the wisdom connected to the apprehension of self being reversed is the meaning of ‚Äúnoble.‚Äù

original: gzhom pa dang nye bar len pa dag 'joms pa'i rgyu dag med par lta ba yin gyi bdag tu lta ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhom pa dang nye bar len pa dag 'joms pa'i rgyu dag med par lta ba yin gyi bdag tu lta ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the view of self is not the cause of destroying and relinquishing the view of self.

original: bdag shes pa ni khams gsum po'i skyon mthong ba can gyi chags pa dang bral ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag shes pa ni khams gsum po'i skyon mthong ba can gyi chags pa dang bral ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the knowledge of self the freedom from attachment of one who sees the faults of the three realms?

original: de ji ltar gcig la nyes pas blo ldog pa yin snyam du sems pa la /üîΩblang dang ror bya'i khyad yod na //
analyzed: de ji ltar gcig la nyes pas blo ldog pa yin snyam du sems pa la / blang dang ror bya'i khyad yod na //
translated: How is it that one is turned away from the self by the faults of the appropriated aggregates?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a difference between what is appropriated and what is enjoyed,

original: bdag tu smra ba ni khams gsum po'i gdon mi za bar dor bya yin yang nye bar blang bar bya ba la brten nas gdon mi za bar blang bya yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba ni khams gsum po'i gdon mi za bar dor bya yin yang nye bar blang bar bya ba la brten nas gdon mi za bar blang bya yin zhing /
translated: The proponents of a self say that the three realms are definitely to be abandoned, but that which is to be appropriated is definitely to be appropriated.

original: nye bar blang bya yang bdag gam de'i chos rnams kyang yin la /
analyzed: nye bar blang bya yang bdag gam de'i chos rnams kyang yin la /
translated: The object of appropriation is the self or its attributes.

original: de 'di yang nye bar blang bya'i nus pa ni byas pa'i phan pa gzhan las de'i nus pa'i sa bon yin zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de 'di yang nye bar blang bya'i nus pa ni byas pa'i phan pa gzhan las de'i nus pa'i sa bon yin zhes brjod de /
translated: The capacity of the object of appropriation is the seed of the capacity of the benefit that is produced from another.

original: de la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin yang rung ma yin yang rung de la ltos pa'i nye bar blang bya'i nus pa de nyid ni gnod pa byed pa po la rgyab kyis phyogs par nye bar 'gro ba'i zhe sdang gi sa bon yin par yang shes par
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin yang rung ma yin yang rung de la ltos pa'i nye bar blang bya'i nus pa de nyid ni gnod pa byed pa po la rgyab kyis phyogs par nye bar 'gro ba'i zhe sdang gi sa bon yin par yang shes par
translated: Whether or not it benefits that self, the capacity of the object of appropriation that depends on it is the seed of the aversion that turns away from the one who harms it.

original: bya'o // gal te thams cad du mi 'gyur ba de lta na ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer ba la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bya'o // gal te thams cad du mi 'gyur ba de lta na ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer ba la bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is not so in all cases, then how is it?

original: rnam grangs kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúBy way of a category.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag de kho na bzhin du 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag de kho na bzhin du 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The arising of desire and hatred that have that as their cause is just like that.

original: 'dod pa dang sdang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang sdang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúDesire and hatred.‚Äù

original: bdag med par lta ba po'i blang bya'i ma yin pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba po'i blang bya'i ma yin pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Since the view of selflessness is not the object of desire, it is not possible.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi sa bon yin zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩbdag med @354a * //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi sa bon yin zhes bstan pa ni / bdag med @354a * //
translated: Since it is not turned away from, how can it be the seed of that?

original: par lta ba la ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par lta ba la ni zhes bya'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThe view of selflessness.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba can yang khams gsum po la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can yang khams gsum po la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the one who has the view of self also not free from attachment to the three realms?

original: yul gzhan yang med na ji ltar 'ga' zhig la ltos pa'am ldang bar byed pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yul gzhan yang med na ji ltar 'ga' zhig la ltos pa'am ldang bar byed pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If there is no other object, how can it be that it depends on or arises from something?

original: skyon med yul can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon med yul can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThe faultless object.‚Äù

original: bdag la chags pa yod na khams gsum po de la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i cha dang ldan pa la chags pa dang ldan pa nyid mi 'thob pas /üîΩbsam med bdag la chags pa yis //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa yod na khams gsum po de la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i cha dang ldan pa la chags pa dang ldan pa nyid mi 'thob pas / bsam med bdag la chags pa yis //
translated: If one is attached to the self, one does not obtain attachment to the aspect that benefits the three realms.

original: ji ltar rnyed bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúHow can one who is attached to the self, which is devoid of thought‚Äù teaches this.

original: skyon dang ldan pa nyid las rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni bdag gi ba bzhin du bdag la yang yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa nyid las rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni bdag gi ba bzhin du bdag la yang yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúOne turns away from the self because it is flawed, just as one does from what belongs to the self‚Äù teaches that the self is flawed.

original: 'on te skyon bcas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te skyon bcas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúBut if the self is flawed‚Äù teaches that the self is flawed.

original: bden te / so so'i skye bos yon tan mthong bas skyon bsgribs nas len par byed la /
analyzed: bden te / so so'i skye bos yon tan mthong bas skyon bsgribs nas len par byed la /
translated: It is true that ordinary people, seeing the good qualities of the self, cover over its flaws and take up the view of the self.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa'i gdams ngag dang ldan pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa ni /üîΩskyon mthong nas yon tan len pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /üîΩyon tan mthong ba las byung ba'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa'i gdams ngag dang ldan pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa ni / skyon mthong nas yon tan len pa yin no snyam du sems pa la / yon tan mthong ba las byung ba'i //
translated: But those who are equipoised and possess the instruction on the contemplation of suffering see the flaws of the self and do not take up the view of the self.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúOne who sees the self as flawed‚Äù teaches this.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúOne who sees the self as flawed‚Äù teaches this.

original: nyes pa mthong ba ni bsgom pa las byung bas nyes pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa mthong ba ni bsgom pa las byung bas nyes pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing faults is seeing faults that arise from meditation.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi lus dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams la chags pa ni yon tan mthong ba'i bskyed bya ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi lus dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams la chags pa ni yon tan mthong ba'i bskyed bya ma yin te /
translated: The attachment of ordinary beings to their bodies, faculties, and so on is not produced by seeing good qualities.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no concomitance and no reversal.

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught by

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to attachment.

original: de ltar yon tan mthong ba las skyes ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan mthong ba las skyes ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced in that way from seeing good qualities.

original: byis sogs la yang zhes bya bas ni ldog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byis sogs la yang zhes bya bas ni ldog pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in fools‚Äù teaches that there is no reversal.

original: yon tan las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not produced from good qualities.

original: ldog pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ldog pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because there is no reversal, this is taught by

original: skyon ldan la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon ldan la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in those with faults.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The absence of concomitance is taught by

original: med phyir zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med phyir zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag la ni gzhan gyi lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni gzhan gyi lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to the bodies, faculties, and so on of others.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'i bdag gi ba la med pa'i phyir yang rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i bdag gi ba la med pa'i phyir yang rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since there is no self that possesses the qualities, it is shown that there is no concomitance.

original: bdag gi ba la 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ba la 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the case of what is mine‚Äù is also like that.

original: gal te yon tan mthong ba las byung ba ma yin pa de lta na cis bskyed pa yin snyam du sems pa la bdag gi blo bcom pas 'dir dor ba yin gyi bzlog pa min zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas 'on kyang bdag gi ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yon tan mthong ba las byung ba ma yin pa de lta na cis bskyed pa yin snyam du sems pa la bdag gi blo bcom pas 'dir dor ba yin gyi bzlog pa min zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas 'on kyang bdag gi ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not arise from seeing the qualities, then what produces it? The thought is that it is discarded here because the idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is destroyed, not the opposite. The idea is that the phrase ‚Äúin the case of what is mine‚Äù is used.

original: chags pa bzhin du bdag gi ba'i blo la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: chags pa bzhin du bdag gi ba'i blo la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as in the case of attachment‚Äù is used to show that the idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù also has no concomitance and no reversal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na zhes @354b bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na zhes @354b bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor this very reason‚Äù is used.

original: de yang ni bdag gi ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: de yang ni bdag gi ba'i blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the idea of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir yon tan mi mthong bas ni skyon mthong bas spong ba yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan mi mthong bas ni skyon mthong bas spong ba yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúbecause one does not see the qualities‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba kho na las spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba kho na las spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is abandoned only through the vision of no-self.

original: bdag gi ba'i blo dang chags pa dag gis slar yang yon tan mthong ba'i bskyed bya nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gi ba'i blo dang chags pa dag gis slar yang yon tan mthong ba'i bskyed bya nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the view of good qualities and attachment are again produced by the view of self and mine is:üîΩMoreover, the good qualities

original: gzhan yang yod min yon tan ni //üîΩsgro 'dogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod min yon tan ni // sgro 'dogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are not existent.

original: chags pa'i rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: chags pa'i rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The cause of attachment is the view of self and mine.üîΩThe meditation on suffering is the means of establishing the absence of that, but it is not the means of harming the result of that, attachment.

original: de dad 'gal ba ma yin pa sdug bsngal bsgom pa sgrub pa yin gyi de'i 'bras bu chags pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de dad 'gal ba ma yin pa sdug bsngal bsgom pa sgrub pa yin gyi de'i 'bras bu chags pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary is:

original: de'i phyir gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the same.

original: 'grel par ni yon tan mthong ba ni skyon mthong ba dang 'gal ba can du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel par ni yon tan mthong ba ni skyon mthong ba dang 'gal ba can du bstan pa ni /
translated: In the commentary, the statement that the view of good qualities is contradictory with the view of faults is:

original: zhen pas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩldog bya chags pas bzlog bya ma yin pa yang skyon mthong ba ni ldog par byed pas ldog pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhen pas zhes bya ba'o // ldog bya chags pas bzlog bya ma yin pa yang skyon mthong ba ni ldog par byed pas ldog pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Attachment is said to be the cause.üîΩThe statement that the view of faults is the means of reversing attachment, but attachment is not the means of reversing the view of faults, is:

original: gnod byed de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod byed de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The view of faults is the means of reversing attachment.

original: ldog bya chags pa'i bskyed bya nyid ldog byed la yang mi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: ldog bya chags pa'i bskyed bya nyid ldog byed la yang mi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The characteristic of non-engagement is the cessation of the object of attachment, which is to be ceased.

original: de la cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it were like that,

original: skyon du lta ba ldog pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyon du lta ba ldog pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the view of the faults would cease.

original: rang bzhin ni bdag ma yin pa'i lus la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bdag ma yin pa'i lus la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The body, etc. that are not the self are the nature.

original: skyes bu ni bdag yin zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu ni bdag yin zhing /
translated: The person is the self.

original: de dang bye brag ni dbye ba ste de yongs su shes pa las grol ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang bye brag ni dbye ba ste de yongs su shes pa las grol ba yin te /
translated: Liberation is from the complete understanding of the distinction between them.

original: de yongs su ma shes pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su ma shes pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not completely understanding that, there is the cause of cyclic existence.üîΩThe cause of cyclic existence is taught to be the non-understanding of that, because it is the means of accomplishing attachment, etc.

original: de yongs su mi shes pa yang chags pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩrtogs pa dag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yongs su mi shes pa yang chags pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan pa ni / rtogs pa dag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of cyclic existence is taught to be the non-understanding of that, because it is the means of accomplishing attachment, etc.

original: 'di la lan du /
analyzed: 'di la lan du /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gzhan dang gzhan don gnyer zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa mkhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan don gnyer zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa mkhan gyi'o //
translated: The desire for the benefit of others, etc. is the author of the commentary.

original: bden mod kyi bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis sdug bsngal gyi shes pa chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis sdug bsngal gyi shes pa chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: True, but the proponents of a self do not have a knowledge of suffering that is free from attachment.

original: 'on kyang bdag med par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag med par lta ba yin no //
translated: However, they do have a view of selflessness.

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa 'dus pa bdag ma yin pa la bdag tu 'dzin pas na bcom pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa 'dus pa bdag ma yin pa la bdag tu 'dzin pas na bcom pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The body, the sense faculties, etc., are not the self, but they are grasped as the self. Therefore, they are not accepted as the self.

original: de'i phyir de ni de la bdag ston pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de la bdag ston pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is not taught to be that.

original: 'di dag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ma yin te /
translated: They are not that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal shes pa ni rtags can yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal shes pa ni rtags can yin te /
translated: The knowledge of desire, hatred, effort, pleasure, and pain are the signs.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir brten pa yin gyi lus @355a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir brten pa yin gyi lus @355a * //
translated: Desire, etc., are the results and are based on the body.

original: ni rten ma yin te /
analyzed: ni rten ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the basis.

original: byis pa la sogs pa'i skabs kyi dbye bas mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis dran pa ma yin la /
analyzed: byis pa la sogs pa'i skabs kyi dbye bas mi rtag pa'i phyir ro // gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis dran pa ma yin la /
translated: It is impermanent because it is divided into the stages of childhood, etc.üîΩOne does not remember what another has experienced.

original: ma dran na mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma dran na mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If one does not remember, one does not connect.

original: gang gi phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i nyams su myong ba dag mtshams sbyor ba ni dran pa dang lhan cig yul gcig nyams su myong ba ste /üîΩrim gyis don du mar mthong ba gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la de bzhin du skyes pa'i byis pa'i skye ba'i dang po la skye ba snga ma la goms pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa la dran pa'i rgyun gyis dga' ba dang
analyzed: gang gi phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i nyams su myong ba dag mtshams sbyor ba ni dran pa dang lhan cig yul gcig nyams su myong ba ste / rim gyis don du mar mthong ba gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la de bzhin du skyes pa'i byis pa'i skye ba'i dang po la skye ba snga ma la goms pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa la dran pa'i rgyun gyis dga' ba dang
translated: Because the former and latter experiences are linked, they are experienced as a single object by memory.üîΩWhen one sees many objects in sequence, they are understood to be one.üîΩIn the same way, the first moment of birth of a newborn infant is the result of the pleasure and pain of the previous life that was familiar to it. The continuum of memory infers the occurrence of other lives, such as the one that preceded it.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las skye ba gzhan la byung ba rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi shes pa thar pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ma bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las skye ba gzhan la byung ba rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi shes pa thar pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ma bstan pa ni /
translated: Since the knowledge of suffering is not a branch of liberation, it is not taught.

original: shes par sla ba'i phyir yang nye bar bstan par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: shes par sla ba'i phyir yang nye bar bstan par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not taught because it is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang tha dad pa'i shes pa yang ngo shes pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang tha dad pa'i shes pa yang ngo shes pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the teaching of recognition of a consciousness that is different from the self is

original: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba rigs par mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba rigs par mthong ste /
translated: seen to be reasonable,

original: gnas skabs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows the situation.

original: chags pa ni gcig nyid du mthong bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chags pa ni gcig nyid du mthong bas ma yin gyi /
translated: Attachment is not seen as a unity,

original: 'on kyang tha dad pas mthong bas yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩchags min bdag la chags pa ste//
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pas mthong bas yin par bstan pa ni / chags min bdag la chags pa ste//
translated: but rather is taught to be seen as a plurality.üîΩIt is not attachment to the self,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: but rather attachment to what is not the self.

original: dmigs pa ste longs spyod kyi nang gi yan lag ni nye ba'i sgrub bye dbang po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa ste longs spyod kyi nang gi yan lag ni nye ba'i sgrub bye dbang po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The object, the internal parts of enjoyment, are the near accompaniers, the sense faculties, etc.

original: tha dad par mthong ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad par mthong ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing as a plurality is seeing as impermanent.

original: tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: The plurality is the negation.üîΩIf that were so, there would be no liberation,

original: de lta yin na thar pa med pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni tha dad par bstan pa tshad ma dang ma 'brel ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta yin na thar pa med pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni tha dad par bstan pa tshad ma dang ma 'brel ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that the teaching of plurality is not connected with valid knowledge.

original: bde ba don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPursuing pleasure‚Äù means being attached to the self.

original: gtso bo dang zhes bya ba ni snga na gcig pa yin na spros pa'i 'bras bu la gtso bo dang gcig par sems pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo dang zhes bya ba ni snga na gcig pa yin na spros pa'i 'bras bu la gtso bo dang gcig par sems pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe principal‚Äù means that if there is oneness prior to the manifestation of the effect, one thinks that the principal is one with the effect.

original: rang nyid sems pa'i zhes bya ba'i phyed bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid sems pa'i zhes bya ba'i phyed bshad pa ni /
translated: The first half of the verse beginning with ‚Äúthe principal itself‚Äù is explained.

original: gtso bo nang du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyul nyid du gtso bo rjes su zhugs pa yod pa kho na zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gtso bo nang du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'o // yul nyid du gtso bo rjes su zhugs pa yod pa kho na zhes zer ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe principal itself enters into itself‚Äù means that the principal itself enters into itself.üîΩ‚ÄúThe principal itself exists as the object‚Äù means that the principal itself exists as the object.

original: yul nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù means the object of the principal.

original: blo med par yang zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i snga rol na'o //
analyzed: blo med par yang zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i snga rol na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven without intelligence‚Äù means prior to manifestation.

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa ni /
translated: The second half of the verse is explained.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi 'dod pa yang //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi 'dod pa yang //
translated: ‚ÄúThe desires of human beings‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: means that

original: 'di yan chad 'di'i blo'i mngon par 'dod @355b pa yang gtso bo las ma yin gyi 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las yin no //
analyzed: 'di yan chad 'di'i blo'i mngon par 'dod @355b pa yang gtso bo las ma yin gyi 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las yin no //
translated: up to this point, the desires of the intellect are not from the principal, but rather from beginningless latent propensities.

original: gal te de lta na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang de ltar 'byung ba'i phyir gtso bo ni mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang de ltar 'byung ba'i phyir gtso bo ni mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gal te thog med bag chags las //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thog med bag chags las // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is from beginningless latent impressions,

original: bag chags ni gtso bo'i rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang rig pa bdag kho na'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags ni gtso bo'i rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang rig pa bdag kho na'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: The primal substance is not the transformation of latent impressions, but rather self-awareness is the nature of the self alone.

original: 'di la yang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: de phyir rang rtogs ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: de phyir rang rtogs ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because it is the nature of self-realization,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is:üîΩTherefore, because it is the nature of self-realization,üîΩThe present type of suffering is observed to produce complete weariness, and that is possible in meditation. The response to that is:

original: da ltar ba'i sdug rigs pa ni kun du skyo ba sgrub par byed par dmigs nas bsgom pa las byung ba la yang de ltar srid par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni gang zhig dag ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩzhe sdang yang chags pa dang bral ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skyon ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i sdug rigs pa ni kun du skyo ba sgrub par byed par dmigs nas bsgom pa las byung ba la yang de ltar srid par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni gang zhig dag ltar zhes bya ba'o // zhe sdang yang chags pa dang bral ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skyon ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: If it is like that,üîΩSome say: Hatred is not a fault because it produces freedom from attachment.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: chags bral ma yin zhe bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chags bral ma yin zhe bya ba smos te /
translated: It is not freedom from attachment.

original: chags bral ma yin pa ni chags pa med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral ma yin pa ni chags pa med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: One who is not free from attachment is not without attachment.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause?

original: de tshe yang ste gang gi phyir da ltar gyi sdug bsngal gyi dus na yang gnas skabs gzhan gyi bde ba'i sgrub byed du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tshe yang ste gang gi phyir da ltar gyi sdug bsngal gyi dus na yang gnas skabs gzhan gyi bde ba'i sgrub byed du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, because at the time of present suffering, one seeks the cause of pleasure in another state.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba dang bcas pa 'gal ba can gyi rgyud la ji ltar gnas skabs gzhan tshol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba dang bcas pa 'gal ba can gyi rgyud la ji ltar gnas skabs gzhan tshol ba'i phyir /
translated: How can attachment arise in a continuum that is opposed to the arising of suffering?

original: 'dod chags skye ba yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags skye ba yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Because one seeks another state.üîΩThe cause of aversion is the thing that is the basis of suffering.

original: zhe sdang gi rgyu ste skye gnas ni sdug bsngal gang gi yin pa de'i dngos po ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rgyu ste skye gnas ni sdug bsngal gang gi yin pa de'i dngos po ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: That is aversion.

original: de srid tsam du ni sdug bsngal yod pa tsam du'o //
analyzed: de srid tsam du ni sdug bsngal yod pa tsam du'o //
translated: To the extent that there is suffering, there is the mere presence of suffering.

original: gnas pa ni kun du gnas pa gnag gi yin pa de lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni kun du gnas pa gnag gi yin pa de lta bu ste /
translated: The state of being is the state of being of that.

original: de log na 'gal ba med pa'i phyir chags pa 'byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de log na 'gal ba med pa'i phyir chags pa 'byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When that is reversed, there is no opposition, so attachment arises. This is the meaning.

original: chags pa nyid kyis na zhes bya ba'i gang gi phyir gyi sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don no //
analyzed: chags pa nyid kyis na zhes bya ba'i gang gi phyir gyi sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don no //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù indicates the reason.

original: sdang ba dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba'i ni'i sgra ni yang gi sgra yin no //
analyzed: sdang ba dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba'i ni'i sgra ni yang gi sgra yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúof‚Äù in ‚Äúendowed with aversion‚Äù is a conjunction.

original: thar pa 'di ni zhi bar mdzod //
analyzed: thar pa 'di ni zhi bar mdzod //
translated: This is the peace.

original: ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the above.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni thar pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni thar pa ma yin te /
translated: Because this is not liberation,

original: sdug bsngal rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni shin tu ba'i sdug bsngal ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro // de ni shin tu ba'i sdug bsngal ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: since it is followed by suffering.üîΩThis is taught by ‚Äúbecause it is the nature of the reversal of suffering.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pas zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with suffering‚Äù is to be connected with this.

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi skye bo chags pa dang bral ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi skye bo chags pa dang bral ba ma yin la /
translated: If those who are born in suffering are not free from attachment,

original: de'i sgrub byed kyang ma yin na de ci zhig ces bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed kyang ma yin na de ci zhig ces bstan pa ni /
translated: and if they are not the means of achieving that freedom, then what are they?

original: blang dang dor bya zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbdag med par lta bas des phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir blang bya @356a * //
analyzed: blang dang dor bya zhes bya ba'o // bdag med par lta bas des phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir blang bya @356a * //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúwhat is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.‚Äù

original: ma yin la /
analyzed: ma yin la /
translated: Since there is no benefit from the view of selflessness, it is not to be adopted.üîΩSince it is not the means of achieving that freedom, it is not to be rejected.

original: gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dor bya ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dor bya ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be rejected because it is not a cause of harm.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste'u dang / bde ba'i rgyu tsan dan dag las mtshungs pa rnams kyi btang snyoms ni chags pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste'u dang / bde ba'i rgyu tsan dan dag las mtshungs pa rnams kyi btang snyoms ni chags pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The equanimity of those who are free from attachment is toward the causes of suffering, such as a saw, and the causes of pleasure, such as sandalwood.

original: gnas skabs 'di ni goms pa rang dbang du gyur pa'i thar par 'dod pa yin no ;
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di ni goms pa rang dbang du gyur pa'i thar par 'dod pa yin no ;
translated: This is the stage of liberation that is the mastery of familiarization.

original: /'dis kyang phan 'dogs bzhin par ma mthong na ji ltar goms par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: /'dis kyang phan 'dogs bzhin par ma mthong na ji ltar goms par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If one does not see that it is beneficial, how can one become familiar with it?

original: 'di'i ma goms pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'di'i ma goms pa gang yin /
translated: What is the lack of familiarity with it?

original: phan gdags bya dang phan 'dogs byed du zhen pa'o //üîΩji ltar ma goms pa yin /üîΩ'on te de med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phan gdags bya dang phan 'dogs byed du zhen pa'o // ji ltar ma goms pa yin / 'on te de med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is the clinging to the one who is benefited and the one who benefits.üîΩHow is there lack of familiarity with it?

original: de lta na yang ji ltar ma goms pa yin /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar ma goms pa yin /
translated: If it does not exist, how can there be lack of familiarity with it?

original: de'i phyir de ni gyi na'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gyi na'o ;
translated: Therefore, that is nonsense.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bde bar gyur pa 'am sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig ces 'dod pa na /
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa 'am sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig ces 'dod pa na /
translated: When one wishes, ‚ÄúMay I be happy and may I not suffer,‚Äù

original: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gang de //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gang de //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the mind thinks ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de ltar mthong na ldog pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar mthong na ldog pa ma yin zhing /
translated: If one sees thus, one does not turn away from samsara;

original: ma mthong na ni grol ba kho na la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong na ni grol ba kho na la gnas pa yin no //
translated: if one does not see thus, one does not abide in mere liberation.

original: chos nyid dang bdag med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid ni bdag dang gzhan dag dor bya dang blar bya dag la yang chags pa dang bral ba'i don du ma yin zhing /
analyzed: chos nyid dang bdag med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid ni bdag dang gzhan dag dor bya dang blar bya dag la yang chags pa dang bral ba'i don du ma yin zhing /
translated: The reality, selflessness, and sameness are not for the purpose of attachment to the abandonment and adoption of self and other.

original: gal te sdang ba'i don du yin na de lta na ji ltar mdo sde las sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid ces gsungs snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te sdang ba'i don du yin na de lta na ji ltar mdo sde las sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid ces gsungs snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it were for the purpose of aversion, then how is it that the sutra declares the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces?

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la dgongs nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la dgongs nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: With the suffering of the formative forces in mind.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba la yang sdug bsngal du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la dgongs pa kho nas yin gyi dgongs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba la yang sdug bsngal du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la dgongs pa kho nas yin gyi dgongs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is declared to be suffering and change is suffering only with the suffering of the formative forces in mind, and not with any other intention.

original: de lta na de nyid ni zhe sdang gi rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de nyid ni zhe sdang gi rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then that is the cause of hatred.

original: de yang ste 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rkyen las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de yang ste 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rkyen las skyes pa ste /
translated: That is also the suffering of the formative forces, which arises from conditions.

original: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis yin la /
analyzed: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis yin la /
translated: It is the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: rkyen las skyes pa dang bdag med par lta ba'i rten te dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pa dang bdag med par lta ba'i rten te dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the basis, the objective support, of the view of the arising from conditions and of selflessness.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de /
translated: The suffering of the formative forces

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang bdag med pa la yang gnyis med pa 'di mthong ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal mthong ba ni sngon rol du yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang bdag med pa la yang gnyis med pa 'di mthong ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal mthong ba ni sngon rol du yin la /
translated: is the seeing of non-duality in dependent origination and selflessness. The seeing of the suffering of the formative forces is prior to the seeing of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa 'di la don med na byang grol gyi sgrub byed yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'di la don med na byang grol gyi sgrub byed yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that this selflessness is the means of achieving liberation when it is not meaningless is as follows:

original: stong nyid lta bas grol bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong nyid lta bas grol bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Liberation is through the view of emptiness.

original: bdag med pa kho na grol ba'i nang gi yan lag yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa kho na grol ba'i nang gi yan lag yin te /
translated: Selflessness alone is the internal limb of liberation,

original: chags pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the antidote to attachment.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs @356b pa mthong ba ni de nyid kyi skyed byed yin pa'i phyir rten yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs @356b pa mthong ba ni de nyid kyi skyed byed yin pa'i phyir rten yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The seeing of the suffering of conditioned existence, etc. is the basis, because it is the producer of that.

original: bsgom pa lhag ma de don yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa lhag ma de don yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remaining meditation is for the sake of that.üîΩThe suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.üîΩThe suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.üîΩThe suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid sdug bsngal kho na yin pa 'di la shes par byed pa ni mi rtag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid sdug bsngal kho na yin pa 'di la shes par byed pa ni mi rtag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.

original: bdag med par mthong ba ni grol ba'i nang gi yan lag yin zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba ni grol ba'i nang gi yan lag yin zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: The seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.

original: sdug bsngal ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.

original: bdag med par mthar gsungs pa yin pa kho ni'i phyir de nyid kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med par mthar gsungs pa yin pa kho ni'i phyir de nyid kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pa ni sdug bsngal nyid la dgongs nas bshad pa ni /üîΩrtog gam ni rigs sam zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i sdud par byed pa ni ;
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pa ni sdug bsngal nyid la dgongs nas bshad pa ni / rtog gam ni rigs sam zhes bya ba'o // rnam par rtog pa'i sdud par byed pa ni ;
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.üîΩThe suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.

original: 'grel pa dang mi mthun par 'chad pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa dang mi mthun par 'chad pa yin par blta'o //
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is suffering itself. The proof of this is ‚Äúfrom impermanence.üîΩThe seeing of selflessness is the internal limb of liberation.

original: bdag med pa nyid du mthong ba med na mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid du mthong ba yang grol ba ma yin no zhes ldog pa las nus pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du mthong ba med na mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid du mthong ba yang grol ba ma yin no zhes ldog pa las nus pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The power of the reverse pervasion is taught:

original: chags bral min dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chags bral min dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One who is not free from attachment.

original: bdag tu lta ba can de 'bras bus rgyu brjod pa'i phyir sred ldan ni chags pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can de 'bras bus rgyu brjod pa'i phyir sred ldan ni chags pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who has the view of self is called ‚Äúone who is attached‚Äù because of the result of attachment.

original: bdag la bdag gi ba la 'dor ba dang len par rtsom pa dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba kho na yin gyi grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la bdag gi ba la 'dor ba dang len par rtsom pa dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba kho na yin gyi grol ba ma yin no //
translated: One who is attached to the self and what belongs to the self, who is engaged in the activity of rejecting and accepting, is only in cyclic existence, not liberated.

original: skyes bu nyid ni 'di dag thams cad la de ltar lta ba la bdag gi ba med cing de la chags pa yang rtsom pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid ni 'di dag thams cad la de ltar lta ba la bdag gi ba med cing de la chags pa yang rtsom pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: But a person who views all of this as selfless is not free from attachment to the self and does not engage in the activity of attachment.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar bdag tu lta ba can grol ba ma yin par brjod snyams du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar bdag tu lta ba can grol ba ma yin par brjod snyams du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, one might think, ‚ÄúWhy is it said that one who has the view of self is not liberated?‚Äù

original: ji ste 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ste 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIf it were so, then . . .‚Äù

original: gal te za ba po ma yin na yang de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te za ba po ma yin na yang de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one is not a consumer, what would be the consequence?

original: bdag kyang med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang med ces bya ba ste /
translated: And the self is not a knower.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba yod pa tsam ni nam mkha' bzhin du bdag gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba yod pa tsam ni nam mkha' bzhin du bdag gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mere existence of the self, which is devoid of the nature of an action, etc., is not the nature of the self, like space.

original: rig pa yang gzhan yin la rig par bya ba ni bdag yin no zhes lta ba 'di la gzung ba thams cad kyang rig par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa yang gzhan yin la rig par bya ba ni bdag yin no zhes lta ba 'di la gzung ba thams cad kyang rig par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And if one holds the view that the self is a knower and that the object of knowledge is the self, then it follows, absurdly, that all objects are knowers.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni thams cad rig par thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni thams cad rig par thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage that goes it follows, absurdly, that everything is a knower is that there is no difference between the two.

original: rig par bya ba med par khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig par bya ba med par khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And since there is no difference between the two, the self is also a knower.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ma yin la gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya bar khas len na yang so sor snang ba gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ma yin la gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya bar khas len na yang so sor snang ba gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if one accepts that the self is neither a knower nor an object of knowledge, then the clear appearance of the individual objects would not occur.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it contradicts direct perception.

original: de'i phyir snang ba ni gnyis su med pa yin gyi med pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba ni gnyis su med pa yin gyi med pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the appearance is nondual, but it is not nonexistent.

original: de'i tshe sna tshogs gnyis med pa //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sna tshogs gnyis med pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, there is no duality of the various.

original: @357a * // so sor snang ba tsam nyid rtag pa'i phyir bdag gnyis su med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @357a * // so sor snang ba tsam nyid rtag pa'i phyir bdag gnyis su med pa ma yin te /
translated: The two selves do not exist because the mere appearance of the various is permanent.

original: nye ba'i rang rig pa la rtag pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni bdag ces bya ba yod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i rang rig pa la rtag pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni bdag ces bya ba yod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that it is not reasonable for the permanent to be the internal knower, for if it were, the self would not exist.

original: mngon sum gyis so zhes bya ba ni rang rig pas so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis so zhes bya ba ni rang rig pas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúdirectly‚Äù means by means of the internal knower.

original: gal te bdag med na bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten la ji ltar gnod pa med pa'i shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten la ji ltar gnod pa med pa'i shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no self, how can the world‚Äôs nonerroneous consciousness be said to have the nature of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù?

original: de phyir grol 'dod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de phyir grol 'dod ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, those who desire liberationüîΩshould abandon the view of self.

original: gang gi phyir bdag tu lta ba can grol ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩthog ma med pa'i rgyud de rgyun gang gi yin pa de la thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag tu lta ba can grol ba ma yin pa de'i phyir / thog ma med pa'i rgyud de rgyun gang gi yin pa de la thog ma med pa'o //
translated: Because those who have the view of self are not liberated,üîΩthe continuum of that which has no beginning is the lineage.

original: rgyud kyang de yin la rigs mthun pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: rgyud kyang de yin la rigs mthun pa yang de yin no //
translated: That which is the continuum is the lineage of the same type.

original: de gang gi sa bon yin pa ni sems can du lta ba'i 'o zhes bya ba 'dis yul med pa la yang khyad par can gyi sa bon yin pa yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang gi sa bon yin pa ni sems can du lta ba'i 'o zhes bya ba 'dis yul med pa la yang khyad par can gyi sa bon yin pa yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that even in the absence of an object, there is a special seed.

original: bdag med pa bsgom pa la ni gzhan gyi bag chags can gyi rgyud la de'i bag chags 'gal ba'i phyir bdag tu byed pa 'gags pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩrtsa ba nyid nas dbyung bar gyis //
analyzed: bdag med pa bsgom pa la ni gzhan gyi bag chags can gyi rgyud la de'i bag chags 'gal ba'i phyir bdag tu byed pa 'gags pa yin par bstan pa ni / rtsa ba nyid nas dbyung bar gyis //
translated: In the cultivation of no-self, the activity of self is stopped in the continuum of others, because the seeds of self are incompatible with the seeds of no-self. This is shown by the verse:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUproot it by the root!‚Äù

original: bdag gi shes pa ni byang grol sgrub par byed pa lung las rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag gi shes pa ni byang grol sgrub par byed pa lung las rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the knowledge of self realized from scripture, which establishes liberation?

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not contradicted by perception,

original: yul nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is not present.

original: lung yang skyes bus byas pa ni don la mi 'khrul bas tshang ma yin te ;
analyzed: lung yang skyes bus byas pa ni don la mi 'khrul bas tshang ma yin te ;
translated: As for scripture, that composed by a person is not valid, because it is not nonerroneous with respect to its object,

original: yid ches pas bstan pa'i phyir sngags dang tshe'i rig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid ches pas bstan pa'i phyir sngags dang tshe'i rig pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a spell or a life-prolonging charm, because it is taught by a trustworthy person.

original: de ltar yang dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said: ‚ÄúIt is beyond the senses, etc.‚Äù

original: skyes bus byas pa yang rgyu'i skyon med pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa med pa grub pa yin par bstan pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa yang rgyu'i skyon med pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa med pa grub pa yin par bstan pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that even the human-made is established as non-erroneous by the absence of a fault in the cause is ‚Äúeven the non-human-made.‚Äù

original: bdag yod pa nyid du ma dag tu shes pa yin la bdag tu shes pa de yang thabs las byung ba nyid kyis thar pa ni 'brel ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag yod pa nyid du ma dag tu shes pa yin la bdag tu shes pa de yang thabs las byung ba nyid kyis thar pa ni 'brel ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of the existence of the self is the knowledge of the self, and that knowledge of the self is related to liberation by the fact that it arises from the means.

original: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho gas dbyig pa gsum 'dzin pa dang / zhi ba ba'i 'dus byas pa'i lung ni de lta'i dngos po ni don lam 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho gas dbyig pa gsum 'dzin pa dang / zhi ba ba'i 'dus byas pa'i lung ni de lta'i dngos po ni don lam 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: The Vedic injunctions, such as the consecration ritual, the holding of the three staffs, and the performance of the peace sacrifice, are not related to liberation, because they are human-made.

original: de la rgyu ni mngon sum la rang gi ngo bo'i snang ba dang / rjes su dpag pa la 'brel pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni mngon sum la rang gi ngo bo'i snang ba dang / rjes su dpag pa la 'brel pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is the appearance of the object to direct perception and the understanding of the relation in inference.

original: 'di la ni de gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni de gnyi ga med do //
translated: But in this case, neither of those two is present.

original: rab rib can gyi shes pa skyes bus ma byas pa yang tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: rab rib can gyi shes pa skyes bus ma byas pa yang tshad ma ma yin /
translated: Even though the consciousness of one with eye-disease arises without being made by a person, it is not a valid cognition.

original: gnod pa can ma dmigs pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can ma dmigs pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to be a non-observation that is a counter-percipient.

original: yid ches pas bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid ches pas bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not taught by one who is trustworthy,

original: sngags dang tshe'i rig pa smra ba bos @357b byas pa nyid la tshad ma med pa'i phyir la de dang 'dra ba gzhan gyis byas pa yin zhes bya ba la yang tshad ma med la /
analyzed: sngags dang tshe'i rig pa smra ba bos @357b byas pa nyid la tshad ma med pa'i phyir la de dang 'dra ba gzhan gyis byas pa yin zhes bya ba la yang tshad ma med la /
translated: because there is no valid cognition in the mere words of one who claims to be a speaker of mantra and life-knowledge, and there is no valid cognition in the claim that it is made by another who is similar to him.

original: tshad ma med pa nyid la rgyu mtshan na don dang 'brel pa med pa kho na yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa nyid la rgyu mtshan na don dang 'brel pa med pa kho na yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: And in the absence of valid cognition, it is only reasonable that there is no connection with the meaning.

original: bdag med par bstan pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gal ba bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i cho ga dang skyes bu'i sa bon la sogs 'ga' yang snang ba ma yin snyam du sems pa la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med par bstan pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gal ba bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i cho ga dang skyes bu'i sa bon la sogs 'ga' yang snang ba ma yin snyam du sems pa la bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that one should think, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that any rite of initiation or seed of a person, etc. appears, like the teaching of selflessness and the contradiction of attachment, etc.‚Äù

original: nus min ni nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nus min ni nus pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot possible‚Äù means not possible.

original: sa bon na sogs grub cho ga ni mi skye ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: sa bon na sogs grub cho ga ni mi skye ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúSeed, etc., established rite‚Äù means the reality of non-arising.

original: gang gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi ched du zhe na /
translated: For whose sake?

original: skyes bu rnams mi skyed pa la ste grol ba sgrub byed ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa rnams til mar bskus pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sa bon la sogs pa rnams la mi skyed pa'i chos nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩskyed pa dang 'gal ba can rnams til mar bskus pa la sogs pa la skye ba la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga la yang de kho na bzhin du skye ba dang 'gal ba ma yin du zin kyang las dang 'gal
analyzed: skyes bu rnams mi skyed pa la ste grol ba sgrub byed ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa rnams til mar bskus pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sa bon la sogs pa rnams la mi skyed pa'i chos nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro // skyed pa dang 'gal ba can rnams til mar bskus pa la sogs pa la skye ba la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga la yang de kho na bzhin du skye ba dang 'gal ba ma yin du zin kyang las dang 'gal
translated: Those who do not desire to produce a person, i.e., to achieve liberation, see that seeds, etc., do not produce, because they are anointed with oil, etc.

original: ba nyid du 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: ba nyid du 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: Since there is no contradiction in the production of what is anointed with oil, etc., even though there is no contradiction in the production of what is anointed with oil, etc., in the rite of consecration, etc., there is still a contradiction with karma.

original: chos dang chos min zad byed pa //
analyzed: chos dang chos min zad byed pa //
translated: The performance of what is contrary to Dharma and supernormal powers

original: dbang phyug chen po'i dbang bskur sogs //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i dbang bskur sogs //
translated: is the consecration of Mahe≈õvara, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu lcid de yang dbang bskur ba'i de ma thag tu yang bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu lcid de yang dbang bskur ba'i de ma thag tu yang bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la bstan pa ni /
translated: The following is stated for one who thinks that even a heavy person becomes light immediately after consecration:

original: sngar lci ba dbang bskur bas phyis yang ba yin pa'i phyir sdig pa 'phrog pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar lci ba dbang bskur bas phyis yang ba yin pa'i phyir sdig pa 'phrog pa yin te /
translated: Since the initiation is light, it removes heavy sins,

original: sdig pa lci ba'i phyir ro zhes rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa lci ba'i phyir ro zhes rgol ba yin no //
translated: because sin is heavy.

original: dbang bskur bas lci ba nyid bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: dbang bskur bas lci ba nyid bsal ba yin te /
translated: The heaviness of the initiation is removed,üîΩbecause when it exists, the heavy sin is removed, and the realization of the contradiction is understood.

original: de yod na de med pas 'gal ba rtogs pa'i phyir brkam chags la sogs pa dang de 'du byed pa'i sdig pa yang lci ba yin te /
analyzed: de yod na de med pas 'gal ba rtogs pa'i phyir brkam chags la sogs pa dang de 'du byed pa'i sdig pa yang lci ba yin te /
translated: The sin of greed and so on and the sin of its performance are heavy,

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not embodied.

original: yang na dbang bskur ni yang bskyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na dbang bskur ni yang bskyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Or, the initiation is that which generates lightness,

original: de yang lci ba spangs pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba yin gyi sdig pa dang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yang lci ba spangs pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba yin gyi sdig pa dang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: and that is the removal of heaviness, so it is taught that it is the contradiction of that, not the contradiction of sin.

original: lci ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir yang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lci ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir yang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The heaviness of the initiation is removed, because it is the contradiction of heaviness, and it is called light.

original: yang ba ni 'bras bu 'gal ba dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni sdig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ba ni 'bras bu 'gal ba dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni sdig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One might think that lightness is the contradiction of the effect and the pervader, but it is taught that it is the contradiction of sin.

original: 'gal ba khas blangs kyang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba khas blangs kyang bstan pa ni /
translated: The contradiction is accepted, but it is taught that

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover,

original: lci ba ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: heavy is not the result of sin, because there is no perception or non-perception.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi yang dbang bskur gyi cho ga dang skye ba 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi yang dbang bskur gyi cho ga dang skye ba 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: The consecration of one who has the quality of non-production is not contradictory to birth.

original: gang dang 'gal ba @358a * //
analyzed: gang dang 'gal ba @358a * //
translated: What is it that is contradictory?

original: yin snyam du sems pa la rgyu dang 'gal bas 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin snyam du sems pa la rgyu dang 'gal bas 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The contradiction of the cause is taught in the verse:

original: log shes te tshogs pa'i snying po can gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: log shes te tshogs pa'i snying po can gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The false consciousness is the grasping of self, which has the essence of the aggregates.

original: de las byung ba'i sred pa de nyid sems pa yin la /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sred pa de nyid sems pa yin la /
translated: The craving that arises from that is the will.

original: de'i nus pa de nyid dman pa'i gnas kyi 'gro ba ni mngal la sogs par thob pa'i ngo bo'i skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nus pa de nyid dman pa'i gnas kyi 'gro ba ni mngal la sogs par thob pa'i ngo bo'i skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Its power is the birth that has the nature of obtaining the womb and so forth, which is the abode of the inferior realm.

original: de'i rgyu log pa'i shes pa des ni ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu log pa'i shes pa des ni ste /
translated: By that false consciousness, which is its cause,

original: 'gal ba can gyi bdag med par lta ba bcad pa yin te skye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba can gyi bdag med par lta ba bcad pa yin te skye ba med pa yin no //
translated: the view of selflessness, which is contradictory to it, is eliminated, and there is no birth.

original: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga ni de dang 'gal ba can ma yin par zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga ni de dang 'gal ba can ma yin par zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the rite of consecration, etc., is not contradictory to that.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: The commentary is quite clear.

original: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa dang bral ba 'byung ba chen po rnams skye ba'i rgyu yin la dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho gas sel bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa dang bral ba 'byung ba chen po rnams skye ba'i rgyu yin la dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho gas sel bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that the great elements that arise without consecration, etc., are the cause of birth, and that consecration, etc., serve to eliminate them?

original: bstan pa ni de dag nyid ni log pa'i shes pa'i srid pa dang sems pa dag nyid kyi skye ba la nus pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa ni de dag nyid ni log pa'i shes pa'i srid pa dang sems pa dag nyid kyi skye ba la nus pa yin no //
translated: The point is that they are the cause of the birth of the existence and intention of false knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir bdag tu mngon par zhen nas 'dod chags sam zhe sdang las log pa'i shes pa rtsom par byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag tu mngon par zhen nas 'dod chags sam zhe sdang las log pa'i shes pa rtsom par byed /
translated: Because, having conceived a self, one engages in false knowledge out of attachment or aversion.

original: dman pa'i gnas la sogs pa thob par byed pa yin gyi dbang bskur las bzlog pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas la sogs pa thob par byed pa yin gyi dbang bskur las bzlog pa ma yin la /
translated: It causes the attainment of a low state, etc., but not the reversal of consecration.

original: dbang bskur dang log pa'i shes pa nyid 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur dang log pa'i shes pa nyid 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And consecration and false knowledge are not contradictory.

original: log pa'i shes pas sred pa dang sems pa dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas sred pa dang sems pa dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical that craving and intention arise due to a wrong consciousness,

original: las rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because karma is the cause.

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: The various worlds arise from karma.

original: zhes bya ba yin no snyam du sems pa la sems pa de dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no snyam du sems pa la sems pa de dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthose intentions‚Äù is that karma is the cause of the world.

original: sems pa'i las dang / bsam pa'i las zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang / bsam pa'i las zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Karma is intention and the karma of intention.

original: nyams pa med pa ste ma tshang ba med pa'i ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang las kyang zhes bya ba gsum pa gnyis tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir sred pa'i dbang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i nus pa'o //üîΩskye ba snga ma las byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang las nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la de yang rang gi 'du byed pa la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: nyams pa med pa ste ma tshang ba med pa'i ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang las kyang zhes bya ba gsum pa gnyis tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir sred pa'i dbang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i nus pa'o // skye ba snga ma las byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang las nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la de yang rang gi 'du byed pa la rag las pa yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the power of craving‚Äù means the power of craving, because the world arises from just two of the three links: the link of nondeprivation, that is, the nondeprivation of ignorance, craving, and karma, and the link of karma.üîΩKarma is also the cause of generosity and so on that is, virtuous karma performed in a previous life.

original: 'di nyid kyis kyang 'di dag gi rgyu yin gyi skye ba'i dngos kyi rgyu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis kyang 'di dag gi rgyu yin gyi skye ba'i dngos kyi rgyu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the power of craving‚Äù indicates that karma is the cause of the world, but it is not the direct cause of birth.

original: sngar gyi sems pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi sems pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The former mental action, etc.

original: skye ba gzhan la 'byung bar 'dod pa ni byed par 'dod pa'i ngang tshul 'di dag yin pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan la byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan la 'byung bar 'dod pa ni byed par 'dod pa'i ngang tshul 'di dag yin pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan la byung ba'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúarisen in another life‚Äù because they are the nature of the desire to do something that occurs in another life.

original: las ni dngos su zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'am /üîΩbyed pa yang ste 'dis yin pa'i phyir snga ma dag ni @358b sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
