analyzed: las ni dngos su zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'am / byed pa yang ste 'dis yin pa'i phyir snga ma dag ni @358b sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Karma is the actual action, or

original: de'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the agent, or it is the instrument, because it is the cause of that.

original: log pa'i shes pa'i sred pa dang sems pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba yin par mi rigs ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa'i sred pa dang sems pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba yin par mi rigs ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it unreasonable to say that beings go by the power of craving and intention that are wrong knowledge?

original: 'gro ba ni bgrod par bya ba rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni bgrod par bya ba rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because going is preceded by the understanding of what is to be traversed,

original: rtogs pa yang byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and understanding is preceded by action.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni bgrod par bya bar ro //
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni bgrod par bya bar ro //
translated: Or, going is what is to be traversed.

original: byed pa ni las kyi dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: byed pa ni las kyi dbang po rnams so //
translated: Action is the faculties of action.

original: rtogs pa'i rten ni sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa la ste longs spyod la blo dang dbang po de ma thag yin pa'i phyir byed pa rnams nyid ni sems pa dag gi'o zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rten ni sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa la ste longs spyod la blo dang dbang po de ma thag yin pa'i phyir byed pa rnams nyid ni sems pa dag gi'o zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The basis of realization is sound and so on, which are objects. The functions are the mental factors, because they are the immediate cause of the enjoyment of the mind and the sense faculties.

original: de ni ma mthong ba las te de las gzhan du mi 'thad par rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: de ni ma mthong ba las te de las gzhan du mi 'thad par rtogs pa las so //
translated: This is not tenable, because it is understood that it is not seen.

original: sems pa de nyid mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa de nyid mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: That very thought is not seen.

original: khyad par la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid knowledge of a difference.

original: bstan bcos kyi rjes su 'jug pas kyang khyad par gyi sems yin na bdag cag gi 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin na sems pa de dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi rjes su 'jug pas kyang khyad par gyi sems yin na bdag cag gi 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin na sems pa de dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Even those who follow the treatises say that if there is a different thought, it follows that it is our assertion, but it is not thought.

original: 'on kyang dge ba bcu rnams dang mi dge ba rnams kyang bcu kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang dge ba bcu rnams dang mi dge ba rnams kyang bcu kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: However, they say that there are ten virtues and ten nonvirtues.

original: rnam pa bcu nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: There are ten types.

original: ma mthong ba de yang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i cho gas zhig pa'i phyir thar pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de yang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i cho gas zhig pa'i phyir thar pa yin no //
translated: That nonseeing is liberation, because it is destroyed by the ritual of consecration and so on.

original: 'gal bar yang khyad par can gyi lung las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal bar yang khyad par can gyi lung las grub pa yin no //
translated: And it is also established by a specific scripture that contradicts it.

original: de khas mi len na sems pa de dag kyang ni 'grub po zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de khas mi len na sems pa de dag kyang ni 'grub po zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If you do not accept that, then those thoughts are also established.

original: ma mthong zhig phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong zhig phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are not seen.

original: ma mthong ba de 'du byed pa las thog ma med pa'i byed pas bskyed pa'i bdag gi chos yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du gzhan yang sna tshogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba de 'du byed pa las thog ma med pa'i byed pas bskyed pa'i bdag gi chos yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du gzhan yang sna tshogs par 'gyur na /
translated: That non-seeing is a property of the self produced by beginningless action, just as other various things are.

original: 'di sems pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'phangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di sems pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'phangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is projected as having the nature of thought.

original: 'di la lan ni /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: yod dang med pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the existence and non-existence.

original: byed pa skyed pa la yid kyi blo kho na'i nus pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa skyed pa la yid kyi blo kho na'i nus pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: The power of the mental cognition alone is seen in the production of action.

original: dbang rnams re re la gnod kyang //
analyzed: dbang rnams re re la gnod kyang //
translated: Even when each of the sense faculties is impaired,

original: yid blo la gnod yod ma yin //üîΩ'di 'gyur na ni de dag kyang //
analyzed: yid blo la gnod yod ma yin // 'di 'gyur na ni de dag kyang //
translated: the mental cognition is not impaired.üîΩWhen this changes,

original: 'gyur ba dag tu mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dag tu mthong ba yin //
translated: those are also seen to change.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa ni /
translated: This reasoning is:

original: yod dang med pa'i rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it follows existence and non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the point of the above passage.

original: ma mthong ba yin na shugs kyis ma mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yin na shugs kyis ma mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If the mind does not see, then it is not taught that it sees by way of the power of the sense faculties.

original: gzhan gyi ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The mind does not see the object field of another person.

original: lung gi stobs kyis khyad par rtogs pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lung gi stobs kyis khyad par rtogs pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the mind does not realize the object field by the power of scripture.

original: de dag ni byed pa rnams te dbang bskur ba la yang blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa rnams te dbang bskur ba la yang blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the functions of the mind, because the mind exists in the consecration of the womb.

original: yod pa ni rgyun gyis @359a * //
analyzed: yod pa ni rgyun gyis @359a * //
translated: The mind exists in the womb, because it is the continuum of the mind that enters the womb.

original: 'jug pa'o // cis mi 'gro ba ni mngal gyi gnas su cis mi 'gro ba 'am cis ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'o // cis mi 'gro ba ni mngal gyi gnas su cis mi 'gro ba 'am cis ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: Why does it not go? Why does it not enter the womb?

original: blo'i bskyed bya'i byed pa rnams yin par ni bden mod kyi ma mthong ba de'i lhan cig byed pa ni dbang bskur gyis gnod pa de'i phyir de rnams lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir skye ba gzhan du skyed par byed pa ma yin no snyam duüîΩsems pa la /
analyzed: blo'i bskyed bya'i byed pa rnams yin par ni bden mod kyi ma mthong ba de'i lhan cig byed pa ni dbang bskur gyis gnod pa de'i phyir de rnams lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir skye ba gzhan du skyed par byed pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is true that the functions of the mind are the functions of the mind that is to be generated, but the mind that does not see is impaired by the consecration of the womb. Therefore, because the conditions for the mind are incomplete, it does not generate another mind.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'jug pa la 'dzin pa'o //üîΩ'dzud pa ni mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'jug pa la 'dzin pa'o //üîΩ'dzud pa ni mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The mind that is to be generated is the mind that is to be generated in the womb.üîΩThe mind that is to be generated is the mind that is to be generated in the womb.

original: 'khrugs pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúDisorder‚Äù means transformation.

original: 'gog pa ni zhig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni zhig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCessation‚Äù means destruction.

original: de dag ni byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa rnams so //
translated: These are the agents.

original: sems pa'i dbang gis ni blo'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: sems pa'i dbang gis ni blo'i dbang gis te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of the mind‚Äù means by the power of the intellect.

original: med par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecome nonexistent‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: dbang sogs byas ma thag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang sogs byas ma thag pa kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately after the performance of the act.‚Äù

original: ma mthong bas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la gnod pa byed pa yin zhing blo la nus pa med na skye ba gzhan bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong bas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la gnod pa byed pa yin zhing blo la nus pa med na skye ba gzhan bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not seen, it is a harm to the cooperating causes. If the intellect is powerless, it will not be like another arising.

original: blo nyams pas na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i gnod pa ste 'di yang rgyu nyid la log par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo nyams pas na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i gnod pa ste 'di yang rgyu nyid la log par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the intellect is impaired‚Äù means that the cooperating causes are harmed by being seen. This is also a wrong understanding of the cause itself.

original: blo tsam yod kyang byed pa rnams la khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: blo tsam yod kyang byed pa rnams la khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that even if the intellect alone exists, it follows that there is no difference in the agents.

original: zhing dang / chu dang / sa bon gyi 'dus pa bzhin du yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag la ltos nas dbang bskur ba dang blo dang ma mthong ba'i phung po la nye bar gnod pa yin na /
analyzed: zhing dang / chu dang / sa bon gyi 'dus pa bzhin du yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag la ltos nas dbang bskur ba dang blo dang ma mthong ba'i phung po la nye bar gnod pa yin na /
translated: Just as the transformation of the seed is dependent on the particular combination of field, water, and seed, so too the transformation of the aggregates is dependent on the particular combination of the body, faculties, and consciousness.

original: 'bras bu ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that the result is not the transformation of the aggregates,

original: shi ma thag tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shi ma thag tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the text says, ‚Äúimmediately after death.‚Äù

original: yongs su gyur pa la ltos pa'i rgyu yang zla ba phyed pa dang zla ba dang po la sogs pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa la ltos pa'i rgyu yang zla ba phyed pa dang zla ba dang po la sogs pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The cause that is dependent on the transformation is not dependent on the half-moon, the full moon, and so on.

original: gal te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúIf it is that very thing.‚Äù

original: ma mthong bas bskyed pa'i lus dang dbang po dang rig pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar yod la /
analyzed: ma mthong bas bskyed pa'i lus dang dbang po dang rig pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar yod la /
translated: How can the body, faculties, and consciousness that are produced by the unseen be existent?

original: de med na med pa ma yin nam /üîΩde'i phyir lus dang dbang po la sogs pa kho na bzhin du blo mtshams sbyor ba can ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de med na med pa ma yin nam / de'i phyir lus dang dbang po la sogs pa kho na bzhin du blo mtshams sbyor ba can ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If they do not exist, how can they not be nonexistent?üîΩTherefore, just as the body, faculties, and so on are connected, so too is the mind.

original: 'on te de lta na ni blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de lta na ni blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think this, the text says, ‚ÄúBut if it is the mind.‚Äù

original: snga ma ni blo'i bskyed bya de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes sems pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni blo'i bskyed bya de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes sems pa yin la /
translated: The former is the thought that if that which is to be produced by the mind does not exist, it does not occur.

original: da ltar ni ma mthong ba'i bskyed bya de med pas mi 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni ma mthong ba'i bskyed bya de med pas mi 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The latter is the thought that if that which is to be produced, which is not seen, does not exist, it does not occur. This is the difference.

original: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni byed pa rnams su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir grol ba yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni byed pa rnams su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir grol ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not occur‚Äù means that one is liberated because one does not become an agent.

original: 'di la yang lan du dri ma rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang lan du dri ma rnams kyi ste /
translated: Here, the reply is:üîΩThe causes of the connection of the stains,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i chags pa la sogs pa mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu rnams dang / ma mthong ba gzhan gyis kyang blo mtshams sbyor bar byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i chags pa la sogs pa mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu rnams dang / ma mthong ba gzhan gyis kyang blo mtshams sbyor bar byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: such as attachment to the conception of self, and also by other unseen connections, the mind is connected.

original: de rnams te dri ma rnams sngags @359b dang rgyud la sogs pa'am dbang bskur bas nye bar gnod pa'i phyir nus pa med pa yin na 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs nyid na yang nus pa med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams te dri ma rnams sngags @359b dang rgyud la sogs pa'am dbang bskur bas nye bar gnod pa'i phyir nus pa med pa yin na 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs nyid na yang nus pa med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If those stains are powerless because they are harmed by mantras, tantras, etc., or by consecration, then even in the state of life they are powerless. This is shown by ‚Äúthose. ‚Äù

original: dbang bskur ba yin na yang dri ma rnams kyis mtshams sbyor bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba yin na yang dri ma rnams kyis mtshams sbyor bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: If you maintain that the defilements are removed by the consecration of the body, then you see that the defilements are the cause of the consecration.

original: de lta na dri ma rnams nyid ma mthong ba las sam ma byung ba yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las 'byung ba ni shi ba yin na slar mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na dri ma rnams nyid ma mthong ba las sam ma byung ba yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las 'byung ba ni shi ba yin na slar mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: If the defilements are removed by the transformation of the body, which is not seen or does not exist, then death would not occur again,

original: ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: because the non-seeing would not exist.

original: 'grib pa ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: Diminution is the antidote.

original: 'phel ba ni rang gi phyogs so //
analyzed: 'phel ba ni rang gi phyogs so //
translated: Increase is one‚Äôs own position.

original: 'phel na ni skyon rnams so //
analyzed: 'phel na ni skyon rnams so //
translated: If there is increase, then there are faults.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: nyes rgyun rang gi sa bon gyi rgyu can ni rigs mthun pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi ma mthong ba'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa tsam sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa /
analyzed: nyes rgyun rang gi sa bon gyi rgyu can ni rigs mthun pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi ma mthong ba'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa tsam sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa /
translated: The stream of faults has the seed as its cause, and it is preceded by a homogeneous cause, not merely preceded by the great elements that are not seen.

original: dbang bskur ba la yang ldog pa med pa ni gnyen po 'phel na skyon rnams 'grib pas rang gi phyogs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la yang ldog pa med pa ni gnyen po 'phel na skyon rnams 'grib pas rang gi phyogs rgyas pa ste /
translated: Even in consecration, there is no reversal. When the antidote increases, the faults diminish, and one‚Äôs own position expands.

original: 'phel pa'i phyir rang gi sa bon gyi rgyu can yin zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa mdzad pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'phel pa'i phyir rang gi sa bon gyi rgyu can yin zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa mdzad pa'i ste /
translated: This is the commentary.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'phal na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'phal na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with the phrase ‚Äúwhen improper mental activity increases.‚Äù

original: dbang bskur bal sogs pa'i cho gas thar pa yin du zin kyang bdag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang bskur bal sogs pa'i cho gas thar pa yin du zin kyang bdag ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if liberation were due to the rite of consecration, etc., it would not be the self,üîΩbecause it is permanent.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis 'khor ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rim pa mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis 'khor ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rim pa mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the sequence of results such as cyclic existence is illogical because of permanence.

original: rtag pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtag pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir ; / zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the permanent is independent,üîΩThe permanent is independent because it is suitable to generate another result at the very time it generates one result.

original: ltos pa med pa ni 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed ba'i dus nyid na 'bras bu gzhan skyed par rung ba nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir rim gyis bskyed pa 'ba' zhig kho na ni 'gal ba ma yin gyi byed pa dang yang 'gal ba yin no zhes byaüîΩbar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa ni 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed ba'i dus nyid na 'bras bu gzhan skyed par rung ba nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir rim gyis bskyed pa 'ba' zhig kho na ni 'gal ba ma yin gyi byed pa dang yang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not just the sequence of generation that is illogical, but also the activity is illogical.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The self of a similar type.

original: gang na zhe na /
analyzed: gang na zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: mi byed pa dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi byed pa dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnon-doer‚Äù is as follows:

original: mi byed pa'i ngo bo ni byed pa'i dus su yang yin la /
analyzed: mi byed pa'i ngo bo ni byed pa'i dus su yang yin la /
translated: The nature of the non-doer is also the nature of the doer.

original: des ni mi byed pa kho nar rigs pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des ni mi byed pa kho nar rigs pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is only proper that the non-doer is the doer.

original: don 'di bstan par 'dod nas rtag pa'i phyogs slong par byed pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di bstan par 'dod nas rtag pa'i phyogs slong par byed pa ni /
translated: Desiring to teach this meaning, he raises the objection that the self is permanent:

original: gal te bdag med pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one sees that there is no self, etc.‚Äù

original: bcings pa dang thar pa dag la gzhan nyid du rgol ba khas len pa ni /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa dag la gzhan nyid du rgol ba khas len pa ni /
translated: He accepts the objection that bondage and liberation are different:

original: dag pa gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the purity, etc.‚Äù

original: tha snyad du gcig pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad du gcig pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: He teaches that they are the same conventionally:

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, etc.‚Äù

original: longs spyod pa'i dus na yod pa kho na byed po'i dus nyid du za ba po nyid du 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i dus na yod pa kho na byed po'i dus nyid du za ba po nyid du 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: He teaches that it is contradictory for that which exists at the time of experience to be the experiencer at the time of the doer:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCause and effect, etc.‚Äù

original: byed pa @360a * //
analyzed: byed pa @360a * //
translated: The doer, etc.

original: dang longs spyod pa dag kyang bdag de las tha dad pa yin yang de dang 'brel pa'i phyir byed pa po dang za ba por yang 'gyur ba zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: dang longs spyod pa dag kyang bdag de las tha dad pa yin yang de dang 'brel pa'i phyir byed pa po dang za ba por yang 'gyur ba zhes zer ba la /
translated: and the enjoyer are different from that self, they would be the agent and the experiencer because they are related to it.

original: de dag las tha dad na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says, ‚ÄúIf they are different from those . . .‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ni dbye ba ste de'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir byed pa po dang / za ba po ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni dbye ba ste de'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir byed pa po dang / za ba po ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means separate. They are not the agent and the experiencer because they do not have the nature of being that.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yang de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yang de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not perceived to have that nature.

original: 'on te de dag byed pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag byed pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that they are just like that because they perform those actions,

original: nus pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúTheir ability is also . . .‚Äù

original: byed pa po nyid yin na rim gyis bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid yin na rim gyis bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: If they are the agent, they are not produced sequentially.

original: sdod pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is illogical that they would remain.

original: byed pa po nyid ma yin na yang byed pa po yang ma yin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir nus pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po nyid ma yin na yang byed pa po yang ma yin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir nus pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If they are not the agent, their ability is not established because they are refuted as being the agent.

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis mi dran pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis mi dran pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that one person does not remember what another person experienced?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa gcig pa nyid kyis khyab par dran pa ni gcig nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa gcig pa nyid kyis khyab par dran pa ni gcig nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The memory of the invariable concomitance is what causes the realization of the identity.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan za ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan za ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, what is produced by one person is not enjoyed by another.

original: byas pa 'jig cing ma byas pa 'ongs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa po nyid longs spyod par grub po //
analyzed: byas pa 'jig cing ma byas pa 'ongs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa po nyid longs spyod par grub po //
translated: Because it would follow that what is produced would be destroyed and what is not produced would come into existence, the agent himself is the one who enjoys.

original: dbugs la sogs pa yang bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa gang med pas med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: dbugs la sogs pa yang bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa gang med pas med pa yin zhing /
translated: The breath, etc., are not the self, because they are absent when the pot, etc., are absent.

original: yod na yang rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yod na yang rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: And when they are present, they are what causes the realization.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog la mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog la mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de las ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not from that, because of the absence of the similar class and the presence of the dissimilar class.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la ma 'khrul ba bzhin du ldog pa la ma 'khrul bar yang go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la ma 'khrul ba bzhin du ldog pa la ma 'khrul bar yang go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, just as there is non-error regarding the positive concomitance, there is also non-error regarding the negative concomitance.

original: thos pa nyid ni ldog pa la mi 'khrul ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thos pa nyid ni ldog pa la mi 'khrul ba ma yin te /
translated: But mere hearing is not non-erroneous regarding the negative concomitance.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is also absent in the similar class.

original: 'dus pa can mal cha dang stan la sogs pa gzhan gyi don du mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dus pa can mal cha dang stan la sogs pa gzhan gyi don du mthong ba yin la /
translated: The collection of bedding, seats, etc. is seen to be for the sake of others.

original: mig la sogs pa yang 'dus pa can yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang 'dus pa can yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don yin no //
translated: And the eyes, etc. are collections, and therefore are for the sake of others.

original: gzhan yang 'di las 'dus pa can yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di las 'dus pa can yin no //
translated: Moreover, the collection is for the sake of something else.

original: bzlog pa yin na de yang gzhan gyi don yin la /
analyzed: bzlog pa yin na de yang gzhan gyi don yin la /
translated: And if the reverse were true, that also would be for the sake of something else.

original: de yang de bzhin yin pas thug pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin yin pas thug pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And that also would be for the sake of something else, and so on ad infinitum. Therefore, the argument is not valid.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang med pa la gnod pa can ni bdag dang bcas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang med pa la gnod pa can ni bdag dang bcas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Therefore, the argument that the absence of the reason in the dissimilar instances is the proof of the possession of self is not valid.

original: gzhan gyis ni nyams su myong ba can gyis dran pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni nyams su myong ba can gyis dran pa yin la /
translated: The opponent thinks that memory is the experience of the object,

original: byed pa po gzhan longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan longs spyod pa'o //
translated: and that the experiencer is different from the agent.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbugs la sogs pa dang / nus pa can la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbugs la sogs pa dang / nus pa can la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes breath, etc. and the potentiality, etc.

original: de rnams ni bdag med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can ma yin no /
analyzed: de rnams ni bdag med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can ma yin no /
translated: These are not the means of harming the non-self that is the opponent.

original: @360b ci las she na /üîΩ'ga' yang dran pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: @360b ci las she na / 'ga' yang dran pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: What is the reason?

original: zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause there is no memory of anything.‚Äù

original: dran pa ni nyams su myong ba dran pa'i dus na yod pa gcig bus khyab par dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni nyams su myong ba dran pa'i dus na yod pa gcig bus khyab par dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Memory is not observed to be pervaded by the existence of a single entity that remembers the experience.

original: gang gis rgyud gzhan la ste /
analyzed: gang gis rgyud gzhan la ste /
translated: Because of the absence of memory in another continuum,

original: med pas med pa yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: med pas med pa yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: it is understood that there is no memory.

original: med pa dag lhan cig yod pa tsam gyis khyab par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa dag lhan cig yod pa tsam gyis khyab par grub pa yin te /
translated: The mere simultaneous existence of non-existents is established as a pervasion,

original: yod pa'i rgyun sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i rgyun sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is preceded by the continuum of existence.

original: dran pa'i byed pa po'i cha la nyams su myong bar byed pa po'i cha rjes su 'jug pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la brten pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa'i byed pa po'i cha la nyams su myong bar byed pa po'i cha rjes su 'jug pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la brten pa ni /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt the aspect of the experiencer of the agent of memory included in the aspect of the agent of memory?‚Äù

original: myong las te /
analyzed: myong las te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúfrom experience.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba'i khyad par la dran pa ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i khyad par la dran pa ste /
translated: Memory is from the particular experience.

original: ma brjed pa zhes dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: ma brjed pa zhes dgongs pa ste /
translated: The intention is that it is not forgotten.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis skyed pa dran pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis skyed pa dran pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúmemory‚Äù is that which is produced by the latent impressions of experience.

original: bdag tsam yang zhes bya bas mi dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tsam yang zhes bya bas mi dran pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust the self‚Äù indicates that it is not the case that there is no memory.

original: gzhan gyis yang nyams su myong ba thams cad dran par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yang nyams su myong ba thams cad dran par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow, absurdly, that one would remember everything experienced by others.

original: bdag kyang nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis dran pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag kyang nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis dran pa yin la /
translated: The self is the memory that is produced by the latent impressions of experience.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni skad cig re re 'jig pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa yin na shugs kyis bdag 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni skad cig re re 'jig pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa yin na shugs kyis bdag 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by the latent impressions of experience is the cause and effect of the momentary disintegration of the self, and it is not the case that the self is obtained by implication.

original: dbugs la sogs pa yang thos pa nyid bzhin du ldog pa ma nges pa yin te /üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs la med pa yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir log pa nges par ma yin no //
analyzed: dbugs la sogs pa yang thos pa nyid bzhin du ldog pa ma nges pa yin te / mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir log pa nges par ma yin no //
translated: The fact that breathing, etc., are not ascertained to cease, just like hearing, etc.,üîΩis not ascertained to cease in the absence of a concordant factor, because the discordant factor is absent.

original: de med pa nyid ces bya ba 'di phyogs med pas the tshom mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa nyid ces bya ba 'di phyogs med pas the tshom mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fact that it is absent is not ascertained because there is no position.

original: de yang mthun pa'i phyogs yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par khyab par byed pas ldog par byed pa yin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba can gyis ldog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang mthun pa'i phyogs yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par khyab par byed pas ldog par byed pa yin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba can gyis ldog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, since the presence of a compatible factor entails the presence of an incompatible factor, the latter is excluded. But the incompatible factor is not excluded by the mere non-observation of the compatible factor.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub bya phyin ci log pa'i chos dang 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub bya phyin ci log pa'i chos dang 'gal ba yin la /
translated: However, the incompatible factor is the opposite of the property that is the opposite of the probandum.üîΩAnd since it is impermanent, it is the opposite of self, and so it is not incompatible with breath, etc.üîΩMoreover, the possession of a collection is pervaded by the possession of another collection, but not by the possession of a non-collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is the cause of the collection, the collection is pervaded by the possessor of the collection.

original: de yang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir bdag las bzlog pas dbugs la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir bdag las bzlog pas dbugs la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And since smoke is the effect of fire, it is pervaded by fire.üîΩAnd since the possession of a collection is pervaded by the possession of another collection, the possession of a collection is pervaded by the possession of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.

original: 'dus pa can mal cha la sogs pa la 'dus pa can gzhan gyi don gyis khyab pa yin gyi the tshom 'dzin par 'dod pas thug pa med pa yang ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir du ba ni 'bras bu nyid kyis me rtogs na 'bras bu ma yin pa yang rtogs byed ma yin zhing thug pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa can mal cha la sogs pa la 'dus pa can gzhan gyi don gyis khyab pa yin gyi the tshom 'dzin par 'dod pas thug pa med pa yang ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir du ba ni 'bras bu nyid kyis me rtogs na 'bras bu ma yin pa yang rtogs byed ma yin zhing thug pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection.üîΩAnd since the possessor of a collection is pervaded by the possessor of a collection, the possessor of

original: byed pa dran pa'am longs spyod kyang dran pa po'i ma longs spyod pa po rten med na mi 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: byed pa dran pa'am longs spyod kyang dran pa po'i ma longs spyod pa po rten med na mi 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that memory and experience do not occur without a support, that is, without a recollecting or experiencing person?üîΩFor an effect must depend on a cause.

original: 'byung ba ni 'byung bar byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /üîΩdran par byed @361a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'byung bar byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la / dran par byed @361a * //
translated: In response to this, the root verse states:

original: pa po 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pa po 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúNo one recollects or experiences.‚Äù

original: rang dang gzhan dag gi nyams su myong ba dang las dag la khyad par med pa na ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dag gi nyams su myong ba dang las dag la khyad par med pa na ma yin te /
translated: If there is no difference between one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô experiences and actions,

original: khyad par gang gis dran pa dang longs spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis dran pa dang longs spyod par 'gyur /
translated: then what is the difference between memory and experience?

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid dang cig shos nyid kyis khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid dang cig shos nyid kyis khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference is that the former is the effect and the latter is the cause.

original: gzhan nyid kyang bag chags las byung ba'i dran pa la gegs byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang bag chags las byung ba'i dran pa la gegs byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, difference does not prevent memory that arises from habitual tendencies.

original: gcig nyid yin yang de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin yang de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though the two are different, the latter does not occur without the former.üîΩTo demonstrate this, the root text states:

original: gal te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf another recollects . . .‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba gzhan nyid kyang dran pa la ltos pa'i phyir bdag la yod pa zhes gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gzhan nyid kyang dran pa la ltos pa'i phyir bdag la yod pa zhes gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: and the experience of another is also dependent on memory. Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúin the self‚Äù is a specification.

original: ji ltar rang dang gzhan dag gi nyams su myong ba nyid kyis sam gzhan nyid kyis khyad par med par dran pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar rang dang gzhan dag gi nyams su myong ba nyid kyis sam gzhan nyid kyis khyad par med par dran pa yin la /
translated: Just as memory is not differentiated as being of oneself or another,

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid dang yang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid dang yang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: so it would not be differentiated as being of the self.

original: skyes bu re re zhing bdag rnams kyi gcig pa nyid la khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu re re zhing bdag rnams kyi gcig pa nyid la khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: And each person would have the same self, without distinction.

original: nyams su myong ba po dang dran pa po'i ngo bo dag la khyad par yod pa'i phyir dran pa nges pa las nyams su myong ba por nges pa ni rnam par smra ba la gtan tshigs nges pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba po dang dran pa po'i ngo bo dag la khyad par yod pa'i phyir dran pa nges pa las nyams su myong ba por nges pa ni rnam par smra ba la gtan tshigs nges pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa yin la /
translated: Since the nature of the experiencer and the nature of the rememberer are different, it is reasonable to infer from the certainty of memory that there is a certainty of the experiencer.

original: bdag tu smra ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not reasonable to infer the self from memory.

original: rtag pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is accepted as permanent.

original: rtag pa nyid ni rgyu med pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba dang 'gal ba can gyi dbye ba med pas khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ni rgyu med pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba dang 'gal ba can gyi dbye ba med pas khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that permanence is pervaded by the absence of division, which is incompatible with division, because of the absence of a cause is:

original: yid la tha dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid la tha dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is not different.‚Äù

original: zhag snga ma la dmigs pa'i don rnams la zhag phyi ma la bdag 'di mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes mthong ba po'i dran pa po dag gi gcig pa nyid du rjes su 'brel ba ni de mthong ba med kyang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: zhag snga ma la dmigs pa'i don rnams la zhag phyi ma la bdag 'di mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes mthong ba po'i dran pa po dag gi gcig pa nyid du rjes su 'brel ba ni de mthong ba med kyang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that the self, which is the experiencer of the objects observed on the previous day, is related to the memory of the experiencer on the following day as the same, even though the seeing of those objects on the previous day does not exist, is:

original: bdag gis mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI saw it.‚Äù

original: bden te / bdag gcig yod na de ltar mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir de mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bden te / bdag gcig yod na de ltar mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir de mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Although that is true, the teaching that the self is not related to the memory of the experiencer on the following day as the same, because if the self were one, it could not be seen in that way, is:

original: skyon 'di dag la 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon 'di dag la 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese faults also.‚Äù

original: 'di la ni gcig la'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni gcig la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúone‚Äù refers to the self.

original: tshad ma skye ba ni mthong ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma skye ba ni mthong ba yod pa'o //
translated: The arising of valid knowledge is seeing.

original: bdag yod pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba med kyang de ltar shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag yod pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba med kyang de ltar shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the self exists, one knows it in that way even though it is not seen.

original: 'di yang gzhal bya rnams tshad ma'i dbang yin pa'i phyir de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang gzhal bya rnams tshad ma'i dbang yin pa'i phyir de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is also taught because the objects of knowledge are the power of the valid cognitions.

original: bdag yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrang gi rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag ni nye bar rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid du rig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag yod kyang zhes bya ba'o // rang gi rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag ni nye bar rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid du rig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the self exists‚Äù is stated.

original: snga ma'i ngo bor de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i ngo bor de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The self that is the nature of one‚Äôs own realization is not known in that way because it is the nature of one‚Äôs own realization. This is taught by ‚Äúthat very thing in the prior nature.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'brel pa kho na tshad ma yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa kho na tshad ma yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Those who say that only the connection is the valid cognition

original: dran pas @361b zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pas @361b zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are refuted by ‚Äúmemory.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation of the opponent.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The connection is not a valid cognition of direct perception

original: nye ba ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su dpag pa nyid la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro // rjes su dpag pa nyid la yang ma yin te /
translated: because it has an object that is not present.

original: rtag pas skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pas skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is also not inference because it is not produced by a permanent thing. This is taught by ‚Äúthat very thing in the prior nature.‚Äù

original: tshad ma min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not valid‚Äù means that it is not valid to posit the self as the appropriator.

original: nye ba nyams su myong bas sad pa'i thog ma med pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bag chags ni sems kyi rgyun gyi lhan cig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: nye ba nyams su myong bas sad pa'i thog ma med pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bag chags ni sems kyi rgyun gyi lhan cig byed par 'gyur /
translated: The latent impressions that are related to beginningless error, which are experienced in the present, become the cooperative conditions of the continuum of the mind.

original: de'i phyir shugs kyis bdag thob pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir shugs kyis bdag thob pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the non-establishment of the self by way of its own entity is taught by implication:

original: dran pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMemory‚Äù means that the self is not established by way of its own entity.

original: ji lta ba kho na'i log pa'i bag chags ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dag gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: ji lta ba kho na'i log pa'i bag chags ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dag gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: The latent impressions of just that error cause the experience of the past and the memory of the present to be conceived as the same.

original: de lta bu kho nar da ltar ba dag la yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar da ltar ba dag la yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In the same way, it is taught that the present is also like that:

original: de dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù means that the present is also not established by way of its own entity.

original: snang ba'i rgyun bzhin du mthong ba'i rgyun yang gcig tu 'dzin par 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: snang ba'i rgyun bzhin du mthong ba'i rgyun yang gcig tu 'dzin par 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: Just as one apprehends the continuum of an appearance as one, one also apprehends the continuum of a seeing as one.

original: de lta bu kho nar da ltar ba dag la yang yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩde dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar da ltar ba dag la yang yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩde dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, it is taught that the present is also like that:üîΩ‚ÄúThose‚Äù means that the present is also not established by way of its own entity.

original: snang ba'i rgyun bzhin du mthong ba'i rgyun yang gcig tu 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar mngon par zhen pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i rgyun bzhin du mthong ba'i rgyun yang gcig tu 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar mngon par zhen pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The result of the perception of the continuity of the object is the adherence to the self as a single entity.

original: 'bras bu gcig nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the words, ‚Äúfrom a single result.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni sna tshogs pa'i dbang po las byung ba mthong ba rnams dang / dran pa rnams kyang bag chags kyi bskyed bya'i rjes su 'brel par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sna tshogs pa'i dbang po las byung ba mthong ba rnams dang / dran pa rnams kyang bag chags kyi bskyed bya'i rjes su 'brel par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the perceptions arising from the various sense organs and the memories are related to the product of the latent impressions.

original: gal te bdag med pa yin pa de lta na rjes su 'brel pa yang brdzun pa'i bag chags kyi bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa yin pa de lta na rjes su 'brel pa yang brdzun pa'i bag chags kyi bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: If the self does not exist, then the relation is also the product of the latent impressions of error.

original: sems kyi snga ma snga ma'i sems kyi dbang gi rgyun yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi snga ma snga ma'i sems kyi dbang gi rgyun yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind is the continuum of the prior mind, as it is the result of that.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang chags pa la sogs pa rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na yod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang chags pa la sogs pa rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na yod pa yang yin no //
translated: If the self did not exist, then the grasping of self and attachment, etc. would not arise from the beginning, and so there would be no cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas bdag grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas bdag grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa na /
translated: Therefore, since cyclic existence is not tenable as something other than the self, the self is established.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that, then how?

original: bdag yod na bdag go zhes bya ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba ni chags pa 'phel par byed pas 'khor ba'i rgyun byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag yod na bdag go zhes bya ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba ni chags pa 'phel par byed pas 'khor ba'i rgyun byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If the self exists, the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù that arises from beginningless latent propensities is the cause of the continuity of cyclic existence, since it increases attachment.

original: bden pa bzhi la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by the line ‚ÄúIn the four truths.‚Äù

original: bdag go zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: bdag go zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: If the self exists, is the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù the cause of cyclic existence?

original: re zhig rgyu med pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu med pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not causeless.

original: rgyu yang yul lam bag chags kyang yul gyi bskyed bya bzhin du bag chags kyi bskyed bya yang ldog byar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩde nyid la ni zhes bstan ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang yul lam bag chags kyang yul gyi bskyed bya bzhin du bag chags kyi bskyed bya yang ldog byar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni / de nyid la ni zhes bstan ba'o //
translated: Just as the object is the cause of the latent propensities, and the latent propensities are the cause of the object, the object that is generated by the latent propensities is also the cause of the latent propensities.
This is taught by the line ‚ÄúIn that itself.‚Äù

original: nyid ni bden bzhi la ste /
analyzed: nyid ni bden bzhi la ste /
translated: That itself is the four truths.

original: de ste de rnams sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ste de rnams sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa rnams so //
translated: That is, those are the aspects of superimposition.

original: 'gal don de nyid ni yul gyi de nyid do //
analyzed: 'gal don de nyid ni yul gyi de nyid do //
translated: The object of that contradiction is the reality of the object.

original: rjes su thogs pa can ni bdag gir byed pa gang yin pa de ni yul du ma'i lhan cig byed pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su thogs pa can ni bdag gir byed pa gang yin pa de ni yul du ma'i lhan cig byed pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The subsequent is the one that appropriates, and it is taught to be powerful because it is the co-operating cause of many objects.

original: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba phyin ci ma log pa ni yul dang bral ba gang las kyang 'byung bar log par lta ba la gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba phyin ci ma log pa ni yul dang bral ba gang las kyang 'byung bar log par lta ba la gnod pa yin te /
translated: The word correct means that the unmistaken view is the antidote to the mistaken view that arises from any separation from the object.

original: dngul du mthong ba la nya phyis su mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngul du mthong ba la nya phyis su mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like seeing silver and seeing mother-of-pearl.

original: legs bsgoms ni shin tu nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: legs bsgoms ni shin tu nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Well-cultivated means very ascertained.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni rgyu 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'bras bu yang de bzhin du yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni rgyu 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'bras bu yang de bzhin du yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Superimposition is not only the cause, but the effect is also taught to be the same.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the superimposition of the incorrect.

original: rgyu'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the cause of the superimposition of the incorrect is:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni rang rig pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni rang rig pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: The incorrect is different from self-awareness.

original: mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin pa yang thar pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin pa yang thar pa ji ltar yin /
translated: How could liberation be that which is not known by direct perception?
